module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.TimeInNanos

-- | Contains a timestamp with optional nanosecond granularity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimeInNanos</a> smart constructor.
data TimeInNanos
TimeInNanos' :: Maybe Natural -> Natural -> TimeInNanos

-- | The nanosecond offset from <tt>timeInSeconds</tt>.
[$sel:offsetInNanos:TimeInNanos'] :: TimeInNanos -> Maybe Natural

-- | The timestamp date, in seconds, in the Unix epoch format. Fractional
--   nanosecond data is provided by <tt>offsetInNanos</tt>.
[$sel:timeInSeconds:TimeInNanos'] :: TimeInNanos -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>TimeInNanos</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:offsetInNanos:TimeInNanos'</a>,
--   <a>timeInNanos_offsetInNanos</a> - The nanosecond offset from
--   <tt>timeInSeconds</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeInSeconds:TimeInNanos'</a>,
--   <a>timeInNanos_timeInSeconds</a> - The timestamp date, in seconds, in
--   the Unix epoch format. Fractional nanosecond data is provided by
--   <tt>offsetInNanos</tt>.
newTimeInNanos :: Natural -> TimeInNanos

-- | The nanosecond offset from <tt>timeInSeconds</tt>.
timeInNanos_offsetInNanos :: Lens' TimeInNanos (Maybe Natural)

-- | The timestamp date, in seconds, in the Unix epoch format. Fractional
--   nanosecond data is provided by <tt>offsetInNanos</tt>.
timeInNanos_timeInSeconds :: Lens' TimeInNanos Natural
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.TimeInNanos.TimeInNanos
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.TimeInNanos.TimeInNanos
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.TimeInNanos.TimeInNanos
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.TimeInNanos.TimeInNanos
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.TimeInNanos.TimeInNanos
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.TimeInNanos.TimeInNanos
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.TimeInNanos.TimeInNanos
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.TimeInNanos.TimeInNanos


module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.BatchPutAssetPropertyError

-- | Contains error information from updating a batch of asset property
--   values.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBatchPutAssetPropertyError</a> smart constructor.
data BatchPutAssetPropertyError
BatchPutAssetPropertyError' :: BatchPutAssetPropertyValueErrorCode -> Text -> [TimeInNanos] -> BatchPutAssetPropertyError

-- | The error code.
[$sel:errorCode:BatchPutAssetPropertyError'] :: BatchPutAssetPropertyError -> BatchPutAssetPropertyValueErrorCode

-- | The associated error message.
[$sel:errorMessage:BatchPutAssetPropertyError'] :: BatchPutAssetPropertyError -> Text

-- | A list of timestamps for each error, if any.
[$sel:timestamps:BatchPutAssetPropertyError'] :: BatchPutAssetPropertyError -> [TimeInNanos]

-- | Create a value of <a>BatchPutAssetPropertyError</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCode:BatchPutAssetPropertyError'</a>,
--   <a>batchPutAssetPropertyError_errorCode</a> - The error code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorMessage:BatchPutAssetPropertyError'</a>,
--   <a>batchPutAssetPropertyError_errorMessage</a> - The associated error
--   message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamps:BatchPutAssetPropertyError'</a>,
--   <a>batchPutAssetPropertyError_timestamps</a> - A list of timestamps
--   for each error, if any.
newBatchPutAssetPropertyError :: BatchPutAssetPropertyValueErrorCode -> Text -> BatchPutAssetPropertyError

-- | The error code.
batchPutAssetPropertyError_errorCode :: Lens' BatchPutAssetPropertyError BatchPutAssetPropertyValueErrorCode

-- | The associated error message.
batchPutAssetPropertyError_errorMessage :: Lens' BatchPutAssetPropertyError Text

-- | A list of timestamps for each error, if any.
batchPutAssetPropertyError_timestamps :: Lens' BatchPutAssetPropertyError [TimeInNanos]

module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.TransformProcessingConfig

-- | The processing configuration for the given transform property. You can
--   configure transforms to be kept at the edge or forwarded to the Amazon
--   Web Services Cloud. You can also configure transforms to be computed
--   at the edge or in the cloud.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTransformProcessingConfig</a> smart constructor.
data TransformProcessingConfig
TransformProcessingConfig' :: Maybe ForwardingConfig -> ComputeLocation -> TransformProcessingConfig
[$sel:forwardingConfig:TransformProcessingConfig'] :: TransformProcessingConfig -> Maybe ForwardingConfig

-- | The compute location for the given transform property.
[$sel:computeLocation:TransformProcessingConfig'] :: TransformProcessingConfig -> ComputeLocation

-- | Create a value of <a>TransformProcessingConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:forwardingConfig:TransformProcessingConfig'</a>,
--   <a>transformProcessingConfig_forwardingConfig</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:computeLocation:TransformProcessingConfig'</a>,
--   <a>transformProcessingConfig_computeLocation</a> - The compute
--   location for the given transform property.
newTransformProcessingConfig :: ComputeLocation -> TransformProcessingConfig

-- | Undocumented member.
transformProcessingConfig_forwardingConfig :: Lens' TransformProcessingConfig (Maybe ForwardingConfig)

-- | The compute location for the given transform property.
transformProcessingConfig_computeLocation :: Lens' TransformProcessingConfig ComputeLocation

module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.TumblingWindow

-- | Contains a tumbling window, which is a repeating fixed-sized,
--   non-overlapping, and contiguous time window. You use this window in
--   metrics to aggregate data from properties and other assets.
--   
--   You can use <tt>m</tt>, <tt>h</tt>, <tt>d</tt>, and <tt>w</tt> when
--   you specify an interval or offset. Note that <tt>m</tt> represents
--   minutes, and <tt>w</tt> represents weeks. You can also use <tt>s</tt>
--   to represent seconds in <tt>offset</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>interval</tt> and <tt>offset</tt> parameters support the
--   <a>ISO 8601 format</a>. For example, <tt>PT5S</tt> represents five
--   seconds, <tt>PT5M</tt> represents five minutes, and <tt>PT5H</tt>
--   represents five hours.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTumblingWindow</a> smart constructor.
data TumblingWindow
TumblingWindow' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> TumblingWindow

-- | The offset for the tumbling window. The <tt>offset</tt> parameter
--   accepts the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The offset time.For example, if you specify <tt>18h</tt> for
--   <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise
--   aggregates data in one of the following ways:<ul><li>If you create the
--   metric before or at 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation
--   result at 6 PM (UTC) on the day when you create the metric.</li><li>If
--   you create the metric after 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first
--   aggregation result at 6 PM (UTC) the next day.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The ISO 8601 format.For example, if you specify <tt>PT18H</tt> for
--   <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise
--   aggregates data in one of the following ways:<ul><li>If you create the
--   metric before or at 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation
--   result at 6 PM (UTC) on the day when you create the metric.</li><li>If
--   you create the metric after 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first
--   aggregation result at 6 PM (UTC) the next day.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The 24-hour clock.For example, if you specify <tt>00:03:00</tt>
--   for <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>5m</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, and you
--   create the metric at 2 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation result
--   at 2:03 PM (UTC). You get the second aggregation result at 2:08 PM
--   (UTC).</li>
--   <li>The offset time zone.For example, if you specify
--   <tt>2021-07-23T18:00-08</tt> for <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for
--   <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise aggregates data in one of the
--   following ways:<ul><li>If you create the metric before or at 6:00 PM
--   (PST), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (PST) on the day
--   when you create the metric.</li><li>If you create the metric after
--   6:00 PM (PST), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (PST) the
--   next day.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:offset:TumblingWindow'] :: TumblingWindow -> Maybe Text

-- | The time interval for the tumbling window. The interval time must be
--   between 1 minute and 1 week.
--   
--   IoT SiteWise computes the <tt>1w</tt> interval the end of Sunday at
--   midnight each week (UTC), the <tt>1d</tt> interval at the end of each
--   day at midnight (UTC), the <tt>1h</tt> interval at the end of each
--   hour, and so on.
--   
--   When IoT SiteWise aggregates data points for metric computations, the
--   start of each interval is exclusive and the end of each interval is
--   inclusive. IoT SiteWise places the computed data point at the end of
--   the interval.
[$sel:interval:TumblingWindow'] :: TumblingWindow -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TumblingWindow</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:offset:TumblingWindow'</a>, <a>tumblingWindow_offset</a> - The
--   offset for the tumbling window. The <tt>offset</tt> parameter accepts
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The offset time.For example, if you specify <tt>18h</tt> for
--   <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise
--   aggregates data in one of the following ways:<ul><li>If you create the
--   metric before or at 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation
--   result at 6 PM (UTC) on the day when you create the metric.</li><li>If
--   you create the metric after 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first
--   aggregation result at 6 PM (UTC) the next day.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The ISO 8601 format.For example, if you specify <tt>PT18H</tt> for
--   <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise
--   aggregates data in one of the following ways:<ul><li>If you create the
--   metric before or at 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation
--   result at 6 PM (UTC) on the day when you create the metric.</li><li>If
--   you create the metric after 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first
--   aggregation result at 6 PM (UTC) the next day.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The 24-hour clock.For example, if you specify <tt>00:03:00</tt>
--   for <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>5m</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, and you
--   create the metric at 2 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation result
--   at 2:03 PM (UTC). You get the second aggregation result at 2:08 PM
--   (UTC).</li>
--   <li>The offset time zone.For example, if you specify
--   <tt>2021-07-23T18:00-08</tt> for <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for
--   <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise aggregates data in one of the
--   following ways:<ul><li>If you create the metric before or at 6:00 PM
--   (PST), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (PST) on the day
--   when you create the metric.</li><li>If you create the metric after
--   6:00 PM (PST), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (PST) the
--   next day.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:interval:TumblingWindow'</a>, <a>tumblingWindow_interval</a> -
--   The time interval for the tumbling window. The interval time must be
--   between 1 minute and 1 week.
--   
--   IoT SiteWise computes the <tt>1w</tt> interval the end of Sunday at
--   midnight each week (UTC), the <tt>1d</tt> interval at the end of each
--   day at midnight (UTC), the <tt>1h</tt> interval at the end of each
--   hour, and so on.
--   
--   When IoT SiteWise aggregates data points for metric computations, the
--   start of each interval is exclusive and the end of each interval is
--   inclusive. IoT SiteWise places the computed data point at the end of
--   the interval.
newTumblingWindow :: Text -> TumblingWindow

-- | The offset for the tumbling window. The <tt>offset</tt> parameter
--   accepts the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The offset time.For example, if you specify <tt>18h</tt> for
--   <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise
--   aggregates data in one of the following ways:<ul><li>If you create the
--   metric before or at 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation
--   result at 6 PM (UTC) on the day when you create the metric.</li><li>If
--   you create the metric after 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first
--   aggregation result at 6 PM (UTC) the next day.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The ISO 8601 format.For example, if you specify <tt>PT18H</tt> for
--   <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise
--   aggregates data in one of the following ways:<ul><li>If you create the
--   metric before or at 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation
--   result at 6 PM (UTC) on the day when you create the metric.</li><li>If
--   you create the metric after 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first
--   aggregation result at 6 PM (UTC) the next day.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The 24-hour clock.For example, if you specify <tt>00:03:00</tt>
--   for <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>5m</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, and you
--   create the metric at 2 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation result
--   at 2:03 PM (UTC). You get the second aggregation result at 2:08 PM
--   (UTC).</li>
--   <li>The offset time zone.For example, if you specify
--   <tt>2021-07-23T18:00-08</tt> for <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for
--   <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise aggregates data in one of the
--   following ways:<ul><li>If you create the metric before or at 6:00 PM
--   (PST), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (PST) on the day
--   when you create the metric.</li><li>If you create the metric after
--   6:00 PM (PST), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (PST) the
--   next day.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
tumblingWindow_offset :: Lens' TumblingWindow (Maybe Text)

-- | The time interval for the tumbling window. The interval time must be
--   between 1 minute and 1 week.
--   
--   IoT SiteWise computes the <tt>1w</tt> interval the end of Sunday at
--   midnight each week (UTC), the <tt>1d</tt> interval at the end of each
--   day at midnight (UTC), the <tt>1h</tt> interval at the end of each
--   hour, and so on.
--   
--   When IoT SiteWise aggregates data points for metric computations, the
--   start of each interval is exclusive and the end of each interval is
--   inclusive. IoT SiteWise places the computed data point at the end of
--   the interval.
tumblingWindow_interval :: Lens' TumblingWindow Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.TumblingWindow.TumblingWindow
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.TumblingWindow.TumblingWindow
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.TumblingWindow.TumblingWindow
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.TumblingWindow.TumblingWindow
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.TumblingWindow.TumblingWindow

--   (for example, average, sum, count, and so on).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricWindow</a> smart constructor.
data MetricWindow
MetricWindow' :: Maybe TumblingWindow -> MetricWindow

[$sel:tumbling:MetricWindow'] :: MetricWindow -> Maybe TumblingWindow

--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   tumbling time interval window.
newMetricWindow :: MetricWindow

metricWindow_tumbling :: Lens' MetricWindow (Maybe TumblingWindow)

module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Identity

-- | Contains an identity that can access an IoT SiteWise Monitor resource.
--   
--   Currently, you can't use Amazon Web Services APIs to retrieve Amazon
--   Web Services SSO identity IDs. You can find the Amazon Web Services
--   SSO identity IDs in the URL of user and group pages in the <a>Amazon
--   Web Services SSO console</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIdentity</a> smart constructor.
data Identity
Identity' :: Maybe IAMUserIdentity -> Maybe GroupIdentity -> Maybe UserIdentity -> Maybe IAMRoleIdentity -> Identity

-- | An IAM user identity.
[$sel:iamUser:Identity'] :: Identity -> Maybe IAMUserIdentity

-- | An Amazon Web Services SSO group identity.
[$sel:group':Identity'] :: Identity -> Maybe GroupIdentity

-- | An Amazon Web Services SSO user identity.
[$sel:user:Identity'] :: Identity -> Maybe UserIdentity

-- | An IAM role identity.
[$sel:iamRole:Identity'] :: Identity -> Maybe IAMRoleIdentity

-- | Create a value of <a>Identity</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamUser:Identity'</a>, <a>identity_iamUser</a> - An IAM user
--   identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:group':Identity'</a>, <a>identity_group</a> - An Amazon Web
--   Services SSO group identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:user:Identity'</a>, <a>identity_user</a> - An Amazon Web
--   Services SSO user identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRole:Identity'</a>, <a>identity_iamRole</a> - An IAM role
--   identity.
newIdentity :: Identity

-- | An IAM user identity.
identity_iamUser :: Lens' Identity (Maybe IAMUserIdentity)

-- | An Amazon Web Services SSO group identity.
identity_group :: Lens' Identity (Maybe GroupIdentity)

-- | An Amazon Web Services SSO user identity.
identity_user :: Lens' Identity (Maybe UserIdentity)

-- | An IAM role identity.
identity_iamRole :: Lens' Identity (Maybe IAMRoleIdentity)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Identity.Identity
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Identity.Identity
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Identity.Identity
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Identity.Identity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Identity.Identity
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Identity.Identity
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Identity.Identity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Identity.Identity


module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AccessPolicySummary

-- | Contains an access policy that defines an identity's access to an IoT
--   SiteWise Monitor resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessPolicySummary</a> smart constructor.
data AccessPolicySummary
AccessPolicySummary' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Text -> Identity -> Resource -> Permission -> AccessPolicySummary

-- | The date the access policy was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
[$sel:lastUpdateDate:AccessPolicySummary'] :: AccessPolicySummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date the access policy was created, in Unix epoch time.
[$sel:creationDate:AccessPolicySummary'] :: AccessPolicySummary -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ID of the access policy.
[$sel:id:AccessPolicySummary'] :: AccessPolicySummary -> Text

-- | The identity (an Amazon Web Services SSO user, an Amazon Web Services
--   SSO group, or an IAM user).
[$sel:identity:AccessPolicySummary'] :: AccessPolicySummary -> Identity

-- | The IoT SiteWise Monitor resource (a portal or project).
[$sel:resource:AccessPolicySummary'] :: AccessPolicySummary -> Resource

-- | The permissions for the access policy. Note that a project
--   <tt>ADMINISTRATOR</tt> is also known as a project owner.
[$sel:permission:AccessPolicySummary'] :: AccessPolicySummary -> Permission

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessPolicySummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdateDate:AccessPolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>accessPolicySummary_lastUpdateDate</a> - The date the access policy
--   was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:AccessPolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>accessPolicySummary_creationDate</a> - The date the access policy
--   was created, in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:AccessPolicySummary'</a>, <a>accessPolicySummary_id</a> -
--   The ID of the access policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identity:AccessPolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>accessPolicySummary_identity</a> - The identity (an Amazon Web
--   Services SSO user, an Amazon Web Services SSO group, or an IAM user).
--   
--   <a>$sel:resource:AccessPolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>accessPolicySummary_resource</a> - The IoT SiteWise Monitor
--   resource (a portal or project).
--   
--   <a>$sel:permission:AccessPolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>accessPolicySummary_permission</a> - The permissions for the access
--   policy. Note that a project <tt>ADMINISTRATOR</tt> is also known as a
--   project owner.
newAccessPolicySummary :: Text -> Identity -> Resource -> Permission -> AccessPolicySummary

-- | The date the access policy was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
accessPolicySummary_lastUpdateDate :: Lens' AccessPolicySummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date the access policy was created, in Unix epoch time.
accessPolicySummary_creationDate :: Lens' AccessPolicySummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ID of the access policy.
accessPolicySummary_id :: Lens' AccessPolicySummary Text

-- | The identity (an Amazon Web Services SSO user, an Amazon Web Services
--   SSO group, or an IAM user).
accessPolicySummary_identity :: Lens' AccessPolicySummary Identity

-- | The IoT SiteWise Monitor resource (a portal or project).
accessPolicySummary_resource :: Lens' AccessPolicySummary Resource

-- | The permissions for the access policy. Note that a project
--   <tt>ADMINISTRATOR</tt> is also known as a project owner.
accessPolicySummary_permission :: Lens' AccessPolicySummary Permission
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AccessPolicySummary.AccessPolicySummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AccessPolicySummary.AccessPolicySummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AccessPolicySummary.AccessPolicySummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AccessPolicySummary.AccessPolicySummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AccessPolicySummary.AccessPolicySummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AccessPolicySummary.AccessPolicySummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AccessPolicySummary.AccessPolicySummary


module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.VariableValue

-- | Identifies a property value used in an expression.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVariableValue</a> smart constructor.
data VariableValue
VariableValue' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> VariableValue

-- | The ID of the hierarchy to query for the property ID. You can use the
--   hierarchy's name instead of the hierarchy's ID.
--   
--   You use a hierarchy ID instead of a model ID because you can have
--   several hierarchies using the same model and therefore the same
--   <tt>propertyId</tt>. For example, you might have separately grouped
--   assets that come from the same asset model. For more information, see
--   <a>Asset hierarchies</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:hierarchyId:VariableValue'] :: VariableValue -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the property to use as the variable. You can use the
--   property <tt>name</tt> if it's from the same asset model.
[$sel:propertyId:VariableValue'] :: VariableValue -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>VariableValue</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:hierarchyId:VariableValue'</a>,
--   <a>variableValue_hierarchyId</a> - The ID of the hierarchy to query
--   for the property ID. You can use the hierarchy's name instead of the
--   hierarchy's ID.
--   
--   You use a hierarchy ID instead of a model ID because you can have
--   several hierarchies using the same model and therefore the same
--   <tt>propertyId</tt>. For example, you might have separately grouped
--   assets that come from the same asset model. For more information, see
--   <a>Asset hierarchies</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyId:VariableValue'</a>, <a>variableValue_propertyId</a>
--   - The ID of the property to use as the variable. You can use the
--   property <tt>name</tt> if it's from the same asset model.
newVariableValue :: Text -> VariableValue

-- | The ID of the hierarchy to query for the property ID. You can use the
--   hierarchy's name instead of the hierarchy's ID.
--   
--   You use a hierarchy ID instead of a model ID because you can have
--   several hierarchies using the same model and therefore the same
--   <tt>propertyId</tt>. For example, you might have separately grouped
--   assets that come from the same asset model. For more information, see
--   <a>Asset hierarchies</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
variableValue_hierarchyId :: Lens' VariableValue (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the property to use as the variable. You can use the
--   property <tt>name</tt> if it's from the same asset model.
variableValue_propertyId :: Lens' VariableValue Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.VariableValue.VariableValue
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.VariableValue.VariableValue
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.VariableValue.VariableValue
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.VariableValue.VariableValue
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.VariableValue.VariableValue
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.VariableValue.VariableValue
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.VariableValue.VariableValue
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.VariableValue.VariableValue


module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.ExpressionVariable

-- | Contains expression variable information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExpressionVariable</a> smart constructor.
data ExpressionVariable
ExpressionVariable' :: Text -> VariableValue -> ExpressionVariable

-- | The friendly name of the variable to be used in the expression.
[$sel:name:ExpressionVariable'] :: ExpressionVariable -> Text

-- | The variable that identifies an asset property from which to use
--   values.
[$sel:value:ExpressionVariable'] :: ExpressionVariable -> VariableValue

-- | Create a value of <a>ExpressionVariable</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ExpressionVariable'</a>, <a>expressionVariable_name</a> -
--   The friendly name of the variable to be used in the expression.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:ExpressionVariable'</a>, <a>expressionVariable_value</a>
--   - The variable that identifies an asset property from which to use
--   values.
newExpressionVariable :: Text -> VariableValue -> ExpressionVariable

-- | The friendly name of the variable to be used in the expression.
expressionVariable_name :: Lens' ExpressionVariable Text

-- | The variable that identifies an asset property from which to use
--   values.
expressionVariable_value :: Lens' ExpressionVariable VariableValue
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.ExpressionVariable.ExpressionVariable
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.ExpressionVariable.ExpressionVariable
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.ExpressionVariable.ExpressionVariable
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.ExpressionVariable.ExpressionVariable
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.ExpressionVariable.ExpressionVariable
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.ExpressionVariable.ExpressionVariable
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.ExpressionVariable.ExpressionVariable
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.ExpressionVariable.ExpressionVariable


module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Transform

-- | Contains an asset transform property. A transform is a one-to-one
--   mapping of a property's data points from one form to another. For
--   example, you can use a transform to convert a Celsius data stream to
--   Fahrenheit by applying the transformation expression to each data
--   point of the Celsius stream. A transform can only have a data type of
--   <tt>DOUBLE</tt> and consume properties with data types of
--   <tt>INTEGER</tt> or <tt>DOUBLE</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Transforms</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise
--   User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTransform</a> smart constructor.
data Transform
Transform' :: Maybe TransformProcessingConfig -> Text -> [ExpressionVariable] -> Transform

-- | The processing configuration for the given transform property. You can
--   configure transforms to be kept at the edge or forwarded to the Amazon
--   Web Services Cloud. You can also configure transforms to be computed
--   at the edge or in the cloud.
[$sel:processingConfig:Transform'] :: Transform -> Maybe TransformProcessingConfig

-- | The mathematical expression that defines the transformation function.
--   You can specify up to 10 variables per expression. You can specify up
--   to 10 functions per expression.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:expression:Transform'] :: Transform -> Text

-- | The list of variables used in the expression.
[$sel:variables:Transform'] :: Transform -> [ExpressionVariable]

-- | Create a value of <a>Transform</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfig:Transform'</a>,
--   <a>transform_processingConfig</a> - The processing configuration for
--   the given transform property. You can configure transforms to be kept
--   at the edge or forwarded to the Amazon Web Services Cloud. You can
--   also configure transforms to be computed at the edge or in the cloud.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expression:Transform'</a>, <a>transform_expression</a> - The
--   mathematical expression that defines the transformation function. You
--   can specify up to 10 variables per expression. You can specify up to
--   10 functions per expression.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:variables:Transform'</a>, <a>transform_variables</a> - The
--   list of variables used in the expression.
newTransform :: Text -> Transform

-- | The processing configuration for the given transform property. You can
--   configure transforms to be kept at the edge or forwarded to the Amazon
--   Web Services Cloud. You can also configure transforms to be computed
--   at the edge or in the cloud.
transform_processingConfig :: Lens' Transform (Maybe TransformProcessingConfig)

-- | The mathematical expression that defines the transformation function.
--   You can specify up to 10 variables per expression. You can specify up
--   to 10 functions per expression.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
transform_expression :: Lens' Transform Text

-- | The list of variables used in the expression.
transform_variables :: Lens' Transform [ExpressionVariable]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Transform.Transform
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Transform.Transform
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Transform.Transform
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Transform.Transform
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Transform.Transform
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Transform.Transform
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Transform.Transform
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Transform.Transform


module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Metric

-- | Contains an asset metric property. With metrics, you can calculate
--   aggregate functions, such as an average, maximum, or minimum, as
--   specified through an expression. A metric maps several values to a
--   single value (such as a sum).
--   
--   The maximum number of dependent/cascading variables used in any one
--   metric calculation is 10. Therefore, a <i>root</i> metric can have up
--   to 10 cascading metrics in its computational dependency tree.
--   Additionally, a metric can only have a data type of <tt>DOUBLE</tt>
--   and consume properties with data types of <tt>INTEGER</tt> or
--   <tt>DOUBLE</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Metrics</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetric</a> smart constructor.
data Metric
Metric' :: Maybe MetricProcessingConfig -> Text -> [ExpressionVariable] -> MetricWindow -> Metric

-- | The processing configuration for the given metric property. You can
--   configure metrics to be computed at the edge or in the Amazon Web
--   Services Cloud. By default, metrics are forwarded to the cloud.
[$sel:processingConfig:Metric'] :: Metric -> Maybe MetricProcessingConfig

-- | The mathematical expression that defines the metric aggregation
--   function. You can specify up to 10 variables per expression. You can
--   specify up to 10 functions per expression.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:expression:Metric'] :: Metric -> Text

-- | The list of variables used in the expression.
[$sel:variables:Metric'] :: Metric -> [ExpressionVariable]

-- | The window (time interval) over which IoT SiteWise computes the
--   metric's aggregation expression. IoT SiteWise computes one data point
--   per <tt>window</tt>.
[$sel:window:Metric'] :: Metric -> MetricWindow

-- | Create a value of <a>Metric</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfig:Metric'</a>, <a>metric_processingConfig</a> -
--   The processing configuration for the given metric property. You can
--   configure metrics to be computed at the edge or in the Amazon Web
--   Services Cloud. By default, metrics are forwarded to the cloud.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expression:Metric'</a>, <a>metric_expression</a> - The
--   mathematical expression that defines the metric aggregation function.
--   You can specify up to 10 variables per expression. You can specify up
--   to 10 functions per expression.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:variables:Metric'</a>, <a>metric_variables</a> - The list of
--   variables used in the expression.
--   
--   <a>$sel:window:Metric'</a>, <a>metric_window</a> - The window (time
--   interval) over which IoT SiteWise computes the metric's aggregation
--   expression. IoT SiteWise computes one data point per <tt>window</tt>.
newMetric :: Text -> MetricWindow -> Metric

-- | The processing configuration for the given metric property. You can
--   configure metrics to be computed at the edge or in the Amazon Web
--   Services Cloud. By default, metrics are forwarded to the cloud.
metric_processingConfig :: Lens' Metric (Maybe MetricProcessingConfig)

-- | The mathematical expression that defines the metric aggregation
--   function. You can specify up to 10 variables per expression. You can
--   specify up to 10 functions per expression.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
metric_expression :: Lens' Metric Text

-- | The list of variables used in the expression.
metric_variables :: Lens' Metric [ExpressionVariable]

-- | The window (time interval) over which IoT SiteWise computes the
--   metric's aggregation expression. IoT SiteWise computes one data point
--   per <tt>window</tt>.
metric_window :: Lens' Metric MetricWindow
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Metric.Metric
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Metric.Metric
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Metric.Metric
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Metric.Metric
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Metric.Metric
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Metric.Metric
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Metric.Metric
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Metric.Metric


module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.PropertyType

-- | Contains a property type, which can be one of <tt>attribute</tt>,
--   <tt>measurement</tt>, <tt>metric</tt>, or <tt>transform</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPropertyType</a> smart constructor.
data PropertyType
PropertyType' :: Maybe Attribute -> Maybe Transform -> Maybe Metric -> Maybe Measurement -> PropertyType

-- | Specifies an asset attribute property. An attribute generally contains
--   static information, such as the serial number of an <a>IIoT</a> wind
--   turbine.
[$sel:attribute:PropertyType'] :: PropertyType -> Maybe Attribute

-- | Specifies an asset transform property. A transform contains a
--   mathematical expression that maps a property's data points from one
--   form to another, such as a unit conversion from Celsius to Fahrenheit.
[$sel:transform:PropertyType'] :: PropertyType -> Maybe Transform

-- | Specifies an asset metric property. A metric contains a mathematical
--   expression that uses aggregate functions to process all input data
--   points over a time interval and output a single data point, such as to
--   calculate the average hourly temperature.
[$sel:metric:PropertyType'] :: PropertyType -> Maybe Metric

-- | Specifies an asset measurement property. A measurement represents a
--   device's raw sensor data stream, such as timestamped temperature
--   values or timestamped power values.
[$sel:measurement:PropertyType'] :: PropertyType -> Maybe Measurement

-- | Create a value of <a>PropertyType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attribute:PropertyType'</a>, <a>propertyType_attribute</a> -
--   Specifies an asset attribute property. An attribute generally contains
--   static information, such as the serial number of an <a>IIoT</a> wind
--   turbine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transform:PropertyType'</a>, <a>propertyType_transform</a> -
--   Specifies an asset transform property. A transform contains a
--   mathematical expression that maps a property's data points from one
--   form to another, such as a unit conversion from Celsius to Fahrenheit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metric:PropertyType'</a>, <a>propertyType_metric</a> -
--   Specifies an asset metric property. A metric contains a mathematical
--   expression that uses aggregate functions to process all input data
--   points over a time interval and output a single data point, such as to
--   calculate the average hourly temperature.
--   
--   <a>$sel:measurement:PropertyType'</a>, <a>propertyType_measurement</a>
--   - Specifies an asset measurement property. A measurement represents a
--   device's raw sensor data stream, such as timestamped temperature
--   values or timestamped power values.
newPropertyType :: PropertyType

-- | Specifies an asset attribute property. An attribute generally contains
--   static information, such as the serial number of an <a>IIoT</a> wind
--   turbine.
propertyType_attribute :: Lens' PropertyType (Maybe Attribute)

-- | Specifies an asset transform property. A transform contains a
--   mathematical expression that maps a property's data points from one
--   form to another, such as a unit conversion from Celsius to Fahrenheit.
propertyType_transform :: Lens' PropertyType (Maybe Transform)

-- | Specifies an asset metric property. A metric contains a mathematical
--   expression that uses aggregate functions to process all input data
--   points over a time interval and output a single data point, such as to
--   calculate the average hourly temperature.
propertyType_metric :: Lens' PropertyType (Maybe Metric)

-- | Specifies an asset measurement property. A measurement represents a
--   device's raw sensor data stream, such as timestamped temperature
--   values or timestamped power values.
propertyType_measurement :: Lens' PropertyType (Maybe Measurement)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.PropertyType.PropertyType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.PropertyType.PropertyType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.PropertyType.PropertyType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.PropertyType.PropertyType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.PropertyType.PropertyType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.PropertyType.PropertyType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.PropertyType.PropertyType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.PropertyType.PropertyType


module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Property

-- | Contains asset property information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProperty</a> smart constructor.
data Property
Property' :: Maybe PropertyNotification -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PropertyType -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> PropertyDataType -> Property

-- | The asset property's notification topic and state. For more
--   information, see <a>UpdateAssetProperty</a>.
[$sel:notification:Property'] :: Property -> Maybe PropertyNotification

-- | The alias that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data
--   stream path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:alias:Property'] :: Property -> Maybe Text

-- | The property type (see <tt>PropertyType</tt>). A property contains one
--   type.
[$sel:type':Property'] :: Property -> Maybe PropertyType

-- | The unit (such as <tt>Newtons</tt> or <tt>RPM</tt>) of the asset
--   property.
[$sel:unit:Property'] :: Property -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the asset property.
[$sel:id:Property'] :: Property -> Text

-- | The name of the property.
[$sel:name:Property'] :: Property -> Text

-- | The property data type.
[$sel:dataType:Property'] :: Property -> PropertyDataType

-- | Create a value of <a>Property</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:notification:Property'</a>, <a>property_notification</a> - The
--   asset property's notification topic and state. For more information,
--   see <a>UpdateAssetProperty</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alias:Property'</a>, <a>property_alias</a> - The alias that
--   identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data stream path
--   (for example, <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For
--   more information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Property'</a>, <a>property_type</a> - The property type
--   (see <tt>PropertyType</tt>). A property contains one type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:Property'</a>, <a>property_unit</a> - The unit (such as
--   <tt>Newtons</tt> or <tt>RPM</tt>) of the asset property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Property'</a>, <a>property_id</a> - The ID of the asset
--   property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Property'</a>, <a>property_name</a> - The name of the
--   property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataType:Property'</a>, <a>property_dataType</a> - The
--   property data type.
newProperty :: Text -> Text -> PropertyDataType -> Property

-- | The asset property's notification topic and state. For more
--   information, see <a>UpdateAssetProperty</a>.
property_notification :: Lens' Property (Maybe PropertyNotification)

-- | The alias that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data
--   stream path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
property_alias :: Lens' Property (Maybe Text)

-- | The property type (see <tt>PropertyType</tt>). A property contains one
--   type.
property_type :: Lens' Property (Maybe PropertyType)

-- | The unit (such as <tt>Newtons</tt> or <tt>RPM</tt>) of the asset
--   property.
property_unit :: Lens' Property (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the asset property.
property_id :: Lens' Property Text

-- | The name of the property.
property_name :: Lens' Property Text

-- | The property data type.
property_dataType :: Lens' Property PropertyDataType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Property.Property
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Property.Property
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Property.Property
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Property.Property
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Property.Property
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Property.Property
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Property.Property


module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.CompositeModelProperty

-- | Contains information about a composite model property on an asset.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCompositeModelProperty</a> smart constructor.
data CompositeModelProperty
CompositeModelProperty' :: Text -> Text -> Property -> CompositeModelProperty

-- | The name of the property.
[$sel:name:CompositeModelProperty'] :: CompositeModelProperty -> Text

-- | The type of the composite model that defines this property.
[$sel:type':CompositeModelProperty'] :: CompositeModelProperty -> Text
[$sel:assetProperty:CompositeModelProperty'] :: CompositeModelProperty -> Property

-- | Create a value of <a>CompositeModelProperty</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CompositeModelProperty'</a>,
--   <a>compositeModelProperty_name</a> - The name of the property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':CompositeModelProperty'</a>,
--   <a>compositeModelProperty_type</a> - The type of the composite model
--   that defines this property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetProperty:CompositeModelProperty'</a>,
--   <a>compositeModelProperty_assetProperty</a> - Undocumented member.
newCompositeModelProperty :: Text -> Text -> Property -> CompositeModelProperty

-- | The name of the property.
compositeModelProperty_name :: Lens' CompositeModelProperty Text

-- | The type of the composite model that defines this property.
compositeModelProperty_type :: Lens' CompositeModelProperty Text

-- | Undocumented member.
compositeModelProperty_assetProperty :: Lens' CompositeModelProperty Property
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.CompositeModelProperty.CompositeModelProperty
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.CompositeModelProperty.CompositeModelProperty
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.CompositeModelProperty.CompositeModelProperty
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.CompositeModelProperty.CompositeModelProperty
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.CompositeModelProperty.CompositeModelProperty
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.CompositeModelProperty.CompositeModelProperty
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.CompositeModelProperty.CompositeModelProperty


module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelPropertyDefinition

-- | Contains an asset model property definition. This property definition
--   is applied to all assets created from the asset model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetModelPropertyDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data AssetModelPropertyDefinition
AssetModelPropertyDefinition' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> PropertyDataType -> PropertyType -> AssetModelPropertyDefinition

-- | The data type of the structure for this property. This parameter is
--   required on properties that have the <tt>STRUCT</tt> data type.
--   
--   The options for this parameter depend on the type of the composite
--   model in which you define this property. Use <tt>AWS/ALARM_STATE</tt>
--   for alarm state in alarm composite models.
[$sel:dataTypeSpec:AssetModelPropertyDefinition'] :: AssetModelPropertyDefinition -> Maybe Text

-- | The unit of the property definition, such as <tt>Newtons</tt> or
--   <tt>RPM</tt>.
[$sel:unit:AssetModelPropertyDefinition'] :: AssetModelPropertyDefinition -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the property definition.
[$sel:name:AssetModelPropertyDefinition'] :: AssetModelPropertyDefinition -> Text

-- | The data type of the property definition.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>STRUCT</tt>, you must also specify
--   <tt>dataTypeSpec</tt> to identify the type of the structure for this
--   property.
[$sel:dataType:AssetModelPropertyDefinition'] :: AssetModelPropertyDefinition -> PropertyDataType

-- | The property definition type (see <tt>PropertyType</tt>). You can only
--   specify one type in a property definition.
[$sel:type':AssetModelPropertyDefinition'] :: AssetModelPropertyDefinition -> PropertyType

-- | Create a value of <a>AssetModelPropertyDefinition</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataTypeSpec:AssetModelPropertyDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelPropertyDefinition_dataTypeSpec</a> - The data type of
--   the structure for this property. This parameter is required on
--   properties that have the <tt>STRUCT</tt> data type.
--   
--   The options for this parameter depend on the type of the composite
--   model in which you define this property. Use <tt>AWS/ALARM_STATE</tt>
--   for alarm state in alarm composite models.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:AssetModelPropertyDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelPropertyDefinition_unit</a> - The unit of the property
--   definition, such as <tt>Newtons</tt> or <tt>RPM</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AssetModelPropertyDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelPropertyDefinition_name</a> - The name of the property
--   definition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataType:AssetModelPropertyDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelPropertyDefinition_dataType</a> - The data type of the
--   property definition.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>STRUCT</tt>, you must also specify
--   <tt>dataTypeSpec</tt> to identify the type of the structure for this
--   property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':AssetModelPropertyDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelPropertyDefinition_type</a> - The property definition
--   type (see <tt>PropertyType</tt>). You can only specify one type in a
--   property definition.
newAssetModelPropertyDefinition :: Text -> PropertyDataType -> PropertyType -> AssetModelPropertyDefinition

-- | The data type of the structure for this property. This parameter is
--   required on properties that have the <tt>STRUCT</tt> data type.
--   
--   The options for this parameter depend on the type of the composite
--   model in which you define this property. Use <tt>AWS/ALARM_STATE</tt>
--   for alarm state in alarm composite models.
assetModelPropertyDefinition_dataTypeSpec :: Lens' AssetModelPropertyDefinition (Maybe Text)

-- | The unit of the property definition, such as <tt>Newtons</tt> or
--   <tt>RPM</tt>.
assetModelPropertyDefinition_unit :: Lens' AssetModelPropertyDefinition (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the property definition.
assetModelPropertyDefinition_name :: Lens' AssetModelPropertyDefinition Text

-- | The data type of the property definition.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>STRUCT</tt>, you must also specify
--   <tt>dataTypeSpec</tt> to identify the type of the structure for this
--   property.
assetModelPropertyDefinition_dataType :: Lens' AssetModelPropertyDefinition PropertyDataType

-- | The property definition type (see <tt>PropertyType</tt>). You can only
--   specify one type in a property definition.
assetModelPropertyDefinition_type :: Lens' AssetModelPropertyDefinition PropertyType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelPropertyDefinition.AssetModelPropertyDefinition
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelPropertyDefinition.AssetModelPropertyDefinition
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelPropertyDefinition.AssetModelPropertyDefinition
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelPropertyDefinition.AssetModelPropertyDefinition
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelPropertyDefinition.AssetModelPropertyDefinition
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelPropertyDefinition.AssetModelPropertyDefinition
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelPropertyDefinition.AssetModelPropertyDefinition


module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition

-- | Contains a composite model definition in an asset model. This
--   composite model definition is applied to all assets created from the
--   asset model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetModelCompositeModelDefinition</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition
AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [AssetModelPropertyDefinition] -> Text -> Text -> AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition

-- | The description of the composite model.
[$sel:description:AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition'] :: AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition -> Maybe Text

-- | The asset property definitions for this composite model.
[$sel:properties:AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition'] :: AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition -> Maybe [AssetModelPropertyDefinition]

-- | The name of the composite model.
[$sel:name:AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition'] :: AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition -> Text

-- | The type of the composite model. For alarm composite models, this type
--   is <tt>AWS/ALARM</tt>.
[$sel:type':AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition'] :: AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelCompositeModelDefinition_description</a> - The
--   description of the composite model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:properties:AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelCompositeModelDefinition_properties</a> - The asset
--   property definitions for this composite model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelCompositeModelDefinition_name</a> - The name of the
--   composite model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelCompositeModelDefinition_type</a> - The type of the
--   composite model. For alarm composite models, this type is
--   <tt>AWS/ALARM</tt>.
newAssetModelCompositeModelDefinition :: Text -> Text -> AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition

-- | The description of the composite model.
assetModelCompositeModelDefinition_description :: Lens' AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition (Maybe Text)

-- | The asset property definitions for this composite model.
assetModelCompositeModelDefinition_properties :: Lens' AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition (Maybe [AssetModelPropertyDefinition])

-- | The name of the composite model.
assetModelCompositeModelDefinition_name :: Lens' AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition Text

-- | The type of the composite model. For alarm composite models, this type
--   is <tt>AWS/ALARM</tt>.
assetModelCompositeModelDefinition_type :: Lens' AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition.AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition.AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition.AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition.AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition.AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition.AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition.AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition


module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelProperty

-- | Contains information about an asset model property.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetModelProperty</a> smart constructor.
data AssetModelProperty
AssetModelProperty' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> PropertyDataType -> PropertyType -> AssetModelProperty

-- | The data type of the structure for this property. This parameter
--   exists on properties that have the <tt>STRUCT</tt> data type.
[$sel:dataTypeSpec:AssetModelProperty'] :: AssetModelProperty -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the asset model property.
[$sel:id:AssetModelProperty'] :: AssetModelProperty -> Maybe Text

-- | The unit of the asset model property, such as <tt>Newtons</tt> or
--   <tt>RPM</tt>.
[$sel:unit:AssetModelProperty'] :: AssetModelProperty -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the asset model property.
[$sel:name:AssetModelProperty'] :: AssetModelProperty -> Text

-- | The data type of the asset model property.
[$sel:dataType:AssetModelProperty'] :: AssetModelProperty -> PropertyDataType

-- | The property type (see <tt>PropertyType</tt>).
[$sel:type':AssetModelProperty'] :: AssetModelProperty -> PropertyType

-- | Create a value of <a>AssetModelProperty</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataTypeSpec:AssetModelProperty'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelProperty_dataTypeSpec</a> - The data type of the
--   structure for this property. This parameter exists on properties that
--   have the <tt>STRUCT</tt> data type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:AssetModelProperty'</a>, <a>assetModelProperty_id</a> - The
--   ID of the asset model property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:AssetModelProperty'</a>, <a>assetModelProperty_unit</a> -
--   The unit of the asset model property, such as <tt>Newtons</tt> or
--   <tt>RPM</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AssetModelProperty'</a>, <a>assetModelProperty_name</a> -
--   The name of the asset model property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataType:AssetModelProperty'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelProperty_dataType</a> - The data type of the asset model
--   property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':AssetModelProperty'</a>, <a>assetModelProperty_type</a>
--   - The property type (see <tt>PropertyType</tt>).
newAssetModelProperty :: Text -> PropertyDataType -> PropertyType -> AssetModelProperty

-- | The data type of the structure for this property. This parameter
--   exists on properties that have the <tt>STRUCT</tt> data type.
assetModelProperty_dataTypeSpec :: Lens' AssetModelProperty (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the asset model property.
assetModelProperty_id :: Lens' AssetModelProperty (Maybe Text)

-- | The unit of the asset model property, such as <tt>Newtons</tt> or
--   <tt>RPM</tt>.
assetModelProperty_unit :: Lens' AssetModelProperty (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the asset model property.
assetModelProperty_name :: Lens' AssetModelProperty Text

-- | The data type of the asset model property.
assetModelProperty_dataType :: Lens' AssetModelProperty PropertyDataType

-- | The property type (see <tt>PropertyType</tt>).
assetModelProperty_type :: Lens' AssetModelProperty PropertyType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelProperty.AssetModelProperty
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelProperty.AssetModelProperty
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelProperty.AssetModelProperty
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelProperty.AssetModelProperty
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelProperty.AssetModelProperty
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelProperty.AssetModelProperty
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelProperty.AssetModelProperty

module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelCompositeModel

-- | Contains information about a composite model in an asset model. This
--   object contains the asset property definitions that you define in the
--   composite model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetModelCompositeModel</a> smart constructor.
data AssetModelCompositeModel
AssetModelCompositeModel' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [AssetModelProperty] -> Text -> Text -> AssetModelCompositeModel

-- | The description of the composite model.
[$sel:description:AssetModelCompositeModel'] :: AssetModelCompositeModel -> Maybe Text

-- | The asset property definitions for this composite model.
[$sel:properties:AssetModelCompositeModel'] :: AssetModelCompositeModel -> Maybe [AssetModelProperty]

-- | The name of the composite model.
[$sel:name:AssetModelCompositeModel'] :: AssetModelCompositeModel -> Text

-- | The type of the composite model. For alarm composite models, this type
--   is <tt>AWS/ALARM</tt>.
[$sel:type':AssetModelCompositeModel'] :: AssetModelCompositeModel -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AssetModelCompositeModel</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:AssetModelCompositeModel'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelCompositeModel_description</a> - The description of the
--   composite model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:properties:AssetModelCompositeModel'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelCompositeModel_properties</a> - The asset property
--   definitions for this composite model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AssetModelCompositeModel'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelCompositeModel_name</a> - The name of the composite
--   model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':AssetModelCompositeModel'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelCompositeModel_type</a> - The type of the composite
--   model. For alarm composite models, this type is <tt>AWS/ALARM</tt>.
newAssetModelCompositeModel :: Text -> Text -> AssetModelCompositeModel

-- | The description of the composite model.
assetModelCompositeModel_description :: Lens' AssetModelCompositeModel (Maybe Text)

-- | The asset property definitions for this composite model.
assetModelCompositeModel_properties :: Lens' AssetModelCompositeModel (Maybe [AssetModelProperty])

-- | The name of the composite model.
assetModelCompositeModel_name :: Lens' AssetModelCompositeModel Text

-- | The type of the composite model. For alarm composite models, this type
--   is <tt>AWS/ALARM</tt>.
assetModelCompositeModel_type :: Lens' AssetModelCompositeModel Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelCompositeModel.AssetModelCompositeModel
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelCompositeModel.AssetModelCompositeModel
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelCompositeModel.AssetModelCompositeModel
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelCompositeModel.AssetModelCompositeModel
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelCompositeModel.AssetModelCompositeModel
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelCompositeModel.AssetModelCompositeModel
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelCompositeModel.AssetModelCompositeModel
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetModelCompositeModel.AssetModelCompositeModel


module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Variant

-- | Contains an asset property value (of a single type only).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVariant</a> smart constructor.
data Variant
Variant' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Variant

-- | Asset property data of type integer (whole number).
[$sel:integerValue:Variant'] :: Variant -> Maybe Int

-- | Asset property data of type double (floating point number).
[$sel:doubleValue:Variant'] :: Variant -> Maybe Double

-- | Asset property data of type string (sequence of characters).
[$sel:stringValue:Variant'] :: Variant -> Maybe Text

-- | Asset property data of type Boolean (true or false).
[$sel:booleanValue:Variant'] :: Variant -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>Variant</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:integerValue:Variant'</a>, <a>variant_integerValue</a> - Asset
--   property data of type integer (whole number).
--   
--   <a>$sel:doubleValue:Variant'</a>, <a>variant_doubleValue</a> - Asset
--   property data of type double (floating point number).
--   
--   <a>$sel:stringValue:Variant'</a>, <a>variant_stringValue</a> - Asset
--   property data of type string (sequence of characters).
--   
--   <a>$sel:booleanValue:Variant'</a>, <a>variant_booleanValue</a> - Asset
--   property data of type Boolean (true or false).
newVariant :: Variant

-- | Asset property data of type integer (whole number).
variant_integerValue :: Lens' Variant (Maybe Int)

-- | Asset property data of type double (floating point number).
variant_doubleValue :: Lens' Variant (Maybe Double)

-- | Asset property data of type string (sequence of characters).
variant_stringValue :: Lens' Variant (Maybe Text)

-- | Asset property data of type Boolean (true or false).
variant_booleanValue :: Lens' Variant (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Variant.Variant
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Variant.Variant
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Variant.Variant
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Variant.Variant
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Variant.Variant
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Variant.Variant
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Variant.Variant
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.Variant.Variant

module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.AssetPropertyValue

-- | Contains asset property value information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetPropertyValue</a> smart constructor.

--   value.

--   - The value of the asset property (see <tt>Variant</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:AssetPropertyValue'</a>,
--   <a>assetPropertyValue_timestamp</a> - The timestamp of the asset
--   property value.
newAssetPropertyValue :: Variant -> TimeInNanos -> AssetPropertyValue

module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.PutAssetPropertyValueEntry

-- | Contains a list of value updates for an asset property in the list of
--   asset entries consumed by the <a>BatchPutAssetPropertyValue</a> API
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutAssetPropertyValueEntry</a> smart constructor.
data PutAssetPropertyValueEntry
PutAssetPropertyValueEntry' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> [AssetPropertyValue] -> PutAssetPropertyValueEntry

-- | The alias that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data
--   stream path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:propertyAlias:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the asset property for this entry.
[$sel:propertyId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the asset to update.
[$sel:assetId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The user specified ID for the entry. You can use this ID to identify
--   which entries failed.
[$sel:entryId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Text

-- | The list of property values to upload. You can specify up to 10
--   <tt>propertyValues</tt> array elements.
[$sel:propertyValues:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> [AssetPropertyValue]

-- | Create a value of <a>PutAssetPropertyValueEntry</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyAlias:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyAlias</a> - The alias that
--   identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data stream path
--   (for example, <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For
--   more information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyId</a> - The ID of the asset
--   property for this entry.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_assetId</a> - The ID of the asset to
--   update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entryId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_entryId</a> - The user specified ID for
--   the entry. You can use this ID to identify which entries failed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyValues:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyValues</a> - The list of
--   property values to upload. You can specify up to 10
--   <tt>propertyValues</tt> array elements.
newPutAssetPropertyValueEntry :: Text -> PutAssetPropertyValueEntry

-- | The alias that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data
--   stream path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyAlias :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the asset property for this entry.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyId :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the asset to update.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_assetId :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The user specified ID for the entry. You can use this ID to identify
--   which entries failed.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_entryId :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry Text

-- | The list of property values to upload. You can specify up to 10
--   <tt>propertyValues</tt> array elements.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyValues :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry [AssetPropertyValue]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.PutAssetPropertyValueEntry.PutAssetPropertyValueEntry
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.PutAssetPropertyValueEntry.PutAssetPropertyValueEntry
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.PutAssetPropertyValueEntry.PutAssetPropertyValueEntry
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.PutAssetPropertyValueEntry.PutAssetPropertyValueEntry
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.PutAssetPropertyValueEntry.PutAssetPropertyValueEntry
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.PutAssetPropertyValueEntry.PutAssetPropertyValueEntry
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types.PutAssetPropertyValueEntry.PutAssetPropertyValueEntry


module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Types

-- | API version <tt>2019-12-02</tt> of the Amazon IoT SiteWise SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The request isn't valid. This can occur if your request contains
--   malformed JSON or unsupported characters. Check your request and try
--   again.
_InvalidRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource already exists.
_ResourceAlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You've reached the limit for the number of tags allowed for a
--   resource. For more information, see <a>Tag naming limits and
--   requirements</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General Reference</i>.
_TooManyTagsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Your request has conflicting operations. This can occur if you're
--   trying to perform more than one operation on the same resource at the
--   same time.
_ConflictingOperationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Your request exceeded a rate limit. For example, you might have
--   exceeded the number of IoT SiteWise assets that can be created per
--   second, the allowed number of messages per second, and so on.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
_ThrottlingException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | IoT SiteWise can't process your request right now. Try again later.
_InternalFailureException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested service is unavailable.
_ServiceUnavailableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You are not authorized.
_UnauthorizedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested resource can't be found.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You've reached the limit for a resource. For example, this can occur
--   if you're trying to associate more than the allowed number of child
--   assets or attempting to create more than the allowed number of
--   properties for an asset model.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
newtype AggregateType
AggregateType' :: Text -> AggregateType
[fromAggregateType] :: AggregateType -> Text
pattern AggregateType_AVERAGE :: AggregateType
pattern AggregateType_COUNT :: AggregateType
pattern AggregateType_MAXIMUM :: AggregateType
pattern AggregateType_MINIMUM :: AggregateType
pattern AggregateType_STANDARD_DEVIATION :: AggregateType
pattern AggregateType_SUM :: AggregateType
newtype AssetErrorCode
AssetErrorCode' :: Text -> AssetErrorCode
[fromAssetErrorCode] :: AssetErrorCode -> Text
pattern AssetErrorCode_INTERNAL_FAILURE :: AssetErrorCode
newtype AssetModelState
AssetModelState' :: Text -> AssetModelState
[fromAssetModelState] :: AssetModelState -> Text
pattern AssetModelState_ACTIVE :: AssetModelState
pattern AssetModelState_CREATING :: AssetModelState
pattern AssetModelState_DELETING :: AssetModelState
pattern AssetModelState_FAILED :: AssetModelState
pattern AssetModelState_PROPAGATING :: AssetModelState
pattern AssetModelState_UPDATING :: AssetModelState
newtype AssetRelationshipType
AssetRelationshipType' :: Text -> AssetRelationshipType
[fromAssetRelationshipType] :: AssetRelationshipType -> Text
pattern AssetRelationshipType_HIERARCHY :: AssetRelationshipType
newtype AssetState

[fromAssetState] :: AssetState -> Text
pattern AssetState_ACTIVE :: AssetState
pattern AssetState_CREATING :: AssetState
pattern AssetState_DELETING :: AssetState
pattern AssetState_FAILED :: AssetState
pattern AssetState_UPDATING :: AssetState
newtype AuthMode
AuthMode' :: Text -> AuthMode
[fromAuthMode] :: AuthMode -> Text
pattern AuthMode_IAM :: AuthMode
pattern AuthMode_SSO :: AuthMode
newtype BatchPutAssetPropertyValueErrorCode
