-- | Contains asset property information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProperty</a> smart constructor.
data Property
Property' :: Maybe PropertyNotification -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PropertyType -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> PropertyDataType -> Property

-- | The asset property's notification topic and state. For more
--   information, see <a>UpdateAssetProperty</a>.
[$sel:notification:Property'] :: Property -> Maybe PropertyNotification

-- | The alias that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data
--   stream path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:alias:Property'] :: Property -> Maybe Text

-- | The property type (see <tt>PropertyType</tt>). A property contains one
--   type.
[$sel:type':Property'] :: Property -> Maybe PropertyType

-- | The unit (such as <tt>Newtons</tt> or <tt>RPM</tt>) of the asset
--   property.
[$sel:unit:Property'] :: Property -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the asset property.
[$sel:id:Property'] :: Property -> Text

-- | The name of the property.
[$sel:name:Property'] :: Property -> Text

-- | The property data type.
[$sel:dataType:Property'] :: Property -> PropertyDataType

-- | Create a value of <a>Property</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:notification:Property'</a>, <a>property_notification</a> - The
--   asset property's notification topic and state. For more information,
--   see <a>UpdateAssetProperty</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alias:Property'</a>, <a>property_alias</a> - The alias that
--   identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data stream path
--   (for example, <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For
--   more information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Property'</a>, <a>property_type</a> - The property type
--   (see <tt>PropertyType</tt>). A property contains one type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:Property'</a>, <a>property_unit</a> - The unit (such as
--   <tt>Newtons</tt> or <tt>RPM</tt>) of the asset property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Property'</a>, <a>property_id</a> - The ID of the asset
--   property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Property'</a>, <a>property_name</a> - The name of the
--   property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataType:Property'</a>, <a>property_dataType</a> - The
--   property data type.
newProperty :: Text -> Text -> PropertyDataType -> Property

-- | The asset property's notification topic and state. For more
--   information, see <a>UpdateAssetProperty</a>.
property_notification :: Lens' Property (Maybe PropertyNotification)

-- | The alias that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data
--   stream path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
property_alias :: Lens' Property (Maybe Text)

-- | The property type (see <tt>PropertyType</tt>). A property contains one
--   type.
property_type :: Lens' Property (Maybe PropertyType)

-- | The unit (such as <tt>Newtons</tt> or <tt>RPM</tt>) of the asset
--   property.
property_unit :: Lens' Property (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the asset property.
property_id :: Lens' Property Text

-- | The name of the property.
property_name :: Lens' Property Text

-- | The property data type.
property_dataType :: Lens' Property PropertyDataType

-- | Contains asset property value notification information. When the
--   notification state is enabled, IoT SiteWise publishes property value
--   updates to a unique MQTT topic. For more information, see
--   <a>Interacting with other services</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPropertyNotification</a> smart constructor.
data PropertyNotification
PropertyNotification' :: Text -> PropertyNotificationState -> PropertyNotification

-- | The MQTT topic to which IoT SiteWise publishes property value update
--   notifications.
[$sel:topic:PropertyNotification'] :: PropertyNotification -> Text

-- | The current notification state.
[$sel:state:PropertyNotification'] :: PropertyNotification -> PropertyNotificationState

-- | Create a value of <a>PropertyNotification</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:topic:PropertyNotification'</a>,
--   <a>propertyNotification_topic</a> - The MQTT topic to which IoT
--   SiteWise publishes property value update notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:PropertyNotification'</a>,
--   <a>propertyNotification_state</a> - The current notification state.
newPropertyNotification :: Text -> PropertyNotificationState -> PropertyNotification

-- | The MQTT topic to which IoT SiteWise publishes property value update
--   notifications.
propertyNotification_topic :: Lens' PropertyNotification Text

-- | The current notification state.
propertyNotification_state :: Lens' PropertyNotification PropertyNotificationState

-- | Contains a property type, which can be one of <tt>attribute</tt>,
--   <tt>measurement</tt>, <tt>metric</tt>, or <tt>transform</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPropertyType</a> smart constructor.
data PropertyType
PropertyType' :: Maybe Attribute -> Maybe Transform -> Maybe Metric -> Maybe Measurement -> PropertyType

-- | Specifies an asset attribute property. An attribute generally contains
--   static information, such as the serial number of an <a>IIoT</a> wind
--   turbine.
[$sel:attribute:PropertyType'] :: PropertyType -> Maybe Attribute

-- | Specifies an asset transform property. A transform contains a
--   mathematical expression that maps a property's data points from one
--   form to another, such as a unit conversion from Celsius to Fahrenheit.
[$sel:transform:PropertyType'] :: PropertyType -> Maybe Transform

-- | Specifies an asset metric property. A metric contains a mathematical
--   expression that uses aggregate functions to process all input data
--   points over a time interval and output a single data point, such as to
--   calculate the average hourly temperature.
[$sel:metric:PropertyType'] :: PropertyType -> Maybe Metric

-- | Specifies an asset measurement property. A measurement represents a
--   device's raw sensor data stream, such as timestamped temperature
--   values or timestamped power values.
[$sel:measurement:PropertyType'] :: PropertyType -> Maybe Measurement

-- | Create a value of <a>PropertyType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attribute:PropertyType'</a>, <a>propertyType_attribute</a> -
--   Specifies an asset attribute property. An attribute generally contains
--   static information, such as the serial number of an <a>IIoT</a> wind
--   turbine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transform:PropertyType'</a>, <a>propertyType_transform</a> -
--   Specifies an asset transform property. A transform contains a
--   mathematical expression that maps a property's data points from one
--   form to another, such as a unit conversion from Celsius to Fahrenheit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metric:PropertyType'</a>, <a>propertyType_metric</a> -
--   Specifies an asset metric property. A metric contains a mathematical
--   expression that uses aggregate functions to process all input data
--   points over a time interval and output a single data point, such as to
--   calculate the average hourly temperature.
--   
--   <a>$sel:measurement:PropertyType'</a>, <a>propertyType_measurement</a>
--   - Specifies an asset measurement property. A measurement represents a
--   device's raw sensor data stream, such as timestamped temperature
--   values or timestamped power values.
newPropertyType :: PropertyType

-- | Specifies an asset attribute property. An attribute generally contains
--   static information, such as the serial number of an <a>IIoT</a> wind
--   turbine.
propertyType_attribute :: Lens' PropertyType (Maybe Attribute)

-- | Specifies an asset transform property. A transform contains a
--   mathematical expression that maps a property's data points from one
--   form to another, such as a unit conversion from Celsius to Fahrenheit.
propertyType_transform :: Lens' PropertyType (Maybe Transform)

-- | Specifies an asset metric property. A metric contains a mathematical
--   expression that uses aggregate functions to process all input data
--   points over a time interval and output a single data point, such as to
--   calculate the average hourly temperature.
propertyType_metric :: Lens' PropertyType (Maybe Metric)

-- | Specifies an asset measurement property. A measurement represents a
--   device's raw sensor data stream, such as timestamped temperature
--   values or timestamped power values.
propertyType_measurement :: Lens' PropertyType (Maybe Measurement)

-- | Contains a list of value updates for an asset property in the list of
--   asset entries consumed by the <a>BatchPutAssetPropertyValue</a> API
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutAssetPropertyValueEntry</a> smart constructor.
data PutAssetPropertyValueEntry
PutAssetPropertyValueEntry' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> [AssetPropertyValue] -> PutAssetPropertyValueEntry

-- | The alias that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data
--   stream path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:propertyAlias:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the asset property for this entry.
[$sel:propertyId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the asset to update.
[$sel:assetId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The user specified ID for the entry. You can use this ID to identify
--   which entries failed.
[$sel:entryId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> Text

-- | The list of property values to upload. You can specify up to 10
--   <tt>propertyValues</tt> array elements.
[$sel:propertyValues:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'] :: PutAssetPropertyValueEntry -> [AssetPropertyValue]

-- | Create a value of <a>PutAssetPropertyValueEntry</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyAlias:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyAlias</a> - The alias that
--   identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data stream path
--   (for example, <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For
--   more information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyId</a> - The ID of the asset
--   property for this entry.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_assetId</a> - The ID of the asset to
--   update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entryId:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_entryId</a> - The user specified ID for
--   the entry. You can use this ID to identify which entries failed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyValues:PutAssetPropertyValueEntry'</a>,
--   <a>putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyValues</a> - The list of
--   property values to upload. You can specify up to 10
--   <tt>propertyValues</tt> array elements.
newPutAssetPropertyValueEntry :: Text -> PutAssetPropertyValueEntry

-- | The alias that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data
--   stream path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyAlias :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the asset property for this entry.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyId :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the asset to update.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_assetId :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The user specified ID for the entry. You can use this ID to identify
--   which entries failed.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_entryId :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry Text

-- | The list of property values to upload. You can specify up to 10
--   <tt>propertyValues</tt> array elements.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyValues :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry [AssetPropertyValue]

-- | Contains an IoT SiteWise Monitor resource ID for a portal or project.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResource</a> smart constructor.
data Resource
Resource' :: Maybe PortalResource -> Maybe ProjectResource -> Resource

-- | A portal resource.
[$sel:portal:Resource'] :: Resource -> Maybe PortalResource

-- | A project resource.
[$sel:project:Resource'] :: Resource -> Maybe ProjectResource

-- | Create a value of <a>Resource</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:portal:Resource'</a>, <a>resource_portal</a> - A portal
--   resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:project:Resource'</a>, <a>resource_project</a> - A project
--   resource.
newResource :: Resource

-- | A portal resource.
resource_portal :: Lens' Resource (Maybe PortalResource)

-- | A project resource.
resource_project :: Lens' Resource (Maybe ProjectResource)

-- | Contains a timestamp with optional nanosecond granularity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimeInNanos</a> smart constructor.
data TimeInNanos
TimeInNanos' :: Maybe Natural -> Natural -> TimeInNanos

-- | The nanosecond offset from <tt>timeInSeconds</tt>.
[$sel:offsetInNanos:TimeInNanos'] :: TimeInNanos -> Maybe Natural

-- | The timestamp date, in seconds, in the Unix epoch format. Fractional
--   nanosecond data is provided by <tt>offsetInNanos</tt>.
[$sel:timeInSeconds:TimeInNanos'] :: TimeInNanos -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>TimeInNanos</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:offsetInNanos:TimeInNanos'</a>,
--   <a>timeInNanos_offsetInNanos</a> - The nanosecond offset from
--   <tt>timeInSeconds</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeInSeconds:TimeInNanos'</a>,
--   <a>timeInNanos_timeInSeconds</a> - The timestamp date, in seconds, in
--   the Unix epoch format. Fractional nanosecond data is provided by
--   <tt>offsetInNanos</tt>.
newTimeInNanos :: Natural -> TimeInNanos

-- | The nanosecond offset from <tt>timeInSeconds</tt>.
timeInNanos_offsetInNanos :: Lens' TimeInNanos (Maybe Natural)

-- | The timestamp date, in seconds, in the Unix epoch format. Fractional
--   nanosecond data is provided by <tt>offsetInNanos</tt>.
timeInNanos_timeInSeconds :: Lens' TimeInNanos Natural

-- | Contains an asset transform property. A transform is a one-to-one
--   mapping of a property's data points from one form to another. For
--   example, you can use a transform to convert a Celsius data stream to
--   Fahrenheit by applying the transformation expression to each data
--   point of the Celsius stream. A transform can only have a data type of
--   <tt>DOUBLE</tt> and consume properties with data types of
--   <tt>INTEGER</tt> or <tt>DOUBLE</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Transforms</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise
--   User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTransform</a> smart constructor.
data Transform
Transform' :: Maybe TransformProcessingConfig -> Text -> [ExpressionVariable] -> Transform

-- | The processing configuration for the given transform property. You can
--   configure transforms to be kept at the edge or forwarded to the Amazon
--   Web Services Cloud. You can also configure transforms to be computed
--   at the edge or in the cloud.
[$sel:processingConfig:Transform'] :: Transform -> Maybe TransformProcessingConfig

-- | The mathematical expression that defines the transformation function.
--   You can specify up to 10 variables per expression. You can specify up
--   to 10 functions per expression.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:expression:Transform'] :: Transform -> Text

-- | The list of variables used in the expression.
[$sel:variables:Transform'] :: Transform -> [ExpressionVariable]

-- | Create a value of <a>Transform</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfig:Transform'</a>,
--   <a>transform_processingConfig</a> - The processing configuration for
--   the given transform property. You can configure transforms to be kept
--   at the edge or forwarded to the Amazon Web Services Cloud. You can
--   also configure transforms to be computed at the edge or in the cloud.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expression:Transform'</a>, <a>transform_expression</a> - The
--   mathematical expression that defines the transformation function. You
--   can specify up to 10 variables per expression. You can specify up to
--   10 functions per expression.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:variables:Transform'</a>, <a>transform_variables</a> - The
--   list of variables used in the expression.
newTransform :: Text -> Transform

-- | The processing configuration for the given transform property. You can
--   configure transforms to be kept at the edge or forwarded to the Amazon
--   Web Services Cloud. You can also configure transforms to be computed
--   at the edge or in the cloud.
transform_processingConfig :: Lens' Transform (Maybe TransformProcessingConfig)

-- | The mathematical expression that defines the transformation function.
--   You can specify up to 10 variables per expression. You can specify up
--   to 10 functions per expression.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
transform_expression :: Lens' Transform Text

-- | The list of variables used in the expression.
transform_variables :: Lens' Transform [ExpressionVariable]

-- | The processing configuration for the given transform property. You can
--   configure transforms to be kept at the edge or forwarded to the Amazon
--   Web Services Cloud. You can also configure transforms to be computed
--   at the edge or in the cloud.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTransformProcessingConfig</a> smart constructor.
data TransformProcessingConfig
TransformProcessingConfig' :: Maybe ForwardingConfig -> ComputeLocation -> TransformProcessingConfig
[$sel:forwardingConfig:TransformProcessingConfig'] :: TransformProcessingConfig -> Maybe ForwardingConfig

-- | The compute location for the given transform property.
[$sel:computeLocation:TransformProcessingConfig'] :: TransformProcessingConfig -> ComputeLocation

-- | Create a value of <a>TransformProcessingConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:forwardingConfig:TransformProcessingConfig'</a>,
--   <a>transformProcessingConfig_forwardingConfig</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:computeLocation:TransformProcessingConfig'</a>,
--   <a>transformProcessingConfig_computeLocation</a> - The compute
--   location for the given transform property.
newTransformProcessingConfig :: ComputeLocation -> TransformProcessingConfig

-- | Undocumented member.
transformProcessingConfig_forwardingConfig :: Lens' TransformProcessingConfig (Maybe ForwardingConfig)

-- | The compute location for the given transform property.
transformProcessingConfig_computeLocation :: Lens' TransformProcessingConfig ComputeLocation

-- | Contains a tumbling window, which is a repeating fixed-sized,
--   non-overlapping, and contiguous time window. You use this window in
--   metrics to aggregate data from properties and other assets.
--   
--   You can use <tt>m</tt>, <tt>h</tt>, <tt>d</tt>, and <tt>w</tt> when
--   you specify an interval or offset. Note that <tt>m</tt> represents
--   minutes, and <tt>w</tt> represents weeks. You can also use <tt>s</tt>
--   to represent seconds in <tt>offset</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>interval</tt> and <tt>offset</tt> parameters support the
--   <a>ISO 8601 format</a>. For example, <tt>PT5S</tt> represents five
--   seconds, <tt>PT5M</tt> represents five minutes, and <tt>PT5H</tt>
--   represents five hours.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTumblingWindow</a> smart constructor.
data TumblingWindow
TumblingWindow' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> TumblingWindow

-- | The offset for the tumbling window. The <tt>offset</tt> parameter
--   accepts the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The offset time.For example, if you specify <tt>18h</tt> for
--   <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise
--   aggregates data in one of the following ways:<ul><li>If you create the
--   metric before or at 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation
--   result at 6 PM (UTC) on the day when you create the metric.</li><li>If
--   you create the metric after 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first
--   aggregation result at 6 PM (UTC) the next day.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The ISO 8601 format.For example, if you specify <tt>PT18H</tt> for
--   <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise
--   aggregates data in one of the following ways:<ul><li>If you create the
--   metric before or at 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation
--   result at 6 PM (UTC) on the day when you create the metric.</li><li>If
--   you create the metric after 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first
--   aggregation result at 6 PM (UTC) the next day.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The 24-hour clock.For example, if you specify <tt>00:03:00</tt>
--   for <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>5m</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, and you
--   create the metric at 2 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation result
--   at 2:03 PM (UTC). You get the second aggregation result at 2:08 PM
--   (UTC).</li>
--   <li>The offset time zone.For example, if you specify
--   <tt>2021-07-23T18:00-08</tt> for <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for
--   <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise aggregates data in one of the
--   following ways:<ul><li>If you create the metric before or at 6:00 PM
--   (PST), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (PST) on the day
--   when you create the metric.</li><li>If you create the metric after
--   6:00 PM (PST), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (PST) the
--   next day.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:offset:TumblingWindow'] :: TumblingWindow -> Maybe Text

-- | The time interval for the tumbling window. The interval time must be
--   between 1 minute and 1 week.
--   
--   IoT SiteWise computes the <tt>1w</tt> interval the end of Sunday at
--   midnight each week (UTC), the <tt>1d</tt> interval at the end of each
--   day at midnight (UTC), the <tt>1h</tt> interval at the end of each
--   hour, and so on.
--   
--   When IoT SiteWise aggregates data points for metric computations, the
--   start of each interval is exclusive and the end of each interval is
--   inclusive. IoT SiteWise places the computed data point at the end of
--   the interval.
[$sel:interval:TumblingWindow'] :: TumblingWindow -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TumblingWindow</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:offset:TumblingWindow'</a>, <a>tumblingWindow_offset</a> - The
--   offset for the tumbling window. The <tt>offset</tt> parameter accepts
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The offset time.For example, if you specify <tt>18h</tt> for
--   <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise
--   aggregates data in one of the following ways:<ul><li>If you create the
--   metric before or at 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation
--   result at 6 PM (UTC) on the day when you create the metric.</li><li>If
--   you create the metric after 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first
--   aggregation result at 6 PM (UTC) the next day.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The ISO 8601 format.For example, if you specify <tt>PT18H</tt> for
--   <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise
--   aggregates data in one of the following ways:<ul><li>If you create the
--   metric before or at 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation
--   result at 6 PM (UTC) on the day when you create the metric.</li><li>If
--   you create the metric after 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first
--   aggregation result at 6 PM (UTC) the next day.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The 24-hour clock.For example, if you specify <tt>00:03:00</tt>
--   for <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>5m</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, and you
--   create the metric at 2 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation result
--   at 2:03 PM (UTC). You get the second aggregation result at 2:08 PM
--   (UTC).</li>
--   <li>The offset time zone.For example, if you specify
--   <tt>2021-07-23T18:00-08</tt> for <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for
--   <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise aggregates data in one of the
--   following ways:<ul><li>If you create the metric before or at 6:00 PM
--   (PST), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (PST) on the day
--   when you create the metric.</li><li>If you create the metric after
--   6:00 PM (PST), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (PST) the
--   next day.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:interval:TumblingWindow'</a>, <a>tumblingWindow_interval</a> -
--   The time interval for the tumbling window. The interval time must be
--   between 1 minute and 1 week.
--   
--   IoT SiteWise computes the <tt>1w</tt> interval the end of Sunday at
--   midnight each week (UTC), the <tt>1d</tt> interval at the end of each
--   day at midnight (UTC), the <tt>1h</tt> interval at the end of each
--   hour, and so on.
--   
--   When IoT SiteWise aggregates data points for metric computations, the
--   start of each interval is exclusive and the end of each interval is
--   inclusive. IoT SiteWise places the computed data point at the end of
--   the interval.
newTumblingWindow :: Text -> TumblingWindow

-- | The offset for the tumbling window. The <tt>offset</tt> parameter
--   accepts the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The offset time.For example, if you specify <tt>18h</tt> for
--   <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise
--   aggregates data in one of the following ways:<ul><li>If you create the
--   metric before or at 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation
--   result at 6 PM (UTC) on the day when you create the metric.</li><li>If
--   you create the metric after 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first
--   aggregation result at 6 PM (UTC) the next day.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The ISO 8601 format.For example, if you specify <tt>PT18H</tt> for
--   <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise
--   aggregates data in one of the following ways:<ul><li>If you create the
--   metric before or at 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation
--   result at 6 PM (UTC) on the day when you create the metric.</li><li>If
--   you create the metric after 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first
--   aggregation result at 6 PM (UTC) the next day.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The 24-hour clock.For example, if you specify <tt>00:03:00</tt>
--   for <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>5m</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, and you
--   create the metric at 2 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation result
--   at 2:03 PM (UTC). You get the second aggregation result at 2:08 PM
--   (UTC).</li>
--   <li>The offset time zone.For example, if you specify
--   <tt>2021-07-23T18:00-08</tt> for <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for
--   <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise aggregates data in one of the
--   following ways:<ul><li>If you create the metric before or at 6:00 PM
--   (PST), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (PST) on the day
--   when you create the metric.</li><li>If you create the metric after
--   6:00 PM (PST), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (PST) the
--   next day.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
tumblingWindow_offset :: Lens' TumblingWindow (Maybe Text)

-- | The time interval for the tumbling window. The interval time must be
--   between 1 minute and 1 week.
--   
--   IoT SiteWise computes the <tt>1w</tt> interval the end of Sunday at
--   midnight each week (UTC), the <tt>1d</tt> interval at the end of each
--   day at midnight (UTC), the <tt>1h</tt> interval at the end of each
--   hour, and so on.
--   
--   When IoT SiteWise aggregates data points for metric computations, the
--   start of each interval is exclusive and the end of each interval is
--   inclusive. IoT SiteWise places the computed data point at the end of
--   the interval.
tumblingWindow_interval :: Lens' TumblingWindow Text

-- | Contains information for a user identity in an access policy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUserIdentity</a> smart constructor.
data UserIdentity
UserIdentity' :: Text -> UserIdentity

-- | The Amazon Web Services SSO ID of the user.
[$sel:id:UserIdentity'] :: UserIdentity -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UserIdentity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

newUserIdentity :: Text -> UserIdentity

userIdentity_id :: Lens' UserIdentity Text

-- | Identifies a property value used in an expression.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVariableValue</a> smart constructor.
data VariableValue
VariableValue' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> VariableValue

-- | The ID of the hierarchy to query for the property ID. You can use the
--   hierarchy's name instead of the hierarchy's ID.
--   
--   You use a hierarchy ID instead of a model ID because you can have
--   several hierarchies using the same model and therefore the same
--   <tt>propertyId</tt>. For example, you might have separately grouped
--   assets that come from the same asset model. For more information, see
--   <a>Asset hierarchies</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:hierarchyId:VariableValue'] :: VariableValue -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the property to use as the variable. You can use the
--   property <tt>name</tt> if it's from the same asset model.
[$sel:propertyId:VariableValue'] :: VariableValue -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>VariableValue</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:hierarchyId:VariableValue'</a>,
--   <a>variableValue_hierarchyId</a> - The ID of the hierarchy to query
--   for the property ID. You can use the hierarchy's name instead of the
--   hierarchy's ID.
--   
--   You use a hierarchy ID instead of a model ID because you can have
--   several hierarchies using the same model and therefore the same
--   <tt>propertyId</tt>. For example, you might have separately grouped
--   assets that come from the same asset model. For more information, see
--   <a>Asset hierarchies</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyId:VariableValue'</a>, <a>variableValue_propertyId</a>
--   - The ID of the property to use as the variable. You can use the
--   property <tt>name</tt> if it's from the same asset model.
newVariableValue :: Text -> VariableValue

-- | The ID of the hierarchy to query for the property ID. You can use the
--   hierarchy's name instead of the hierarchy's ID.
--   
--   You use a hierarchy ID instead of a model ID because you can have
--   several hierarchies using the same model and therefore the same
--   <tt>propertyId</tt>. For example, you might have separately grouped
--   assets that come from the same asset model. For more information, see
--   <a>Asset hierarchies</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
variableValue_hierarchyId :: Lens' VariableValue (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the property to use as the variable. You can use the
--   property <tt>name</tt> if it's from the same asset model.
variableValue_propertyId :: Lens' VariableValue Text

-- | Contains an asset property value (of a single type only).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVariant</a> smart constructor.
data Variant
Variant' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Variant

-- | Asset property data of type integer (whole number).
[$sel:integerValue:Variant'] :: Variant -> Maybe Int

-- | Asset property data of type double (floating point number).
[$sel:doubleValue:Variant'] :: Variant -> Maybe Double

-- | Asset property data of type string (sequence of characters).
[$sel:stringValue:Variant'] :: Variant -> Maybe Text

-- | Asset property data of type Boolean (true or false).
[$sel:booleanValue:Variant'] :: Variant -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>Variant</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:integerValue:Variant'</a>, <a>variant_integerValue</a> - Asset
--   property data of type integer (whole number).
--   
--   <a>$sel:doubleValue:Variant'</a>, <a>variant_doubleValue</a> - Asset
--   property data of type double (floating point number).
--   
--   <a>$sel:stringValue:Variant'</a>, <a>variant_stringValue</a> - Asset
--   property data of type string (sequence of characters).
--   
--   <a>$sel:booleanValue:Variant'</a>, <a>variant_booleanValue</a> - Asset
--   property data of type Boolean (true or false).
newVariant :: Variant

-- | Asset property data of type integer (whole number).
variant_integerValue :: Lens' Variant (Maybe Int)

-- | Asset property data of type double (floating point number).
variant_doubleValue :: Lens' Variant (Maybe Double)

-- | Asset property data of type string (sequence of characters).
variant_stringValue :: Lens' Variant (Maybe Text)

-- | Asset property data of type Boolean (true or false).
variant_booleanValue :: Lens' Variant (Maybe Bool)


-- | Adds tags to an IoT SiteWise resource. If a tag already exists for the
--   resource, this operation updates the tag's value.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.TagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResource</a> smart constructor.
data TagResource
TagResource' :: Text -> HashMap Text Text -> TagResource

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the resource to tag.
[$sel:resourceArn:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> Text

-- | A list of key-value pairs that contain metadata for the resource. For
--   more information, see <a>Tagging your IoT SiteWise resources</a> in
--   the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:tags:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> HashMap Text Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResource</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_resourceArn</a> -
--   The <a>ARN</a> of the resource to tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_tags</a> - A list of
--   key-value pairs that contain metadata for the resource. For more
--   information, see <a>Tagging your IoT SiteWise resources</a> in the
--   <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
newTagResource :: Text -> TagResource

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the resource to tag.
tagResource_resourceArn :: Lens' TagResource Text

-- | A list of key-value pairs that contain metadata for the resource. For
--   more information, see <a>Tagging your IoT SiteWise resources</a> in
--   the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
tagResource_tags :: Lens' TagResource (HashMap Text Text)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResourceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data TagResourceResponse
TagResourceResponse' :: Int -> TagResourceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:TagResourceResponse'] :: TagResourceResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResourceResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:TagResourceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>tagResourceResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newTagResourceResponse :: Int -> TagResourceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
tagResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' TagResourceResponse Int

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.TagResource.TagResource

-- | Configures storage settings for IoT SiteWise.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.PutStorageConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutStorageConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data PutStorageConfiguration
PutStorageConfiguration' :: Maybe MultiLayerStorage -> StorageType -> PutStorageConfiguration

-- | Identifies a storage destination. If you specified
--   <tt>MULTI_LAYER_STORAGE</tt> for the storage type, you must specify a
--   <tt>MultiLayerStorage</tt> object.
[$sel:multiLayerStorage:PutStorageConfiguration'] :: PutStorageConfiguration -> Maybe MultiLayerStorage

-- | The type of storage that you specified for your data. The storage type
--   can be one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>SITEWISE_DEFAULT_STORAGE</tt> – IoT SiteWise replicates your
--   data into a service managed database.</li>
--   <li><tt>MULTI_LAYER_STORAGE</tt> – IoT SiteWise replicates your data
--   into a service managed database and saves a copy of your raw data and
--   metadata in an Amazon S3 object that you specified.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:storageType:PutStorageConfiguration'] :: PutStorageConfiguration -> StorageType

-- | Create a value of <a>PutStorageConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:multiLayerStorage:PutStorageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>putStorageConfiguration_multiLayerStorage</a> - Identifies a
--   storage destination. If you specified <tt>MULTI_LAYER_STORAGE</tt> for
--   the storage type, you must specify a <tt>MultiLayerStorage</tt>
--   object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageType:PutStorageConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>putStorageConfiguration_storageType</a> - The type of storage that
--   you specified for your data. The storage type can be one of the
--   following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>SITEWISE_DEFAULT_STORAGE</tt> – IoT SiteWise replicates your
--   data into a service managed database.</li>
--   <li><tt>MULTI_LAYER_STORAGE</tt> – IoT SiteWise replicates your data
--   into a service managed database and saves a copy of your raw data and
--   metadata in an Amazon S3 object that you specified.</li>
--   </ul>
newPutStorageConfiguration :: StorageType -> PutStorageConfiguration

-- | Identifies a storage destination. If you specified
--   <tt>MULTI_LAYER_STORAGE</tt> for the storage type, you must specify a
--   <tt>MultiLayerStorage</tt> object.
putStorageConfiguration_multiLayerStorage :: Lens' PutStorageConfiguration (Maybe MultiLayerStorage)

-- | The type of storage that you specified for your data. The storage type
--   can be one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>SITEWISE_DEFAULT_STORAGE</tt> – IoT SiteWise replicates your
--   data into a service managed database.</li>
--   <li><tt>MULTI_LAYER_STORAGE</tt> – IoT SiteWise replicates your data
--   into a service managed database and saves a copy of your raw data and
--   metadata in an Amazon S3 object that you specified.</li>
--   </ul>
putStorageConfiguration_storageType :: Lens' PutStorageConfiguration StorageType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutStorageConfigurationResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutStorageConfigurationResponse
PutStorageConfigurationResponse' :: Maybe MultiLayerStorage -> Int -> StorageType -> ConfigurationStatus -> PutStorageConfigurationResponse

[$sel:multiLayerStorage:PutStorageConfigurationResponse'] :: PutStorageConfigurationResponse -> Maybe MultiLayerStorage

--

--

--   of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>SITEWISE_DEFAULT_STORAGE</tt> – IoT SiteWise replicates your
--   data into a service managed database.</li>
--   <li><tt>MULTI_LAYER_STORAGE</tt> – IoT SiteWise replicates your data

-- | Sets the default encryption configuration for the Amazon Web Services
--   account. For more information, see <a>Key management</a> in the <i>IoT
--   SiteWise User Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.PutDefaultEncryptionConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutDefaultEncryptionConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutDefaultEncryptionConfiguration
PutDefaultEncryptionConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> EncryptionType -> PutDefaultEncryptionConfiguration

-- | The Key ID of the customer managed customer master key (CMK) used for
--   KMS encryption. This is required if you use
--   <tt>KMS_BASED_ENCRYPTION</tt>.
[$sel:kmsKeyId:PutDefaultEncryptionConfiguration'] :: PutDefaultEncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of encryption used for the encryption configuration.
[$sel:encryptionType:PutDefaultEncryptionConfiguration'] :: PutDefaultEncryptionConfiguration -> EncryptionType

-- | Create a value of <a>PutDefaultEncryptionConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:PutDefaultEncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>putDefaultEncryptionConfiguration_kmsKeyId</a> - The Key ID of the
--   customer managed customer master key (CMK) used for KMS encryption.
--   This is required if you use <tt>KMS_BASED_ENCRYPTION</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionType:PutDefaultEncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>putDefaultEncryptionConfiguration_encryptionType</a> - The type of
--   encryption used for the encryption configuration.
newPutDefaultEncryptionConfiguration :: EncryptionType -> PutDefaultEncryptionConfiguration

--   <tt>KMS_BASED_ENCRYPTION</tt>.

-- | Retrieves the list of tags for an IoT SiteWise resource.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.ListTagsForResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTagsForResource</a> smart constructor.
data ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource' :: Text -> ListTagsForResource

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the resource.
[$sel:resourceArn:ListTagsForResource'] :: ListTagsForResource -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTagsForResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:ListTagsForResource'</a>,
--   <a>listTagsForResource_resourceArn</a> - The <a>ARN</a> of the
--   resource.
newListTagsForResource :: Text -> ListTagsForResource

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the resource.
listTagsForResource_resourceArn :: Lens' ListTagsForResource Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTagsForResourceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListTagsForResourceResponse
ListTagsForResourceResponse' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Int -> ListTagsForResourceResponse

-- | The list of key-value pairs that contain metadata for the resource.
--   For more information, see <a>Tagging your IoT SiteWise resources</a>
--   in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:tags:ListTagsForResourceResponse'] :: ListTagsForResourceResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListTagsForResourceResponse'] :: ListTagsForResourceResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTagsForResourceResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ListTagsForResourceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listTagsForResourceResponse_tags</a> - The list of key-value pairs
--   that contain metadata for the resource. For more information, see
--   <a>Tagging your IoT SiteWise resources</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListTagsForResourceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listTagsForResourceResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newListTagsForResourceResponse :: Int -> ListTagsForResourceResponse

-- | The list of key-value pairs that contain metadata for the resource.
--   For more information, see <a>Tagging your IoT SiteWise resources</a>
--   in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
listTagsForResourceResponse_tags :: Lens' ListTagsForResourceResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The response's http status code.
listTagsForResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListTagsForResourceResponse Int

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.ListTagsForResource.ListTagsForResource

-- | Retrieves a paginated list of associated assets.
--   
--   You can use this operation to do the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>List child assets associated to a parent asset by a hierarchy that
--   you specify.</li>
--   <li>List an asset's parent asset.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.ListAssociatedAssets

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListAssociatedAssets</a> smart constructor.
data ListAssociatedAssets
ListAssociatedAssets' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe TraversalDirection -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> ListAssociatedAssets

-- | The ID of the hierarchy by which child assets are associated to the
--   asset. To find a hierarchy ID, use the <a>DescribeAsset</a> or
--   <a>DescribeAssetModel</a> operations. This parameter is required if
--   you choose <tt>CHILD</tt> for <tt>traversalDirection</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Asset hierarchies</a> in the <i>IoT
--   SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:hierarchyId:ListAssociatedAssets'] :: ListAssociatedAssets -> Maybe Text

-- | The direction to list associated assets. Choose one of the following
--   options:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CHILD</tt> – The list includes all child assets associated to
--   the asset. The <tt>hierarchyId</tt> parameter is required if you
--   choose <tt>CHILD</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>PARENT</tt> – The list includes the asset's parent asset.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Default: <tt>CHILD</tt>
[$sel:traversalDirection:ListAssociatedAssets'] :: ListAssociatedAssets -> Maybe TraversalDirection

-- | The token to be used for the next set of paginated results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListAssociatedAssets'] :: ListAssociatedAssets -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to return for each paginated request.
--   
--   Default: 50
[$sel:maxResults:ListAssociatedAssets'] :: ListAssociatedAssets -> Maybe Natural

-- | The ID of the asset to query.
[$sel:assetId:ListAssociatedAssets'] :: ListAssociatedAssets -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListAssociatedAssets</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:hierarchyId:ListAssociatedAssets'</a>,
--   <a>listAssociatedAssets_hierarchyId</a> - The ID of the hierarchy by
--   which child assets are associated to the asset. To find a hierarchy
--   ID, use the <a>DescribeAsset</a> or <a>DescribeAssetModel</a>
--   operations. This parameter is required if you choose <tt>CHILD</tt>
--   for <tt>traversalDirection</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Asset hierarchies</a> in the <i>IoT
--   SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:traversalDirection:ListAssociatedAssets'</a>,
--   <a>listAssociatedAssets_traversalDirection</a> - The direction to list
--   associated assets. Choose one of the following options:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CHILD</tt> – The list includes all child assets associated to
--   the asset. The <tt>hierarchyId</tt> parameter is required if you
--   choose <tt>CHILD</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>PARENT</tt> – The list includes the asset's parent asset.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Default: <tt>CHILD</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListAssociatedAssets'</a>,
--   <a>listAssociatedAssets_nextToken</a> - The token to be used for the
--   next set of paginated results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListAssociatedAssets'</a>,
--   <a>listAssociatedAssets_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results
--   to return for each paginated request.
--   
--   Default: 50
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetId:ListAssociatedAssets'</a>,
--   <a>listAssociatedAssets_assetId</a> - The ID of the asset to query.
newListAssociatedAssets :: Text -> ListAssociatedAssets

-- | The ID of the hierarchy by which child assets are associated to the
--   asset. To find a hierarchy ID, use the <a>DescribeAsset</a> or
--   <a>DescribeAssetModel</a> operations. This parameter is required if
--   you choose <tt>CHILD</tt> for <tt>traversalDirection</tt>.

-- | Retrieves a paginated list of asset summaries.
--   
--   You can use this operation to do the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>List assets based on a specific asset model.</li>
--   <li>List top-level assets.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can't use this operation to list all assets. To retrieve summaries
--   for all of your assets, use <a>ListAssetModels</a> to get all of your
--   asset model IDs. Then, use ListAssets to get all assets for each asset
--   model.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.ListAssets

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListAssets</a> smart constructor.
data ListAssets
ListAssets' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ListAssetsFilter -> Maybe Natural -> ListAssets

-- | The ID of the asset model by which to filter the list of assets. This
--   parameter is required if you choose <tt>ALL</tt> for <tt>filter</tt>.
[$sel:assetModelId:ListAssets'] :: ListAssets -> Maybe Text

-- | The token to be used for the next set of paginated results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListAssets'] :: ListAssets -> Maybe Text

-- | The filter for the requested list of assets. Choose one of the
--   following options:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALL</tt> – The list includes all assets for a given asset
--   model ID. The <tt>assetModelId</tt> parameter is required if you
--   filter by <tt>ALL</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>TOP_LEVEL</tt> – The list includes only top-level assets in
--   the asset hierarchy tree.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Default: <tt>ALL</tt>
[$sel:filter':ListAssets'] :: ListAssets -> Maybe ListAssetsFilter

-- | The maximum number of results to return for each paginated request.
--   
--   Default: 50
[$sel:maxResults:ListAssets'] :: ListAssets -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListAssets</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelId:ListAssets'</a>, <a>listAssets_assetModelId</a> -
--   The ID of the asset model by which to filter the list of assets. This
--   parameter is required if you choose <tt>ALL</tt> for <tt>filter</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListAssets'</a>, <a>listAssets_nextToken</a> - The
--   token to be used for the next set of paginated results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':ListAssets'</a>, <a>listAssets_filter</a> - The filter
--   for the requested list of assets. Choose one of the following options:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALL</tt> – The list includes all assets for a given asset
--   model ID. The <tt>assetModelId</tt> parameter is required if you
--   filter by <tt>ALL</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>TOP_LEVEL</tt> – The list includes only top-level assets in
--   the asset hierarchy tree.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Default: <tt>ALL</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListAssets'</a>, <a>listAssets_maxResults</a> - The
--   maximum number of results to return for each paginated request.
--   
--   Default: 50
newListAssets :: ListAssets

-- | The ID of the asset model by which to filter the list of assets. This
--   parameter is required if you choose <tt>ALL</tt> for <tt>filter</tt>.
listAssets_assetModelId :: Lens' ListAssets (Maybe Text)

-- | The token to be used for the next set of paginated results.
listAssets_nextToken :: Lens' ListAssets (Maybe Text)

-- | The filter for the requested list of assets. Choose one of the
--   following options:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALL</tt> – The list includes all assets for a given asset
--   model ID. The <tt>assetModelId</tt> parameter is required if you
--   filter by <tt>ALL</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>TOP_LEVEL</tt> – The list includes only top-level assets in
--   the asset hierarchy tree.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Default: <tt>ALL</tt>
listAssets_filter :: Lens' ListAssets (Maybe ListAssetsFilter)

-- | The maximum number of results to return for each paginated request.
--   
--   Default: 50
listAssets_maxResults :: Lens' ListAssets (Maybe Natural)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListAssetsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListAssetsResponse
ListAssetsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> [AssetSummary] -> ListAssetsResponse

-- | The token for the next set of results, or null if there are no
--   additional results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListAssetsResponse'] :: ListAssetsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListAssetsResponse'] :: ListAssetsResponse -> Int

-- | A list that summarizes each asset.
[$sel:assetSummaries:ListAssetsResponse'] :: ListAssetsResponse -> [AssetSummary]

-- | Create a value of <a>ListAssetsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   additional results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListAssetsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listAssetsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetSummaries:ListAssetsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listAssetsResponse_assetSummaries</a> - A list that summarizes each
--   asset.
newListAssetsResponse :: Int -> ListAssetsResponse

--   additional results.
listAssetsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListAssetsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Retrieves a paginated list of asset relationships for an asset. You
--   can use this operation to identify an asset's root asset and all
--   associated assets between that asset and its root.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.ListAssetRelationships

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListAssetRelationships</a> smart constructor.
data ListAssetRelationships
ListAssetRelationships' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> TraversalType -> ListAssetRelationships

-- | The token to be used for the next set of paginated results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListAssetRelationships'] :: ListAssetRelationships -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to return for each paginated request.
[$sel:maxResults:ListAssetRelationships'] :: ListAssetRelationships -> Maybe Natural

-- | The ID of the asset.
[$sel:assetId:ListAssetRelationships'] :: ListAssetRelationships -> Text

-- | The type of traversal to use to identify asset relationships. Choose
--   the following option:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PATH_TO_ROOT</tt> – Identify the asset's parent assets up to
--   the root asset. The asset that you specify in <tt>assetId</tt> is the
--   first result in the list of <tt>assetRelationshipSummaries</tt>, and
--   the root asset is the last result.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:traversalType:ListAssetRelationships'] :: ListAssetRelationships -> TraversalType

-- | Create a value of <a>ListAssetRelationships</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListAssetRelationships'</a>,
--   <a>listAssetRelationships_nextToken</a> - The token to be used for the
--   next set of paginated results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListAssetRelationships'</a>,
--   <a>listAssetRelationships_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of
--   results to return for each paginated request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetId:ListAssetRelationships'</a>,
--   <a>listAssetRelationships_assetId</a> - The ID of the asset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:traversalType:ListAssetRelationships'</a>,
--   <a>listAssetRelationships_traversalType</a> - The type of traversal to
--   use to identify asset relationships. Choose the following option:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PATH_TO_ROOT</tt> – Identify the asset's parent assets up to
--   the root asset. The asset that you specify in <tt>assetId</tt> is the
--   first result in the list of <tt>assetRelationshipSummaries</tt>, and
--   the root asset is the last result.</li>
--   </ul>
newListAssetRelationships :: Text -> TraversalType -> ListAssetRelationships

-- | The token to be used for the next set of paginated results.
listAssetRelationships_nextToken :: Lens' ListAssetRelationships (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to return for each paginated request.
listAssetRelationships_maxResults :: Lens' ListAssetRelationships (Maybe Natural)

-- | The ID of the asset.
listAssetRelationships_assetId :: Lens' ListAssetRelationships Text

-- | The type of traversal to use to identify asset relationships. Choose
--   the following option:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PATH_TO_ROOT</tt> – Identify the asset's parent assets up to
--   the root asset. The asset that you specify in <tt>assetId</tt> is the
--   first result in the list of <tt>assetRelationshipSummaries</tt>, and
--   the root asset is the last result.</li>
--   </ul>
listAssetRelationships_traversalType :: Lens' ListAssetRelationships TraversalType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListAssetRelationshipsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ListAssetRelationshipsResponse
ListAssetRelationshipsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> [AssetRelationshipSummary] -> ListAssetRelationshipsResponse

-- | The token for the next set of results, or null if there are no
--   additional results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListAssetRelationshipsResponse'] :: ListAssetRelationshipsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListAssetRelationshipsResponse'] :: ListAssetRelationshipsResponse -> Int

-- | A list that summarizes each asset relationship.
[$sel:assetRelationshipSummaries:ListAssetRelationshipsResponse'] :: ListAssetRelationshipsResponse -> [AssetRelationshipSummary]

-- | Create a value of <a>ListAssetRelationshipsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListAssetRelationships'</a>,
--   <a>listAssetRelationshipsResponse_nextToken</a> - The token for the
--   next set of results, or null if there are no additional results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListAssetRelationshipsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listAssetRelationshipsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetRelationshipSummaries:ListAssetRelationshipsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listAssetRelationshipsResponse_assetRelationshipSummaries</a> - A
--   list that summarizes each asset relationship.
newListAssetRelationshipsResponse :: Int -> ListAssetRelationshipsResponse

--   additional results.
