-- | Get interpolated values for an asset property for a specified time
--   interval, during a period of time. If your time series is missing data
--   points during the specified time interval, you can use interpolation
--   to estimate the missing data.
--   
--   For example, you can use this operation to return the interpolated
--   temperature values for a wind turbine every 24 hours over a duration
--   of 7 days.
--   
--   To identify an asset property, you must specify one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The <tt>assetId</tt> and <tt>propertyId</tt> of an asset
--   property.</li>
--   <li>A <tt>propertyAlias</tt>, which is a data stream alias (for
--   example, <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). To
--   define an asset property's alias, see <a>UpdateAssetProperty</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues
GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Quality -> Natural -> Text -> GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues

-- | The nanosecond offset converted from <tt>startTimeInSeconds</tt>.
[$sel:startTimeOffsetInNanos:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'] :: GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues -> Maybe Natural

-- | The nanosecond offset converted from <tt>endTimeInSeconds</tt>.
[$sel:endTimeOffsetInNanos:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'] :: GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues -> Maybe Natural

-- | The alias that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data
--   stream path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:propertyAlias:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'] :: GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The token to be used for the next set of paginated results.
[$sel:nextToken:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'] :: GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The query interval for the window in seconds. IoT SiteWise computes
--   each interpolated value by using data points from the timestamp of
--   each interval minus the window to the timestamp of each interval plus
--   the window. If not specified, the window is between the start time
--   minus the interval and the end time plus the interval.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you specify a value for the <tt>intervalWindowInSeconds</tt>
--   parameter, the <tt>type</tt> parameter must be
--   <tt>LINEAR_INTERPOLATION</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If no data point is found during the specified query window, IoT
--   SiteWise won't return an interpolated value for the interval. This
--   indicates that there's a gap in the ingested data points.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For example, you can get the interpolated temperature values for a
--   wind turbine every 24 hours over a duration of 7 days. If the
--   interpolation starts on July 1, 2021, at 9 AM with a window of 2
--   hours, IoT SiteWise uses the data points from 7 AM (9 AM - 2 hours) to
--   11 AM (9 AM + 2 hours) on July 2, 2021 to compute the first
--   interpolated value, uses the data points from 7 AM (9 AM - 2 hours) to
--   11 AM (9 AM + 2 hours) on July 3, 2021 to compute the second
--   interpolated value, and so on.
[$sel:intervalWindowInSeconds:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'] :: GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues -> Maybe Natural

-- | The ID of the asset property.
[$sel:propertyId:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'] :: GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the asset.
[$sel:assetId:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'] :: GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to return for each paginated request. If
--   not specified, the default value is 10.
[$sel:maxResults:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'] :: GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues -> Maybe Natural

-- | The exclusive start of the range from which to interpolate data,
--   expressed in seconds in Unix epoch time.
[$sel:startTimeInSeconds:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'] :: GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues -> Natural

-- | The inclusive end of the range from which to interpolate data,
--   expressed in seconds in Unix epoch time.
[$sel:endTimeInSeconds:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'] :: GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues -> Natural

-- | The quality of the asset property value. You can use this parameter as
--   a filter to choose only the asset property values that have a specific
--   quality.
[$sel:quality:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'] :: GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues -> Quality

-- | The time interval in seconds over which to interpolate data. Each
--   interval starts when the previous one ends.
[$sel:intervalInSeconds:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'] :: GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues -> Natural

-- | The interpolation type.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>LINEAR_INTERPOLATION | LOCF_INTERPOLATION</tt>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>LINEAR_INTERPOLATION</tt> – Estimates missing data using
--   <a>linear interpolation</a>.For example, you can use this operation to
--   return the interpolated temperature values for a wind turbine every 24
--   hours over a duration of 7 days. If the interpolation starts on July
--   1, 2021, at 9 AM, IoT SiteWise returns the first interpolated value on
--   July 2, 2021, at 9 AM, the second interpolated value on July 3, 2021,
--   at 9 AM, and so on.</li>
--   <li><tt>LOCF_INTERPOLATION</tt> – Estimates missing data using last
--   observation carried forward interpolationIf no data point is found for
--   an interval, IoT SiteWise returns the last observed data point for the
--   previous interval and carries forward this interpolated value until a
--   new data point is found.For example, you can get the state of an
--   on-off valve every 24 hours over a duration of 7 days. If the
--   interpolation starts on July 1, 2021, at 9 AM, IoT SiteWise returns
--   the last observed data point between July 1, 2021, at 9 AM and July 2,
--   2021, at 9 AM as the first interpolated value. If no data point is
--   found after 9 AM on July 2, 2021, IoT SiteWise uses the same
--   interpolated value for the rest of the days.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:type':GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'] :: GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTimeOffsetInNanos:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_startTimeOffsetInNanos</a> - The
--   nanosecond offset converted from <tt>startTimeInSeconds</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTimeOffsetInNanos:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_endTimeOffsetInNanos</a> - The
--   nanosecond offset converted from <tt>endTimeInSeconds</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyAlias:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_propertyAlias</a> - The alias
--   that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data stream
--   path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_nextToken</a> - The token to be
--   used for the next set of paginated results.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:intervalWindowInSeconds:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_intervalWindowInSeconds</a> -
--   The query interval for the window in seconds. IoT SiteWise computes
--   each interpolated value by using data points from the timestamp of
--   each interval minus the window to the timestamp of each interval plus
--   the window. If not specified, the window is between the start time
--   minus the interval and the end time plus the interval.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you specify a value for the <tt>intervalWindowInSeconds</tt>
--   parameter, the <tt>type</tt> parameter must be
--   <tt>LINEAR_INTERPOLATION</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If no data point is found during the specified query window, IoT
--   SiteWise won't return an interpolated value for the interval. This
--   indicates that there's a gap in the ingested data points.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For example, you can get the interpolated temperature values for a
--   wind turbine every 24 hours over a duration of 7 days. If the
--   interpolation starts on July 1, 2021, at 9 AM with a window of 2
--   hours, IoT SiteWise uses the data points from 7 AM (9 AM - 2 hours) to
--   11 AM (9 AM + 2 hours) on July 2, 2021 to compute the first
--   interpolated value, uses the data points from 7 AM (9 AM - 2 hours) to
--   11 AM (9 AM + 2 hours) on July 3, 2021 to compute the second
--   interpolated value, and so on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyId:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_propertyId</a> - The ID of the
--   asset property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetId:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_assetId</a> - The ID of the
--   asset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_maxResults</a> - The maximum
--   number of results to return for each paginated request. If not
--   specified, the default value is 10.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTimeInSeconds:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_startTimeInSeconds</a> - The
--   exclusive start of the range from which to interpolate data, expressed
--   in seconds in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTimeInSeconds:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_endTimeInSeconds</a> - The
--   inclusive end of the range from which to interpolate data, expressed
--   in seconds in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quality:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_quality</a> - The quality of the
--   asset property value. You can use this parameter as a filter to choose
--   only the asset property values that have a specific quality.
--   
--   <a>$sel:intervalInSeconds:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_intervalInSeconds</a> - The time
--   interval in seconds over which to interpolate data. Each interval
--   starts when the previous one ends.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_type</a> - The interpolation
--   type.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>LINEAR_INTERPOLATION | LOCF_INTERPOLATION</tt>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>LINEAR_INTERPOLATION</tt> – Estimates missing data using
--   <a>linear interpolation</a>.For example, you can use this operation to
--   return the interpolated temperature values for a wind turbine every 24
--   hours over a duration of 7 days. If the interpolation starts on July
--   1, 2021, at 9 AM, IoT SiteWise returns the first interpolated value on
--   July 2, 2021, at 9 AM, the second interpolated value on July 3, 2021,
--   at 9 AM, and so on.</li>
--   <li><tt>LOCF_INTERPOLATION</tt> – Estimates missing data using last
--   observation carried forward interpolationIf no data point is found for
--   an interval, IoT SiteWise returns the last observed data point for the
--   previous interval and carries forward this interpolated value until a
--   new data point is found.For example, you can get the state of an
--   on-off valve every 24 hours over a duration of 7 days. If the
--   interpolation starts on July 1, 2021, at 9 AM, IoT SiteWise returns
--   the last observed data point between July 1, 2021, at 9 AM and July 2,
--   2021, at 9 AM as the first interpolated value. If no data point is
--   found after 9 AM on July 2, 2021, IoT SiteWise uses the same
--   interpolated value for the rest of the days.</li>
--   </ul>
newGetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues :: Natural -> Natural -> Quality -> Natural -> Text -> GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues

-- | The nanosecond offset converted from <tt>startTimeInSeconds</tt>.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_startTimeOffsetInNanos :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues (Maybe Natural)

-- | The nanosecond offset converted from <tt>endTimeInSeconds</tt>.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_endTimeOffsetInNanos :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues (Maybe Natural)

-- | The alias that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data
--   stream path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_propertyAlias :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues (Maybe Text)

-- | The token to be used for the next set of paginated results.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_nextToken :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues (Maybe Text)

-- | The query interval for the window in seconds. IoT SiteWise computes
--   each interpolated value by using data points from the timestamp of
--   each interval minus the window to the timestamp of each interval plus
--   the window. If not specified, the window is between the start time
--   minus the interval and the end time plus the interval.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you specify a value for the <tt>intervalWindowInSeconds</tt>
--   parameter, the <tt>type</tt> parameter must be
--   <tt>LINEAR_INTERPOLATION</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If no data point is found during the specified query window, IoT
--   SiteWise won't return an interpolated value for the interval. This
--   indicates that there's a gap in the ingested data points.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For example, you can get the interpolated temperature values for a
--   wind turbine every 24 hours over a duration of 7 days. If the
--   interpolation starts on July 1, 2021, at 9 AM with a window of 2
--   hours, IoT SiteWise uses the data points from 7 AM (9 AM - 2 hours) to
--   11 AM (9 AM + 2 hours) on July 2, 2021 to compute the first
--   interpolated value, uses the data points from 7 AM (9 AM - 2 hours) to
--   11 AM (9 AM + 2 hours) on July 3, 2021 to compute the second
--   interpolated value, and so on.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_intervalWindowInSeconds :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues (Maybe Natural)

-- | The ID of the asset property.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_propertyId :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the asset.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_assetId :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to return for each paginated request. If
--   not specified, the default value is 10.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_maxResults :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues (Maybe Natural)

-- | The exclusive start of the range from which to interpolate data,
--   expressed in seconds in Unix epoch time.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_startTimeInSeconds :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues Natural

-- | The inclusive end of the range from which to interpolate data,
--   expressed in seconds in Unix epoch time.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_endTimeInSeconds :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues Natural

-- | The quality of the asset property value. You can use this parameter as
--   a filter to choose only the asset property values that have a specific
--   quality.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_quality :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues Quality

-- | The time interval in seconds over which to interpolate data. Each
--   interval starts when the previous one ends.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_intervalInSeconds :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues Natural

-- | The interpolation type.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>LINEAR_INTERPOLATION | LOCF_INTERPOLATION</tt>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>LINEAR_INTERPOLATION</tt> – Estimates missing data using
--   <a>linear interpolation</a>.For example, you can use this operation to
--   return the interpolated temperature values for a wind turbine every 24
--   hours over a duration of 7 days. If the interpolation starts on July
--   1, 2021, at 9 AM, IoT SiteWise returns the first interpolated value on
--   July 2, 2021, at 9 AM, the second interpolated value on July 3, 2021,
--   at 9 AM, and so on.</li>
--   <li><tt>LOCF_INTERPOLATION</tt> – Estimates missing data using last
--   observation carried forward interpolationIf no data point is found for
--   an interval, IoT SiteWise returns the last observed data point for the
--   previous interval and carries forward this interpolated value until a
--   new data point is found.For example, you can get the state of an
--   on-off valve every 24 hours over a duration of 7 days. If the
--   interpolation starts on July 1, 2021, at 9 AM, IoT SiteWise returns
--   the last observed data point between July 1, 2021, at 9 AM and July 2,
--   2021, at 9 AM as the first interpolated value. If no data point is
--   found after 9 AM on July 2, 2021, IoT SiteWise uses the same
--   interpolated value for the rest of the days.</li>
--   </ul>
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_type :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValuesResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

-- | Gets the history of an asset property's values. For more information,
--   see <a>Querying historical values</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   To identify an asset property, you must specify one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The <tt>assetId</tt> and <tt>propertyId</tt> of an asset
--   property.</li>
--   <li>A <tt>propertyAlias</tt>, which is a data stream alias (for
--   example, <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). To
--   define an asset property's alias, see <a>UpdateAssetProperty</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.GetAssetPropertyValueHistory

-- | Gets an asset property's current value. For more information, see

-- | Gets aggregated values for an asset property. For more information,
--   see <a>Querying aggregates</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   To identify an asset property, you must specify one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The <tt>assetId</tt> and <tt>propertyId</tt> of an asset
--   property.</li>
--   <li>A <tt>propertyAlias</tt>, which is a data stream alias (for
--   example, <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). To
--   define an asset property's alias, see <a>UpdateAssetProperty</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.GetAssetPropertyAggregates

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetAssetPropertyAggregates</a> smart constructor.

-- | Disassociates a child asset from the given parent asset through a
--   hierarchy defined in the parent asset's model.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DisassociateAssets

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisassociateAssets</a> smart constructor.
data DisassociateAssets
DisassociateAssets' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> DisassociateAssets

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
[$sel:clientToken:DisassociateAssets'] :: DisassociateAssets -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the parent asset from which to disassociate the child asset.
[$sel:assetId:DisassociateAssets'] :: DisassociateAssets -> Text

-- | The ID of a hierarchy in the parent asset's model. Hierarchies allow
--   different groupings of assets to be formed that all come from the same
--   asset model. You can use the hierarchy ID to identify the correct
--   asset to disassociate. For more information, see <a>Asset
--   hierarchies</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:hierarchyId:DisassociateAssets'] :: DisassociateAssets -> Text

-- | The ID of the child asset to disassociate.
[$sel:childAssetId:DisassociateAssets'] :: DisassociateAssets -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DisassociateAssets</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:DisassociateAssets'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateAssets_clientToken</a> - A unique case-sensitive
--   identifier that you can provide to ensure the idempotency of the
--   request. Don't reuse this client token if a new idempotent request is
--   required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetId:DisassociateAssets'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateAssets_assetId</a> - The ID of the parent asset from
--   which to disassociate the child asset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hierarchyId:DisassociateAssets'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateAssets_hierarchyId</a> - The ID of a hierarchy in the
--   parent asset's model. Hierarchies allow different groupings of assets
--   to be formed that all come from the same asset model. You can use the
--   hierarchy ID to identify the correct asset to disassociate. For more
--   information, see <a>Asset hierarchies</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:childAssetId:DisassociateAssets'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateAssets_childAssetId</a> - The ID of the child asset to
--   disassociate.
newDisassociateAssets :: Text -> Text -> Text -> DisassociateAssets

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
disassociateAssets_clientToken :: Lens' DisassociateAssets (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the parent asset from which to disassociate the child asset.
disassociateAssets_assetId :: Lens' DisassociateAssets Text

-- | The ID of a hierarchy in the parent asset's model. Hierarchies allow
--   different groupings of assets to be formed that all come from the same
--   asset model. You can use the hierarchy ID to identify the correct
--   asset to disassociate. For more information, see <a>Asset
--   hierarchies</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
disassociateAssets_hierarchyId :: Lens' DisassociateAssets Text

-- | Retrieves information about the storage configuration for IoT
--   SiteWise.

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   constructor.
data DescribeStorageConfigurationResponse
DescribeStorageConfigurationResponse' :: Maybe MultiLayerStorage -> Maybe POSIX -> Int -> StorageType -> ConfigurationStatus -> DescribeStorageConfigurationResponse

-- | Contains information about the storage destination.
[$sel:multiLayerStorage:DescribeStorageConfigurationResponse'] :: DescribeStorageConfigurationResponse -> Maybe MultiLayerStorage

-- | The date the storage configuration was last updated, in Unix epoch
--   time.

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeStorageConfigurationResponse'] :: DescribeStorageConfigurationResponse -> Int

-- | The type of storage that you specified for your data. The storage type
--   can be one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>SITEWISE_DEFAULT_STORAGE</tt> – IoT SiteWise replicates your
--   data into a service managed database.</li>
--   <li><tt>MULTI_LAYER_STORAGE</tt> – IoT SiteWise replicates your data
--   into a service managed database and saves a copy of your raw data and
--   metadata in an Amazon S3 object that you specified.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:storageType:DescribeStorageConfigurationResponse'] :: DescribeStorageConfigurationResponse -> StorageType
[$sel:configurationStatus:DescribeStorageConfigurationResponse'] :: DescribeStorageConfigurationResponse -> ConfigurationStatus

-- | Retrieves information about a project.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeProject

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeProject</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeProject
DescribeProject' :: Text -> DescribeProject

-- | The ID of the project.
[$sel:projectId:DescribeProject'] :: DescribeProject -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeProject</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectId:DescribeProject'</a>,
--   <a>describeProject_projectId</a> - The ID of the project.
newDescribeProject :: Text -> DescribeProject

-- | The ID of the project.
describeProject_projectId :: Lens' DescribeProject Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeProjectResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeProjectResponse
DescribeProjectResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> POSIX -> POSIX -> DescribeProjectResponse

-- | The project's description.
[$sel:projectDescription:DescribeProjectResponse'] :: DescribeProjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeProjectResponse'] :: DescribeProjectResponse -> Int

-- | The ID of the project.
[$sel:projectId:DescribeProjectResponse'] :: DescribeProjectResponse -> Text

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the project, which has the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:project/${ProjectId}
--   </pre>
[$sel:projectArn:DescribeProjectResponse'] :: DescribeProjectResponse -> Text

-- | The name of the project.
[$sel:projectName:DescribeProjectResponse'] :: DescribeProjectResponse -> Text

-- | The ID of the portal that the project is in.
[$sel:portalId:DescribeProjectResponse'] :: DescribeProjectResponse -> Text

-- | The date the project was created, in Unix epoch time.
[$sel:projectCreationDate:DescribeProjectResponse'] :: DescribeProjectResponse -> POSIX

-- | The date the project was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
[$sel:projectLastUpdateDate:DescribeProjectResponse'] :: DescribeProjectResponse -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeProjectResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectDescription:DescribeProjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeProjectResponse_projectDescription</a> - The project's
--   description.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeProjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeProjectResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectId:DescribeProject'</a>,
--   <a>describeProjectResponse_projectId</a> - The ID of the project.
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectArn:DescribeProjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeProjectResponse_projectArn</a> - The <a>ARN</a> of the
--   project, which has the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:project/${ProjectId}
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectName:DescribeProjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeProjectResponse_projectName</a> - The name of the project.
--   
--   <a>$sel:portalId:DescribeProjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeProjectResponse_portalId</a> - The ID of the portal that
--   the project is in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectCreationDate:DescribeProjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeProjectResponse_projectCreationDate</a> - The date the
--   project was created, in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectLastUpdateDate:DescribeProjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeProjectResponse_projectLastUpdateDate</a> - The date the
--   project was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
newDescribeProjectResponse :: Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> DescribeProjectResponse

-- | The project's description.
describeProjectResponse_projectDescription :: Lens' DescribeProjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeProjectResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeProjectResponse Int

-- | The ID of the project.
describeProjectResponse_projectId :: Lens' DescribeProjectResponse Text

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the project, which has the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:project/${ProjectId}
--   </pre>
describeProjectResponse_projectArn :: Lens' DescribeProjectResponse Text

-- | The name of the project.
describeProjectResponse_projectName :: Lens' DescribeProjectResponse Text

-- | The ID of the portal that the project is in.
describeProjectResponse_portalId :: Lens' DescribeProjectResponse Text

-- | The date the project was created, in Unix epoch time.
describeProjectResponse_projectCreationDate :: Lens' DescribeProjectResponse UTCTime

-- | The date the project was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
describeProjectResponse_projectLastUpdateDate :: Lens' DescribeProjectResponse UTCTime

-- | Retrieves information about a portal.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribePortal

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribePortal</a> smart constructor.
data DescribePortal
DescribePortal' :: Text -> DescribePortal

-- | The ID of the portal.
[$sel:portalId:DescribePortal'] :: DescribePortal -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribePortal</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:portalId:DescribePortal'</a>, <a>describePortal_portalId</a> -
--   The ID of the portal.
newDescribePortal :: Text -> DescribePortal

-- | The ID of the portal.
describePortal_portalId :: Lens' DescribePortal Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribePortalResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribePortalResponse
DescribePortalResponse' :: Maybe AuthMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ImageLocation -> Maybe Alarms -> Maybe Text -> Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> PortalStatus -> POSIX -> POSIX -> DescribePortalResponse

-- | The service to use to authenticate users to the portal.
[$sel:portalAuthMode:DescribePortalResponse'] :: DescribePortalResponse -> Maybe AuthMode

-- | The portal's description.
[$sel:portalDescription:DescribePortalResponse'] :: DescribePortalResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The email address that sends alarm notifications.
[$sel:notificationSenderEmail:DescribePortalResponse'] :: DescribePortalResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The portal's logo image, which is available at a URL.
[$sel:portalLogoImageLocation:DescribePortalResponse'] :: DescribePortalResponse -> Maybe ImageLocation

-- | Contains the configuration information of an alarm created in an IoT
--   SiteWise Monitor portal.
[$sel:alarms:DescribePortalResponse'] :: DescribePortalResponse -> Maybe Alarms

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the service role that allows the portal's users to
--   access your IoT SiteWise resources on your behalf. For more
--   information, see <a>Using service roles for IoT SiteWise Monitor</a>
--   in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:roleArn:DescribePortalResponse'] :: DescribePortalResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribePortalResponse'] :: DescribePortalResponse -> Int

-- | The ID of the portal.
[$sel:portalId:DescribePortalResponse'] :: DescribePortalResponse -> Text

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the portal, which has the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:portal/${PortalId}
--   </pre>
[$sel:portalArn:DescribePortalResponse'] :: DescribePortalResponse -> Text

-- | The name of the portal.
[$sel:portalName:DescribePortalResponse'] :: DescribePortalResponse -> Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services SSO application generated client ID (used with
--   Amazon Web Services SSO APIs). IoT SiteWise includes
--   <tt>portalClientId</tt> for only portals that use Amazon Web Services
--   SSO to authenticate users.
[$sel:portalClientId:DescribePortalResponse'] :: DescribePortalResponse -> Text

-- | The URL for the IoT SiteWise Monitor portal. You can use this URL to
--   access portals that use Amazon Web Services SSO for authentication.
--   For portals that use IAM for authentication, you must use the IoT
--   SiteWise console to get a URL that you can use to access the portal.
[$sel:portalStartUrl:DescribePortalResponse'] :: DescribePortalResponse -> Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services administrator's contact email address.
[$sel:portalContactEmail:DescribePortalResponse'] :: DescribePortalResponse -> Text

-- | The current status of the portal, which contains a state and any error
--   message.
[$sel:portalStatus:DescribePortalResponse'] :: DescribePortalResponse -> PortalStatus

-- | The date the portal was created, in Unix epoch time.
[$sel:portalCreationDate:DescribePortalResponse'] :: DescribePortalResponse -> POSIX

-- | The date the portal was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
[$sel:portalLastUpdateDate:DescribePortalResponse'] :: DescribePortalResponse -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribePortalResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   description.

--   address that sends alarm notifications.

-- | Retrieves information about a gateway capability configuration. Each
--   gateway capability defines data sources for a gateway. A capability
--   configuration can contain multiple data source configurations. If you
--   define OPC-UA sources for a gateway in the IoT SiteWise console, all
--   of your OPC-UA sources are stored in one capability configuration. To
--   list all capability configurations for a gateway, use
--   <a>DescribeGateway</a>.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration
DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration' :: Text -> Text -> DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration

-- | The ID of the gateway that defines the capability configuration.
[$sel:gatewayId:DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration'] :: DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration -> Text

-- | The namespace of the capability configuration. For example, if you
--   configure OPC-UA sources from the IoT SiteWise console, your OPC-UA
--   capability configuration has the namespace
--   <tt>iotsitewise:opcuacollector:version</tt>, where <tt>version</tt> is
--   a number such as <tt>1</tt>.
[$sel:capabilityNamespace:DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration'] :: DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayId:DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>describeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration_gatewayId</a> - The ID of
--   the gateway that defines the capability configuration.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:capabilityNamespace:DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>describeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration_capabilityNamespace</a> -
--   The namespace of the capability configuration. For example, if you
--   configure OPC-UA sources from the IoT SiteWise console, your OPC-UA
--   capability configuration has the namespace
--   <tt>iotsitewise:opcuacollector:version</tt>, where <tt>version</tt> is
--   a number such as <tt>1</tt>.
newDescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration

-- | The ID of the gateway that defines the capability configuration.
describeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration_gatewayId :: Lens' DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration Text

-- | The namespace of the capability configuration. For example, if you
--   configure OPC-UA sources from the IoT SiteWise console, your OPC-UA
--   capability configuration has the namespace
--   <tt>iotsitewise:opcuacollector:version</tt>, where <tt>version</tt> is
--   a number such as <tt>1</tt>.
describeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration_capabilityNamespace :: Lens' DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse</a>
--   smart constructor.
data DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse
DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse' :: Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CapabilitySyncStatus -> DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse'] :: DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse -> Int

-- | The ID of the gateway that defines the capability configuration.
[$sel:gatewayId:DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse'] :: DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse -> Text

-- | The namespace of the gateway capability.
[$sel:capabilityNamespace:DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse'] :: DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse -> Text

-- | The JSON document that defines the gateway capability's configuration.
--   For more information, see <a>Configuring data sources (CLI)</a> in the
--   <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:capabilityConfiguration:DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse'] :: DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse -> Text

-- | The synchronization status of the capability configuration. The sync
--   status can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt> – The gateway is running the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUT_OF_SYNC</tt> – The gateway hasn't received the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>SYNC_FAILED</tt> – The gateway rejected the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:capabilitySyncStatus:DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse'] :: DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse -> CapabilitySyncStatus

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayId:DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>describeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_gatewayId</a> - The
--   ID of the gateway that defines the capability configuration.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:capabilityNamespace:DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>describeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_capabilityNamespace</a>
--   - The namespace of the gateway capability.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:capabilityConfiguration:DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_capabilityConfiguration</a>
--   - The JSON document that defines the gateway capability's
--   configuration. For more information, see <a>Configuring data sources
--   (CLI)</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:capabilitySyncStatus:DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_capabilitySyncStatus</a>
--   - The synchronization status of the capability configuration. The sync
--   status can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt> – The gateway is running the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUT_OF_SYNC</tt> – The gateway hasn't received the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>SYNC_FAILED</tt> – The gateway rejected the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
newDescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse :: Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CapabilitySyncStatus -> DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
describeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse Int

-- | The ID of the gateway that defines the capability configuration.
describeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_gatewayId :: Lens' DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse Text

-- | The namespace of the gateway capability.
describeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_capabilityNamespace :: Lens' DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse Text

-- | The JSON document that defines the gateway capability's configuration.
--   For more information, see <a>Configuring data sources (CLI)</a> in the
--   <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
describeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_capabilityConfiguration :: Lens' DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse Text

-- | The synchronization status of the capability configuration. The sync
--   status can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt> – The gateway is running the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUT_OF_SYNC</tt> – The gateway hasn't received the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>SYNC_FAILED</tt> – The gateway rejected the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
describeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_capabilitySyncStatus :: Lens' DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse CapabilitySyncStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration.DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration

--   </pre>

-- | A list of gateway capability summaries that each contain a namespace
--   and status. Each gateway capability defines data sources for the
--   gateway. To retrieve a capability configuration's definition, use
--   <a>DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration</a>.
[$sel:gatewayCapabilitySummaries:DescribeGatewayResponse'] :: DescribeGatewayResponse -> [GatewayCapabilitySummary]

-- | Retrieves information about the default encryption configuration for
--   the Amazon Web Services account in the default or specified Region.
--   For more information, see <a>Key management</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise
--   User Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeDefaultEncryptionConfiguration

--   constructor.

--   <tt>ConfigurationState</tt>. If there's an error, it also contains the
--   <tt>ErrorDetails</tt>.

--   <a>DescribeDefaultEncryptionConfigurationResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   encryption if you use <tt>KMS_BASED_ENCRYPTION</tt>.
--

--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeDefaultEncryptionConfigurationResponse'</a>,

-- | Retrieves information about an asset property.
--   
--   When you call this operation for an attribute property, this response
--   includes the default attribute value that you define in the asset
--   model. If you update the default value in the model, this operation's
--   response includes the new default value.
--   
--   This operation doesn't return the value of the asset property. To get
--   the value of an asset property, use <a>GetAssetPropertyValue</a>.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAssetProperty

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeAssetProperty</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeAssetProperty
DescribeAssetProperty' :: Text -> Text -> DescribeAssetProperty

-- | The ID of the asset.
[$sel:assetId:DescribeAssetProperty'] :: DescribeAssetProperty -> Text

-- | The ID of the asset property.
[$sel:propertyId:DescribeAssetProperty'] :: DescribeAssetProperty -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeAssetProperty</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetId:DescribeAssetProperty'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetProperty_assetId</a> - The ID of the asset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyId:DescribeAssetProperty'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetProperty_propertyId</a> - The ID of the asset
--   property.
newDescribeAssetProperty :: Text -> Text -> DescribeAssetProperty

-- | The ID of the asset.
describeAssetProperty_assetId :: Lens' DescribeAssetProperty Text

-- | The ID of the asset property.
describeAssetProperty_propertyId :: Lens' DescribeAssetProperty Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeAssetPropertyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeAssetPropertyResponse
DescribeAssetPropertyResponse' :: Maybe Property -> Maybe CompositeModelProperty -> Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> DescribeAssetPropertyResponse

-- | The asset property's definition, alias, and notification state.
--   
--   This response includes this object for normal asset properties. If you
--   describe an asset property in a composite model, this response
--   includes the asset property information in <tt>compositeModel</tt>.
[$sel:assetProperty:DescribeAssetPropertyResponse'] :: DescribeAssetPropertyResponse -> Maybe Property

-- | The composite asset model that declares this asset property, if this
--   asset property exists in a composite model.
[$sel:compositeModel:DescribeAssetPropertyResponse'] :: DescribeAssetPropertyResponse -> Maybe CompositeModelProperty

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeAssetPropertyResponse'] :: DescribeAssetPropertyResponse -> Int

-- | The ID of the asset.
[$sel:assetId:DescribeAssetPropertyResponse'] :: DescribeAssetPropertyResponse -> Text

-- | The name of the asset.
[$sel:assetName:DescribeAssetPropertyResponse'] :: DescribeAssetPropertyResponse -> Text

-- | The ID of the asset model.
[$sel:assetModelId:DescribeAssetPropertyResponse'] :: DescribeAssetPropertyResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeAssetPropertyResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetProperty:DescribeAssetPropertyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetPropertyResponse_assetProperty</a> - The asset
--   property's definition, alias, and notification state.
--   
--   This response includes this object for normal asset properties. If you
--   describe an asset property in a composite model, this response
--   includes the asset property information in <tt>compositeModel</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:compositeModel:DescribeAssetPropertyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetPropertyResponse_compositeModel</a> - The composite
--   asset model that declares this asset property, if this asset property
--   exists in a composite model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeAssetPropertyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetPropertyResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetId:DescribeAssetProperty'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetPropertyResponse_assetId</a> - The ID of the asset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetName:DescribeAssetPropertyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetPropertyResponse_assetName</a> - The name of the
--   asset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelId:DescribeAssetPropertyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetPropertyResponse_assetModelId</a> - The ID of the
--   asset model.
newDescribeAssetPropertyResponse :: Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> DescribeAssetPropertyResponse

-- | The asset property's definition, alias, and notification state.
--   
--   This response includes this object for normal asset properties. If you
--   describe an asset property in a composite model, this response
--   includes the asset property information in <tt>compositeModel</tt>.
describeAssetPropertyResponse_assetProperty :: Lens' DescribeAssetPropertyResponse (Maybe Property)

-- | The composite asset model that declares this asset property, if this
--   asset property exists in a composite model.
describeAssetPropertyResponse_compositeModel :: Lens' DescribeAssetPropertyResponse (Maybe CompositeModelProperty)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeAssetPropertyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeAssetPropertyResponse Int

-- | The ID of the asset.
describeAssetPropertyResponse_assetId :: Lens' DescribeAssetPropertyResponse Text

-- | The name of the asset.
describeAssetPropertyResponse_assetName :: Lens' DescribeAssetPropertyResponse Text

-- | The ID of the asset model.
describeAssetPropertyResponse_assetModelId :: Lens' DescribeAssetPropertyResponse Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAssetProperty.DescribeAssetProperty
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAssetProperty.DescribeAssetProperty
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAssetProperty.DescribeAssetProperty
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAssetProperty.DescribeAssetProperty
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAssetProperty.DescribeAssetPropertyResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAssetProperty.DescribeAssetPropertyResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAssetProperty.DescribeAssetPropertyResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAssetProperty.DescribeAssetPropertyResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAssetProperty.DescribeAssetProperty

data DescribeAssetModelResponse
DescribeAssetModelResponse' :: Maybe [AssetModelCompositeModel] -> Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> [AssetModelProperty] -> [AssetModelHierarchy] -> POSIX -> POSIX -> AssetModelStatus -> DescribeAssetModelResponse

-- | The list of composite asset models for the asset model.

--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:asset-model/${AssetModelId}
--   </pre>

--

--   models. You can find composite model properties in the
--   <tt>assetModelCompositeModels</tt> object.
[$sel:assetModelProperties:DescribeAssetModelResponse'] :: DescribeAssetModelResponse -> [AssetModelProperty]

-- | A list of asset model hierarchies that each contain a
--   <tt>childAssetModelId</tt> and a <tt>hierarchyId</tt> (named
--   <tt>id</tt>). A hierarchy specifies allowed parent/child asset
--   relationships for an asset model.
[$sel:assetModelHierarchies:DescribeAssetModelResponse'] :: DescribeAssetModelResponse -> [AssetModelHierarchy]

-- | The date the asset model was created, in Unix epoch time.
[$sel:assetModelCreationDate:DescribeAssetModelResponse'] :: DescribeAssetModelResponse -> POSIX

-- | The date the asset model was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
[$sel:assetModelLastUpdateDate:DescribeAssetModelResponse'] :: DescribeAssetModelResponse -> POSIX

-- | The current status of the asset model, which contains a state and any
--   error message.
[$sel:assetModelStatus:DescribeAssetModelResponse'] :: DescribeAssetModelResponse -> AssetModelStatus

--   fields omitted.

-- | Describes an access policy, which specifies an identity's access to an
--   IoT SiteWise Monitor portal or project.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAccessPolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeAccessPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeAccessPolicy
DescribeAccessPolicy' :: Text -> DescribeAccessPolicy

-- | The ID of the access policy.
[$sel:accessPolicyId:DescribeAccessPolicy'] :: DescribeAccessPolicy -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeAccessPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessPolicyId:DescribeAccessPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>describeAccessPolicy_accessPolicyId</a> - The ID of the access
--   policy.
newDescribeAccessPolicy :: Text -> DescribeAccessPolicy

-- | The ID of the access policy.
describeAccessPolicy_accessPolicyId :: Lens' DescribeAccessPolicy Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeAccessPolicyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeAccessPolicyResponse
DescribeAccessPolicyResponse' :: Int -> Text -> Text -> Identity -> Resource -> Permission -> POSIX -> POSIX -> DescribeAccessPolicyResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeAccessPolicyResponse'] :: DescribeAccessPolicyResponse -> Int

-- | The ID of the access policy.
[$sel:accessPolicyId:DescribeAccessPolicyResponse'] :: DescribeAccessPolicyResponse -> Text

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the access policy, which has the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:access-policy/${AccessPolicyId}
--   </pre>
[$sel:accessPolicyArn:DescribeAccessPolicyResponse'] :: DescribeAccessPolicyResponse -> Text

-- | The identity (Amazon Web Services SSO user, Amazon Web Services SSO
--   group, or IAM user) to which this access policy applies.
[$sel:accessPolicyIdentity:DescribeAccessPolicyResponse'] :: DescribeAccessPolicyResponse -> Identity

-- | The IoT SiteWise Monitor resource (portal or project) to which this
--   access policy provides access.
[$sel:accessPolicyResource:DescribeAccessPolicyResponse'] :: DescribeAccessPolicyResponse -> Resource

-- | The access policy permission. Note that a project
--   <tt>ADMINISTRATOR</tt> is also known as a project owner.
[$sel:accessPolicyPermission:DescribeAccessPolicyResponse'] :: DescribeAccessPolicyResponse -> Permission

-- | The date the access policy was created, in Unix epoch time.
[$sel:accessPolicyCreationDate:DescribeAccessPolicyResponse'] :: DescribeAccessPolicyResponse -> POSIX

-- | The date the access policy was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
[$sel:accessPolicyLastUpdateDate:DescribeAccessPolicyResponse'] :: DescribeAccessPolicyResponse -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeAccessPolicyResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeAccessPolicyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAccessPolicyResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessPolicyId:DescribeAccessPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyId</a> - The ID of the
--   access policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessPolicyArn:DescribeAccessPolicyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyArn</a> - The <a>ARN</a>
--   of the access policy, which has the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:access-policy/${AccessPolicyId}
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessPolicyIdentity:DescribeAccessPolicyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyIdentity</a> - The
--   identity (Amazon Web Services SSO user, Amazon Web Services SSO group,
--   or IAM user) to which this access policy applies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessPolicyResource:DescribeAccessPolicyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyResource</a> - The IoT
--   SiteWise Monitor resource (portal or project) to which this access
--   policy provides access.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessPolicyPermission:DescribeAccessPolicyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyPermission</a> - The
--   access policy permission. Note that a project <tt>ADMINISTRATOR</tt>
--   is also known as a project owner.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessPolicyCreationDate:DescribeAccessPolicyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyCreationDate</a> - The
--   date the access policy was created, in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessPolicyLastUpdateDate:DescribeAccessPolicyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyLastUpdateDate</a> - The
--   date the access policy was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
newDescribeAccessPolicyResponse :: Int -> Text -> Text -> Identity -> Resource -> Permission -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> DescribeAccessPolicyResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
describeAccessPolicyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeAccessPolicyResponse Int

-- | The ID of the access policy.
describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyId :: Lens' DescribeAccessPolicyResponse Text

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the access policy, which has the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:access-policy/${AccessPolicyId}
--   </pre>
describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyArn :: Lens' DescribeAccessPolicyResponse Text

-- | The identity (Amazon Web Services SSO user, Amazon Web Services SSO
--   group, or IAM user) to which this access policy applies.
describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyIdentity :: Lens' DescribeAccessPolicyResponse Identity

-- | The IoT SiteWise Monitor resource (portal or project) to which this
--   access policy provides access.
describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyResource :: Lens' DescribeAccessPolicyResponse Resource

-- | The access policy permission. Note that a project
--   <tt>ADMINISTRATOR</tt> is also known as a project owner.
describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyPermission :: Lens' DescribeAccessPolicyResponse Permission

-- | The date the access policy was created, in Unix epoch time.
describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyCreationDate :: Lens' DescribeAccessPolicyResponse UTCTime

-- | The date the access policy was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyLastUpdateDate :: Lens' DescribeAccessPolicyResponse UTCTime
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAccessPolicy.DescribeAccessPolicy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAccessPolicy.DescribeAccessPolicy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAccessPolicy.DescribeAccessPolicy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAccessPolicy.DescribeAccessPolicy
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAccessPolicy.DescribeAccessPolicyResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAccessPolicy.DescribeAccessPolicyResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAccessPolicy.DescribeAccessPolicyResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAccessPolicy.DescribeAccessPolicyResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAccessPolicy.DescribeAccessPolicy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAccessPolicy.DescribeAccessPolicyResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAccessPolicy.DescribeAccessPolicy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAccessPolicy.DescribeAccessPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAccessPolicy.DescribeAccessPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DescribeAccessPolicy.DescribeAccessPolicy

-- | Deletes an asset model. This action can't be undone. You must delete
--   all assets created from an asset model before you can delete the
--   model. Also, you can't delete an asset model if a parent asset model
--   exists that contains a property formula expression that depends on the
--   asset model that you want to delete. For more information, see
--   <a>Deleting assets and models</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DeleteAssetModel

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   identifier that you can provide to ensure the idempotency of the
--   request. Don't reuse this client token if a new idempotent request is
--   required.

--   idempotent request is required.

deleteAssetModel_assetModelId :: Lens' DeleteAssetModel Text

--   error message.

-- | Deletes an asset. This action can't be undone. For more information,
--   see <a>Deleting assets and models</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can't delete an asset that's associated to another asset. For more
--   information, see <a>DisassociateAssets</a>.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.DeleteAsset

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteAsset</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteAsset
DeleteAsset' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> DeleteAsset

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
[$sel:clientToken:DeleteAsset'] :: DeleteAsset -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the asset to delete.
[$sel:assetId:DeleteAsset'] :: DeleteAsset -> Text

--

--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:DeleteAsset'</a>, <a>deleteAsset_clientToken</a> -
--   A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetId:DeleteAsset'</a>, <a>deleteAsset_assetId</a> - The ID
--   of the asset to delete.
newDeleteAsset :: Text -> DeleteAsset

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
deleteAsset_clientToken :: Lens' DeleteAsset (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the asset to delete.
deleteAsset_assetId :: Lens' DeleteAsset Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteAssetResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteAssetResponse
DeleteAssetResponse' :: Int -> AssetStatus -> DeleteAssetResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteAssetResponse'] :: DeleteAssetResponse -> Int

-- | The status of the asset, which contains a state (<tt>DELETING</tt>
--   after successfully calling this operation) and any error message.
[$sel:assetStatus:DeleteAssetResponse'] :: DeleteAssetResponse -> AssetStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteAssetResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteAssetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteAssetResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetStatus:DeleteAssetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteAssetResponse_assetStatus</a> - The status of the asset,
--   which contains a state (<tt>DELETING</tt> after successfully calling
--   this operation) and any error message.
newDeleteAssetResponse :: Int -> AssetStatus -> DeleteAssetResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteAssetResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteAssetResponse Int

--   after successfully calling this operation) and any error message.

-- | Creates a portal, which can contain projects and dashboards. IoT
--   SiteWise Monitor uses Amazon Web Services SSO or IAM to authenticate
--   portal users and manage user permissions.
--   
--   Before you can sign in to a new portal, you must add at least one
--   identity to that portal. For more information, see <a>Adding or
--   removing portal administrators</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.CreatePortal

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreatePortal</a> smart constructor.
data CreatePortal
CreatePortal' :: Maybe AuthMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Alarms -> Maybe ImageFile -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreatePortal

-- | The service to use to authenticate users to the portal. Choose from
--   the following options:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>SSO</tt> – The portal uses Amazon Web Services Single Sign On
--   to authenticate users and manage user permissions. Before you can
--   create a portal that uses Amazon Web Services SSO, you must enable
--   Amazon Web Services SSO. For more information, see <a>Enabling Amazon
--   Web Services SSO</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>. This
--   option is only available in Amazon Web Services Regions other than the
--   China Regions.</li>
--   <li><tt>IAM</tt> – The portal uses Identity and Access Management to
--   authenticate users and manage user permissions. This option is only
--   available in the China Regions.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can't change this value after you create a portal.
--   
--   Default: <tt>SSO</tt>
[$sel:portalAuthMode:CreatePortal'] :: CreatePortal -> Maybe AuthMode

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
[$sel:clientToken:CreatePortal'] :: CreatePortal -> Maybe Text

-- | A description for the portal.
[$sel:portalDescription:CreatePortal'] :: CreatePortal -> Maybe Text

-- | The email address that sends alarm notifications.
--   
--   If you use the <a>IoT Events managed Lambda function</a> to manage
--   your emails, you must <a>verify the sender email address in Amazon
--   SES</a>.
[$sel:notificationSenderEmail:CreatePortal'] :: CreatePortal -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains the configuration information of an alarm created in an IoT
--   SiteWise Monitor portal. You can use the alarm to monitor an asset
--   property and get notified when the asset property value is outside a
--   specified range. For more information, see <a>Monitoring with
--   alarms</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise Application Guide</i>.
[$sel:alarms:CreatePortal'] :: CreatePortal -> Maybe Alarms

-- | A logo image to display in the portal. Upload a square,
--   high-resolution image. The image is displayed on a dark background.
[$sel:portalLogoImageFile:CreatePortal'] :: CreatePortal -> Maybe ImageFile

-- | A list of key-value pairs that contain metadata for the portal. For
--   more information, see <a>Tagging your IoT SiteWise resources</a> in
--   the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:tags:CreatePortal'] :: CreatePortal -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | A friendly name for the portal.
[$sel:portalName:CreatePortal'] :: CreatePortal -> Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services administrator's contact email address.
[$sel:portalContactEmail:CreatePortal'] :: CreatePortal -> Text

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of a service role that allows the portal's users to
--   access your IoT SiteWise resources on your behalf. For more
--   information, see <a>Using service roles for IoT SiteWise Monitor</a>
--   in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:roleArn:CreatePortal'] :: CreatePortal -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreatePortal</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:portalAuthMode:CreatePortal'</a>,
--   <a>createPortal_portalAuthMode</a> - The service to use to
--   authenticate users to the portal. Choose from the following options:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>SSO</tt> – The portal uses Amazon Web Services Single Sign On
--   to authenticate users and manage user permissions. Before you can
--   create a portal that uses Amazon Web Services SSO, you must enable
--   Amazon Web Services SSO. For more information, see <a>Enabling Amazon
--   Web Services SSO</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>. This
--   option is only available in Amazon Web Services Regions other than the
--   China Regions.</li>
--   <li><tt>IAM</tt> – The portal uses Identity and Access Management to
--   authenticate users and manage user permissions. This option is only
--   available in the China Regions.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can't change this value after you create a portal.
--   
--   Default: <tt>SSO</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:CreatePortal'</a>, <a>createPortal_clientToken</a>

--   administrator's contact email address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:CreatePortal'</a>, <a>createPortal_roleArn</a> - The
--   <a>ARN</a> of a service role that allows the portal's users to access
--   your IoT SiteWise resources on your behalf. For more information, see
--   <a>Using service roles for IoT SiteWise Monitor</a> in the <i>IoT
--   SiteWise User Guide</i>.
newCreatePortal :: Text -> Text -> Text -> CreatePortal

-- | The service to use to authenticate users to the portal. Choose from
--   the following options:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>SSO</tt> – The portal uses Amazon Web Services Single Sign On

data CreatePortalResponse
CreatePortalResponse' :: Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> PortalStatus -> Text -> CreatePortalResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreatePortalResponse'] :: CreatePortalResponse -> Int

-- | The ID of the created portal.
[$sel:portalId:CreatePortalResponse'] :: CreatePortalResponse -> Text

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the portal, which has the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:portal/${PortalId}
--   </pre>
[$sel:portalArn:CreatePortalResponse'] :: CreatePortalResponse -> Text

-- | The URL for the IoT SiteWise Monitor portal. You can use this URL to
--   access portals that use Amazon Web Services SSO for authentication.
--   For portals that use IAM for authentication, you must use the IoT
--   SiteWise console to get a URL that you can use to access the portal.
[$sel:portalStartUrl:CreatePortalResponse'] :: CreatePortalResponse -> Text

-- | The status of the portal, which contains a state (<tt>CREATING</tt>
--   after successfully calling this operation) and any error message.
[$sel:portalStatus:CreatePortalResponse'] :: CreatePortalResponse -> PortalStatus

-- | The associated Amazon Web Services SSO application ID, if the portal
--   uses Amazon Web Services SSO.

-- | The ID of the created portal.

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the portal, which has the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:portal/${PortalId}
--   </pre>
createPortalResponse_portalArn :: Lens' CreatePortalResponse Text

-- | The URL for the IoT SiteWise Monitor portal. You can use this URL to
--   access portals that use Amazon Web Services SSO for authentication.
--   For portals that use IAM for authentication, you must use the IoT
--   SiteWise console to get a URL that you can use to access the portal.
createPortalResponse_portalStartUrl :: Lens' CreatePortalResponse Text

-- | The status of the portal, which contains a state (<tt>CREATING</tt>
--   after successfully calling this operation) and any error message.
createPortalResponse_portalStatus :: Lens' CreatePortalResponse PortalStatus

-- | The associated Amazon Web Services SSO application ID, if the portal
--   uses Amazon Web Services SSO.
createPortalResponse_ssoApplicationId :: Lens' CreatePortalResponse Text

-- | Creates an asset model from specified property and hierarchy
--   definitions. You create assets from asset models. With asset models,
--   you can easily create assets of the same type that have standardized
--   definitions. Each asset created from a model inherits the asset
--   model's property and hierarchy definitions. For more information, see
--   <a>Defining asset models</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.CreateAssetModel

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateAssetModel</a> smart constructor.
data CreateAssetModel
CreateAssetModel' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [AssetModelPropertyDefinition] -> Maybe [AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition] -> Maybe [AssetModelHierarchyDefinition] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> CreateAssetModel

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
[$sel:clientToken:CreateAssetModel'] :: CreateAssetModel -> Maybe Text

-- | A description for the asset model.
[$sel:assetModelDescription:CreateAssetModel'] :: CreateAssetModel -> Maybe Text

-- | The property definitions of the asset model. For more information, see
--   <a>Asset properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can specify up to 200 properties per asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:assetModelProperties:CreateAssetModel'] :: CreateAssetModel -> Maybe [AssetModelPropertyDefinition]

-- | The composite asset models that are part of this asset model.
--   Composite asset models are asset models that contain specific
--   properties. Each composite model has a type that defines the
--   properties that the composite model supports. Use composite asset
--   models to define alarms on this asset model.
[$sel:assetModelCompositeModels:CreateAssetModel'] :: CreateAssetModel -> Maybe [AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition]

-- | The hierarchy definitions of the asset model. Each hierarchy specifies
--   an asset model whose assets can be children of any other assets
--   created from this asset model. For more information, see <a>Asset
--   hierarchies</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can specify up to 10 hierarchies per asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:assetModelHierarchies:CreateAssetModel'] :: CreateAssetModel -> Maybe [AssetModelHierarchyDefinition]

-- | A list of key-value pairs that contain metadata for the asset model.
--   For more information, see <a>Tagging your IoT SiteWise resources</a>
--   in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:tags:CreateAssetModel'] :: CreateAssetModel -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | A unique, friendly name for the asset model.
[$sel:assetModelName:CreateAssetModel'] :: CreateAssetModel -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateAssetModel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   asset model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelProperties:CreateAssetModel'</a>,

--   definitions of the asset model. For more information, see <a>Asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can specify up to 200 properties per asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--

--   see <a>Creating assets</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.

-- | Creates an access policy that grants the specified identity (Amazon
--   Web Services SSO user, Amazon Web Services SSO group, or IAM user)
--   access to the specified IoT SiteWise Monitor portal or project
--   resource.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.CreateAccessPolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateAccessPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data CreateAccessPolicy
CreateAccessPolicy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Identity -> Resource -> Permission -> CreateAccessPolicy

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
[$sel:clientToken:CreateAccessPolicy'] :: CreateAccessPolicy -> Maybe Text

--   For more information, see <a>Tagging your IoT SiteWise resources</a>
--   in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:tags:CreateAccessPolicy'] :: CreateAccessPolicy -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The identity for this access policy. Choose an Amazon Web Services SSO
--   user, an Amazon Web Services SSO group, or an IAM user.
[$sel:accessPolicyIdentity:CreateAccessPolicy'] :: CreateAccessPolicy -> Identity

-- | The IoT SiteWise Monitor resource for this access policy. Choose
--   either a portal or a project.
[$sel:accessPolicyResource:CreateAccessPolicy'] :: CreateAccessPolicy -> Resource

-- | The permission level for this access policy. Note that a project
--   <tt>ADMINISTRATOR</tt> is also known as a project owner.
[$sel:accessPolicyPermission:CreateAccessPolicy'] :: CreateAccessPolicy -> Permission

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateAccessPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   identifier that you can provide to ensure the idempotency of the
--   request. Don't reuse this client token if a new idempotent request is
--   required.

--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateAccessPolicy'</a>, <a>createAccessPolicy_tags</a> -
--   A list of key-value pairs that contain metadata for the access policy.
--   For more information, see <a>Tagging your IoT SiteWise resources</a>
--   in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
