-- | Sends a list of asset property values to IoT SiteWise. Each value is a
--   timestamp-quality-value (TQV) data point. For more information, see
--   <a>Ingesting data using the API</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   To identify an asset property, you must specify one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The <tt>assetId</tt> and <tt>propertyId</tt> of an asset
--   property.</li>
--   <li>A <tt>propertyAlias</tt>, which is a data stream alias (for
--   example, <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). To
--   define an asset property's alias, see <a>UpdateAssetProperty</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   With respect to Unix epoch time, IoT SiteWise accepts only TQVs that
--   have a timestamp of no more than 7 days in the past and no more than
--   10 minutes in the future. IoT SiteWise rejects timestamps outside of
--   the inclusive range of [-7 days, +10 minutes] and returns a
--   <tt>TimestampOutOfRangeException</tt> error.
--   
--   For each asset property, IoT SiteWise overwrites TQVs with duplicate
--   timestamps unless the newer TQV has a different quality. For example,
--   if you store a TQV <tt>{T1, GOOD, V1}</tt>, then storing <tt>{T1,
--   GOOD, V2}</tt> replaces the existing TQV.
--   
--   IoT SiteWise authorizes access to each
--   <tt>BatchPutAssetPropertyValue</tt> entry individually. For more
--   information, see <a>BatchPutAssetPropertyValue authorization</a> in
--   the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.BatchPutAssetPropertyValue

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newBatchPutAssetPropertyValue</a> smart constructor.
data BatchPutAssetPropertyValue
BatchPutAssetPropertyValue' :: [PutAssetPropertyValueEntry] -> BatchPutAssetPropertyValue

-- | The list of asset property value entries for the batch put request.
--   You can specify up to 10 entries per request.
[$sel:entries:BatchPutAssetPropertyValue'] :: BatchPutAssetPropertyValue -> [PutAssetPropertyValueEntry]

-- | Create a value of <a>BatchPutAssetPropertyValue</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:entries:BatchPutAssetPropertyValue'</a>,
--   <a>batchPutAssetPropertyValue_entries</a> - The list of asset property
--   value entries for the batch put request. You can specify up to 10
--   entries per request.
newBatchPutAssetPropertyValue :: BatchPutAssetPropertyValue

-- | The list of asset property value entries for the batch put request.
--   You can specify up to 10 entries per request.
batchPutAssetPropertyValue_entries :: Lens' BatchPutAssetPropertyValue [PutAssetPropertyValueEntry]

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newBatchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data BatchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse
BatchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse' :: Int -> [BatchPutAssetPropertyErrorEntry] -> BatchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:BatchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse'] :: BatchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse -> Int

-- | A list of the errors (if any) associated with the batch put request.
--   Each error entry contains the <tt>entryId</tt> of the entry that
--   failed.
[$sel:errorEntries:BatchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse'] :: BatchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse -> [BatchPutAssetPropertyErrorEntry]

-- | Create a value of <a>BatchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:BatchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse'</a>,
--   <a>batchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorEntries:BatchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse'</a>,
--   <a>batchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse_errorEntries</a> - A list of the
--   errors (if any) associated with the batch put request. Each error
--   entry contains the <tt>entryId</tt> of the entry that failed.
newBatchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse :: Int -> BatchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
batchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' BatchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse Int

-- | A list of the errors (if any) associated with the batch put request.
--   Each error entry contains the <tt>entryId</tt> of the entry that
--   failed.
batchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse_errorEntries :: Lens' BatchPutAssetPropertyValueResponse [BatchPutAssetPropertyErrorEntry]

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.BatchPutAssetPropertyValue.BatchPutAssetPropertyValue
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.BatchPutAssetPropertyValue.BatchPutAssetPropertyValue

-- | The ID of the project from which to disassociate the assets.

--   project.

-- | Associates a child asset with the given parent asset through a
--   hierarchy defined in the parent asset's model. For more information,
--   see <a>Associating assets</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.AssociateAssets

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAssociateAssets</a> smart constructor.
data AssociateAssets
AssociateAssets' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> AssociateAssets

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
[$sel:clientToken:AssociateAssets'] :: AssociateAssets -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the parent asset.
[$sel:assetId:AssociateAssets'] :: AssociateAssets -> Text

-- | The ID of a hierarchy in the parent asset's model. Hierarchies allow
--   different groupings of assets to be formed that all come from the same
--   asset model. For more information, see <a>Asset hierarchies</a> in the
--   <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:hierarchyId:AssociateAssets'] :: AssociateAssets -> Text

-- | The ID of the child asset to be associated.
[$sel:childAssetId:AssociateAssets'] :: AssociateAssets -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AssociateAssets</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:AssociateAssets'</a>,
--   <a>associateAssets_clientToken</a> - A unique case-sensitive
--   identifier that you can provide to ensure the idempotency of the
--   request. Don't reuse this client token if a new idempotent request is
--   required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetId:AssociateAssets'</a>, <a>associateAssets_assetId</a> -
--   The ID of the parent asset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hierarchyId:AssociateAssets'</a>,
--   <a>associateAssets_hierarchyId</a> - The ID of a hierarchy in the
--   parent asset's model. Hierarchies allow different groupings of assets
--   to be formed that all come from the same asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Asset hierarchies</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:childAssetId:AssociateAssets'</a>,
--   <a>associateAssets_childAssetId</a> - The ID of the child asset to be
--   associated.
newAssociateAssets :: Text -> Text -> Text -> AssociateAssets

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
associateAssets_clientToken :: Lens' AssociateAssets (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the parent asset.
associateAssets_assetId :: Lens' AssociateAssets Text

-- | The ID of a hierarchy in the parent asset's model. Hierarchies allow
--   different groupings of assets to be formed that all come from the same
--   asset model. For more information, see <a>Asset hierarchies</a> in the
--   <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
associateAssets_hierarchyId :: Lens' AssociateAssets Text

-- | The ID of the child asset to be associated.
associateAssets_childAssetId :: Lens' AssociateAssets Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAssociateAssetsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data AssociateAssetsResponse
AssociateAssetsResponse' :: AssociateAssetsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>AssociateAssetsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

-- | Removes a tag from an IoT SiteWise resource.

--   untag.

--   list of keys for tags to remove from the resource.

-- | Updates an existing access policy that specifies an identity's access
--   to an IoT SiteWise Monitor portal or project resource.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.UpdateAccessPolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateAccessPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateAccessPolicy
UpdateAccessPolicy' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Identity -> Resource -> Permission -> UpdateAccessPolicy

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
[$sel:clientToken:UpdateAccessPolicy'] :: UpdateAccessPolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the access policy.
[$sel:accessPolicyId:UpdateAccessPolicy'] :: UpdateAccessPolicy -> Text

-- | The identity for this access policy. Choose an Amazon Web Services SSO
--   user, an Amazon Web Services SSO group, or an IAM user.
[$sel:accessPolicyIdentity:UpdateAccessPolicy'] :: UpdateAccessPolicy -> Identity

-- | The IoT SiteWise Monitor resource for this access policy. Choose
--   either a portal or a project.
[$sel:accessPolicyResource:UpdateAccessPolicy'] :: UpdateAccessPolicy -> Resource

-- | The permission level for this access policy. Note that a project
--   <tt>ADMINISTRATOR</tt> is also known as a project owner.
[$sel:accessPolicyPermission:UpdateAccessPolicy'] :: UpdateAccessPolicy -> Permission

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateAccessPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:UpdateAccessPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccessPolicy_clientToken</a> - A unique case-sensitive
--   identifier that you can provide to ensure the idempotency of the
--   request. Don't reuse this client token if a new idempotent request is
--   required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessPolicyId:UpdateAccessPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccessPolicy_accessPolicyId</a> - The ID of the access
--   policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessPolicyIdentity:UpdateAccessPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccessPolicy_accessPolicyIdentity</a> - The identity for this
--   access policy. Choose an Amazon Web Services SSO user, an Amazon Web
--   Services SSO group, or an IAM user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessPolicyResource:UpdateAccessPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccessPolicy_accessPolicyResource</a> - The IoT SiteWise
--   Monitor resource for this access policy. Choose either a portal or a
--   project.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessPolicyPermission:UpdateAccessPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccessPolicy_accessPolicyPermission</a> - The permission
--   level for this access policy. Note that a project
--   <tt>ADMINISTRATOR</tt> is also known as a project owner.
newUpdateAccessPolicy :: Text -> Identity -> Resource -> Permission -> UpdateAccessPolicy

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
updateAccessPolicy_clientToken :: Lens' UpdateAccessPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the access policy.
updateAccessPolicy_accessPolicyId :: Lens' UpdateAccessPolicy Text

-- | The identity for this access policy. Choose an Amazon Web Services SSO
--   user, an Amazon Web Services SSO group, or an IAM user.
updateAccessPolicy_accessPolicyIdentity :: Lens' UpdateAccessPolicy Identity

-- | The IoT SiteWise Monitor resource for this access policy. Choose
--   either a portal or a project.
updateAccessPolicy_accessPolicyResource :: Lens' UpdateAccessPolicy Resource

-- | The permission level for this access policy. Note that a project
--   <tt>ADMINISTRATOR</tt> is also known as a project owner.
updateAccessPolicy_accessPolicyPermission :: Lens' UpdateAccessPolicy Permission

-- | Updates an asset's name. For more information, see <a>Updating assets
--   and models</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.UpdateAsset

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateAsset</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateAsset
UpdateAsset' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdateAsset

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
[$sel:clientToken:UpdateAsset'] :: UpdateAsset -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the asset to update.
[$sel:assetId:UpdateAsset'] :: UpdateAsset -> Text

-- | A unique, friendly name for the asset.
[$sel:assetName:UpdateAsset'] :: UpdateAsset -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateAsset</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:UpdateAsset'</a>, <a>updateAsset_clientToken</a> -
--   A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetId:UpdateAsset'</a>, <a>updateAsset_assetId</a> - The ID
--   of the asset to update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetName:UpdateAsset'</a>, <a>updateAsset_assetName</a> - A
--   unique, friendly name for the asset.
newUpdateAsset :: Text -> Text -> UpdateAsset

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
updateAsset_clientToken :: Lens' UpdateAsset (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the asset to update.
updateAsset_assetId :: Lens' UpdateAsset Text

-- | A unique, friendly name for the asset.
updateAsset_assetName :: Lens' UpdateAsset Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateAssetResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateAssetResponse
UpdateAssetResponse' :: Int -> AssetStatus -> UpdateAssetResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateAssetResponse'] :: UpdateAssetResponse -> Int

-- | The status of the asset, which contains a state (<tt>UPDATING</tt>
--   after successfully calling this operation) and any error message.
[$sel:assetStatus:UpdateAssetResponse'] :: UpdateAssetResponse -> AssetStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateAssetResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>updateAssetResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetStatus:UpdateAssetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateAssetResponse_assetStatus</a> - The status of the asset,
--   which contains a state (<tt>UPDATING</tt> after successfully calling

-- | Updates an asset model and all of the assets that were created from
--   the model. Each asset created from the model inherits the updated
--   asset model's property and hierarchy definitions. For more
--   information, see <a>Updating assets and models</a> in the <i>IoT
--   SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   This operation overwrites the existing model with the provided model.
--   To avoid deleting your asset model's properties or hierarchies, you
--   must include their IDs and definitions in the updated asset model
--   payload. For more information, see <a>DescribeAssetModel</a>.
--   
--   If you remove a property from an asset model, IoT SiteWise deletes all
--   previous data for that property. If you remove a hierarchy definition
--   from an asset model, IoT SiteWise disassociates every asset associated
--   with that hierarchy. You can't change the type or data type of an
--   existing property.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.UpdateAssetModel

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateAssetModel</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateAssetModel
UpdateAssetModel' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [AssetModelProperty] -> Maybe [AssetModelCompositeModel] -> Maybe [AssetModelHierarchy] -> Text -> Text -> UpdateAssetModel

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
[$sel:clientToken:UpdateAssetModel'] :: UpdateAssetModel -> Maybe Text

-- | A description for the asset model.
[$sel:assetModelDescription:UpdateAssetModel'] :: UpdateAssetModel -> Maybe Text

-- | The updated property definitions of the asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Asset properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can specify up to 200 properties per asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:assetModelProperties:UpdateAssetModel'] :: UpdateAssetModel -> Maybe [AssetModelProperty]

-- | The composite asset models that are part of this asset model.
--   Composite asset models are asset models that contain specific
--   properties. Each composite model has a type that defines the
--   properties that the composite model supports. Use composite asset
--   models to define alarms on this asset model.
[$sel:assetModelCompositeModels:UpdateAssetModel'] :: UpdateAssetModel -> Maybe [AssetModelCompositeModel]

-- | The updated hierarchy definitions of the asset model. Each hierarchy
--   specifies an asset model whose assets can be children of any other
--   assets created from this asset model. For more information, see
--   <a>Asset hierarchies</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can specify up to 10 hierarchies per asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:assetModelHierarchies:UpdateAssetModel'] :: UpdateAssetModel -> Maybe [AssetModelHierarchy]

-- | The ID of the asset model to update.
[$sel:assetModelId:UpdateAssetModel'] :: UpdateAssetModel -> Text

-- | A unique, friendly name for the asset model.
[$sel:assetModelName:UpdateAssetModel'] :: UpdateAssetModel -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateAssetModel</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:UpdateAssetModel'</a>,
--   <a>updateAssetModel_clientToken</a> - A unique case-sensitive
--   identifier that you can provide to ensure the idempotency of the
--   request. Don't reuse this client token if a new idempotent request is
--   required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelDescription:UpdateAssetModel'</a>,
--   <a>updateAssetModel_assetModelDescription</a> - A description for the
--   asset model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelProperties:UpdateAssetModel'</a>,
--   <a>updateAssetModel_assetModelProperties</a> - The updated property
--   definitions of the asset model. For more information, see <a>Asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can specify up to 200 properties per asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelCompositeModels:UpdateAssetModel'</a>,
--   <a>updateAssetModel_assetModelCompositeModels</a> - The composite
--   asset models that are part of this asset model. Composite asset models
--   are asset models that contain specific properties. Each composite
--   model has a type that defines the properties that the composite model
--   supports. Use composite asset models to define alarms on this asset
--   model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelHierarchies:UpdateAssetModel'</a>,
--   <a>updateAssetModel_assetModelHierarchies</a> - The updated hierarchy
--   definitions of the asset model. Each hierarchy specifies an asset
--   model whose assets can be children of any other assets created from
--   this asset model. For more information, see <a>Asset hierarchies</a>
--   in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can specify up to 10 hierarchies per asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelId:UpdateAssetModel'</a>,
--   <a>updateAssetModel_assetModelId</a> - The ID of the asset model to
--   update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelName:UpdateAssetModel'</a>,
--   <a>updateAssetModel_assetModelName</a> - A unique, friendly name for
--   the asset model.
newUpdateAssetModel :: Text -> Text -> UpdateAssetModel

--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
updateAssetModel_clientToken :: Lens' UpdateAssetModel (Maybe Text)

-- | A description for the asset model.
updateAssetModel_assetModelDescription :: Lens' UpdateAssetModel (Maybe Text)

-- | The updated property definitions of the asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Asset properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can specify up to 200 properties per asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
updateAssetModel_assetModelProperties :: Lens' UpdateAssetModel (Maybe [AssetModelProperty])

-- | The composite asset models that are part of this asset model.
--   Composite asset models are asset models that contain specific
--   properties. Each composite model has a type that defines the
--   properties that the composite model supports. Use composite asset
--   models to define alarms on this asset model.
updateAssetModel_assetModelCompositeModels :: Lens' UpdateAssetModel (Maybe [AssetModelCompositeModel])

-- | The updated hierarchy definitions of the asset model. Each hierarchy
--   specifies an asset model whose assets can be children of any other
--   assets created from this asset model. For more information, see
--   <a>Asset hierarchies</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can specify up to 10 hierarchies per asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
updateAssetModel_assetModelHierarchies :: Lens' UpdateAssetModel (Maybe [AssetModelHierarchy])

-- | The ID of the asset model to update.
updateAssetModel_assetModelId :: Lens' UpdateAssetModel Text

-- | A unique, friendly name for the asset model.
updateAssetModel_assetModelName :: Lens' UpdateAssetModel Text

-- | Updates an asset property's alias and notification state.
--   
--   This operation overwrites the property's existing alias and
--   notification state. To keep your existing property's alias or
--   notification state, you must include the existing values in the
--   UpdateAssetProperty request. For more information, see
--   <a>DescribeAssetProperty</a>.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.UpdateAssetProperty

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateAssetProperty</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateAssetProperty
UpdateAssetProperty' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe PropertyNotificationState -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdateAssetProperty

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
[$sel:clientToken:UpdateAssetProperty'] :: UpdateAssetProperty -> Maybe Text

-- | The MQTT notification state (enabled or disabled) for this asset
--   property. When the notification state is enabled, IoT SiteWise
--   publishes property value updates to a unique MQTT topic. For more
--   information, see <a>Interacting with other services</a> in the <i>IoT
--   SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If you omit this parameter, the notification state is set to
--   <tt>DISABLED</tt>.
[$sel:propertyNotificationState:UpdateAssetProperty'] :: UpdateAssetProperty -> Maybe PropertyNotificationState

-- | The alias that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data
--   stream path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If you omit this parameter, the alias is removed from the property.
[$sel:propertyAlias:UpdateAssetProperty'] :: UpdateAssetProperty -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the asset to be updated.
[$sel:assetId:UpdateAssetProperty'] :: UpdateAssetProperty -> Text

-- | The ID of the asset property to be updated.
[$sel:propertyId:UpdateAssetProperty'] :: UpdateAssetProperty -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateAssetProperty</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:UpdateAssetProperty'</a>,
--   <a>updateAssetProperty_clientToken</a> - A unique case-sensitive
--   identifier that you can provide to ensure the idempotency of the
--   request. Don't reuse this client token if a new idempotent request is
--   required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyNotificationState:UpdateAssetProperty'</a>,
--   <a>updateAssetProperty_propertyNotificationState</a> - The MQTT
--   notification state (enabled or disabled) for this asset property. When
--   the notification state is enabled, IoT SiteWise publishes property
--   value updates to a unique MQTT topic. For more information, see
--   <a>Interacting with other services</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   If you omit this parameter, the notification state is set to
--   <tt>DISABLED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyAlias:UpdateAssetProperty'</a>,
--   <a>updateAssetProperty_propertyAlias</a> - The alias that identifies
--   the property, such as an OPC-UA server data stream path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If you omit this parameter, the alias is removed from the property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetId:UpdateAssetProperty'</a>,
--   <a>updateAssetProperty_assetId</a> - The ID of the asset to be
--   updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyId:UpdateAssetProperty'</a>,
--   <a>updateAssetProperty_propertyId</a> - The ID of the asset property
--   to be updated.
newUpdateAssetProperty :: Text -> Text -> UpdateAssetProperty

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
updateAssetProperty_clientToken :: Lens' UpdateAssetProperty (Maybe Text)

-- | The MQTT notification state (enabled or disabled) for this asset
--   property. When the notification state is enabled, IoT SiteWise
--   publishes property value updates to a unique MQTT topic. For more
--   information, see <a>Interacting with other services</a> in the <i>IoT
--   SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If you omit this parameter, the notification state is set to
--   <tt>DISABLED</tt>.
updateAssetProperty_propertyNotificationState :: Lens' UpdateAssetProperty (Maybe PropertyNotificationState)

-- | The alias that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data
--   stream path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If you omit this parameter, the alias is removed from the property.
updateAssetProperty_propertyAlias :: Lens' UpdateAssetProperty (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the asset to be updated.
updateAssetProperty_assetId :: Lens' UpdateAssetProperty Text

-- | The ID of the asset property to be updated.
updateAssetProperty_propertyId :: Lens' UpdateAssetProperty Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateAssetPropertyResponse</a> smart constructor.

UpdateAssetPropertyResponse' :: UpdateAssetPropertyResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateAssetPropertyResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   fields.

-- | Updates a gateway's name.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.UpdateGateway

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateGateway</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateGateway
UpdateGateway' :: Text -> Text -> UpdateGateway

-- | The ID of the gateway to update.
[$sel:gatewayId:UpdateGateway'] :: UpdateGateway -> Text

-- | A unique, friendly name for the gateway.
[$sel:gatewayName:UpdateGateway'] :: UpdateGateway -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateGateway</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayId:UpdateGateway'</a>, <a>updateGateway_gatewayId</a> -
--   The ID of the gateway to update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayName:UpdateGateway'</a>,
--   <a>updateGateway_gatewayName</a> - A unique, friendly name for the
--   gateway.
newUpdateGateway :: Text -> Text -> UpdateGateway

-- | The ID of the gateway to update.
updateGateway_gatewayId :: Lens' UpdateGateway Text

-- | A unique, friendly name for the gateway.
updateGateway_gatewayName :: Lens' UpdateGateway Text

UpdateGatewayResponse' :: UpdateGatewayResponse

--   fields omitted.

--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newUpdateGatewayResponse :: UpdateGatewayResponse

-- | Updates a gateway capability configuration or defines a new capability
--   configuration. Each gateway capability defines data sources for a
--   gateway. A capability configuration can contain multiple data source
--   configurations. If you define OPC-UA sources for a gateway in the IoT
--   SiteWise console, all of your OPC-UA sources are stored in one
--   capability configuration. To list all capability configurations for a
--   gateway, use <a>DescribeGateway</a>.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration
UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration

-- | The ID of the gateway to be updated.
[$sel:gatewayId:UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration'] :: UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration -> Text

-- | The namespace of the gateway capability configuration to be updated.
--   For example, if you configure OPC-UA sources from the IoT SiteWise
--   console, your OPC-UA capability configuration has the namespace
--   <tt>iotsitewise:opcuacollector:version</tt>, where <tt>version</tt> is
--   a number such as <tt>1</tt>.
[$sel:capabilityNamespace:UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration'] :: UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration -> Text

-- | The JSON document that defines the configuration for the gateway
--   capability. For more information, see <a>Configuring data sources
--   (CLI)</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:capabilityConfiguration:UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration'] :: UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayId:UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration_gatewayId</a> - The ID of the
--   gateway to be updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:capabilityNamespace:UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration_capabilityNamespace</a> - The
--   namespace of the gateway capability configuration to be updated. For
--   example, if you configure OPC-UA sources from the IoT SiteWise
--   console, your OPC-UA capability configuration has the namespace
--   <tt>iotsitewise:opcuacollector:version</tt>, where <tt>version</tt> is
--   a number such as <tt>1</tt>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:capabilityConfiguration:UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration_capabilityConfiguration</a> -
--   The JSON document that defines the configuration for the gateway
--   capability. For more information, see <a>Configuring data sources
--   (CLI)</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
newUpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration

-- | The ID of the gateway to be updated.
updateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration_gatewayId :: Lens' UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration Text

-- | The namespace of the gateway capability configuration to be updated.
--   For example, if you configure OPC-UA sources from the IoT SiteWise
--   console, your OPC-UA capability configuration has the namespace
--   <tt>iotsitewise:opcuacollector:version</tt>, where <tt>version</tt> is
--   a number such as <tt>1</tt>.
updateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration_capabilityNamespace :: Lens' UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration Text

-- | The JSON document that defines the configuration for the gateway
--   capability. For more information, see <a>Configuring data sources
--   (CLI)</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
updateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration_capabilityConfiguration :: Lens' UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse</a>
--   smart constructor.
data UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse
UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse' :: Int -> Text -> CapabilitySyncStatus -> UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse'] :: UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse -> Int

-- | The namespace of the gateway capability.
[$sel:capabilityNamespace:UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse'] :: UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse -> Text

-- | The synchronization status of the capability configuration. The sync
--   status can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt> – The gateway is running the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUT_OF_SYNC</tt> – The gateway hasn't received the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>SYNC_FAILED</tt> – The gateway rejected the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   After you update a capability configuration, its sync status is
--   <tt>OUT_OF_SYNC</tt> until the gateway receives and applies or rejects
--   the updated configuration.
[$sel:capabilitySyncStatus:UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse'] :: UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse -> CapabilitySyncStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:capabilityNamespace:UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_capabilityNamespace</a>
--   - The namespace of the gateway capability.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:capabilitySyncStatus:UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_capabilitySyncStatus</a>
--   - The synchronization status of the capability configuration. The sync
--   status can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt> – The gateway is running the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUT_OF_SYNC</tt> – The gateway hasn't received the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>SYNC_FAILED</tt> – The gateway rejected the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   After you update a capability configuration, its sync status is
--   <tt>OUT_OF_SYNC</tt> until the gateway receives and applies or rejects
--   the updated configuration.
newUpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse :: Int -> Text -> CapabilitySyncStatus -> UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
updateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse Int

-- | The namespace of the gateway capability.
updateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_capabilityNamespace :: Lens' UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse Text

-- | The synchronization status of the capability configuration. The sync
--   status can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt> – The gateway is running the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUT_OF_SYNC</tt> – The gateway hasn't received the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>SYNC_FAILED</tt> – The gateway rejected the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   After you update a capability configuration, its sync status is
--   <tt>OUT_OF_SYNC</tt> until the gateway receives and applies or rejects
--   the updated configuration.
updateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_capabilitySyncStatus :: Lens' UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse CapabilitySyncStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration.UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration.UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration.UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration.UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration

-- | Updates an IoT SiteWise Monitor portal.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.UpdatePortal

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdatePortal</a> smart constructor.
data UpdatePortal
UpdatePortal' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Image -> Maybe Alarms -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdatePortal

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
[$sel:clientToken:UpdatePortal'] :: UpdatePortal -> Maybe Text

-- | A new description for the portal.
[$sel:portalDescription:UpdatePortal'] :: UpdatePortal -> Maybe Text

-- | The email address that sends alarm notifications.
[$sel:notificationSenderEmail:UpdatePortal'] :: UpdatePortal -> Maybe Text
[$sel:portalLogoImage:UpdatePortal'] :: UpdatePortal -> Maybe Image

-- | Contains the configuration information of an alarm created in an IoT
--   SiteWise Monitor portal. You can use the alarm to monitor an asset
--   property and get notified when the asset property value is outside a
--   specified range. For more information, see <a>Monitoring with
--   alarms</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise Application Guide</i>.
[$sel:alarms:UpdatePortal'] :: UpdatePortal -> Maybe Alarms

-- | The ID of the portal to update.
[$sel:portalId:UpdatePortal'] :: UpdatePortal -> Text

-- | A new friendly name for the portal.
[$sel:portalName:UpdatePortal'] :: UpdatePortal -> Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services administrator's contact email address.
[$sel:portalContactEmail:UpdatePortal'] :: UpdatePortal -> Text

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of a service role that allows the portal's users to
--   access your IoT SiteWise resources on your behalf. For more
--   information, see <a>Using service roles for IoT SiteWise Monitor</a>
--   in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
[$sel:roleArn:UpdatePortal'] :: UpdatePortal -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdatePortal</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:UpdatePortal'</a>, <a>updatePortal_clientToken</a>
--   - A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure
--   the idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:portalDescription:UpdatePortal'</a>,
--   <a>updatePortal_portalDescription</a> - A new description for the
--   portal.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationSenderEmail:UpdatePortal'</a>,
--   <a>updatePortal_notificationSenderEmail</a> - The email address that
--   sends alarm notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:portalLogoImage:UpdatePortal'</a>,
--   <a>updatePortal_portalLogoImage</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alarms:UpdatePortal'</a>, <a>updatePortal_alarms</a> -
--   Contains the configuration information of an alarm created in an IoT
--   SiteWise Monitor portal. You can use the alarm to monitor an asset
--   property and get notified when the asset property value is outside a
--   specified range. For more information, see <a>Monitoring with
--   alarms</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise Application Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:portalId:UpdatePortal'</a>, <a>updatePortal_portalId</a> - The
--   ID of the portal to update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:portalName:UpdatePortal'</a>, <a>updatePortal_portalName</a> -
--   A new friendly name for the portal.
--   
--   <a>$sel:portalContactEmail:UpdatePortal'</a>,
--   <a>updatePortal_portalContactEmail</a> - The Amazon Web Services
--   administrator's contact email address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleArn:UpdatePortal'</a>, <a>updatePortal_roleArn</a> - The
--   <a>ARN</a> of a service role that allows the portal's users to access
--   your IoT SiteWise resources on your behalf. For more information, see
--   <a>Using service roles for IoT SiteWise Monitor</a> in the <i>IoT
--   SiteWise User Guide</i>.
newUpdatePortal :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdatePortal

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
updatePortal_clientToken :: Lens' UpdatePortal (Maybe Text)

-- | A new description for the portal.
updatePortal_portalDescription :: Lens' UpdatePortal (Maybe Text)

-- | The email address that sends alarm notifications.
updatePortal_notificationSenderEmail :: Lens' UpdatePortal (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
updatePortal_portalLogoImage :: Lens' UpdatePortal (Maybe Image)

-- | Contains the configuration information of an alarm created in an IoT
--   SiteWise Monitor portal. You can use the alarm to monitor an asset
--   property and get notified when the asset property value is outside a
--   specified range. For more information, see <a>Monitoring with
--   alarms</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise Application Guide</i>.
updatePortal_alarms :: Lens' UpdatePortal (Maybe Alarms)

-- | The ID of the portal to update.
updatePortal_portalId :: Lens' UpdatePortal Text

-- | A new friendly name for the portal.
updatePortal_portalName :: Lens' UpdatePortal Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services administrator's contact email address.
updatePortal_portalContactEmail :: Lens' UpdatePortal Text

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of a service role that allows the portal's users to
--   access your IoT SiteWise resources on your behalf. For more
--   information, see <a>Using service roles for IoT SiteWise Monitor</a>
--   in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
updatePortal_roleArn :: Lens' UpdatePortal Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdatePortalResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdatePortalResponse

--   which contains a state (<tt>UPDATING</tt> after successfully calling

-- | Updates an IoT SiteWise Monitor project.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.UpdateProject

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateProject</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateProject
UpdateProject' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdateProject

-- | A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
[$sel:clientToken:UpdateProject'] :: UpdateProject -> Maybe Text

-- | A new description for the project.
[$sel:projectDescription:UpdateProject'] :: UpdateProject -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the project to update.
[$sel:projectId:UpdateProject'] :: UpdateProject -> Text

-- | A new friendly name for the project.
[$sel:projectName:UpdateProject'] :: UpdateProject -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateProject</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:UpdateProject'</a>,
--   <a>updateProject_clientToken</a> - A unique case-sensitive identifier
--   that you can provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Don't
--   reuse this client token if a new idempotent request is required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectDescription:UpdateProject'</a>,
--   <a>updateProject_projectDescription</a> - A new description for the
--   project.
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectId:UpdateProject'</a>, <a>updateProject_projectId</a> -
--   The ID of the project to update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectName:UpdateProject'</a>,
--   <a>updateProject_projectName</a> - A new friendly name for the
--   project.

updateProject_projectId :: Lens' UpdateProject Text

-- | A new friendly name for the project.
updateProject_projectName :: Lens' UpdateProject Text

module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Lens

-- | The token to be used for the next set of paginated results.
listProjects_nextToken :: Lens' ListProjects (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to return for each paginated request.
--   
--   Default: 50
listProjects_maxResults :: Lens' ListProjects (Maybe Natural)

-- | The ID of the portal.
listProjects_portalId :: Lens' ListProjects Text

-- | The token for the next set of results, or null if there are no
--   additional results.
listProjectsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListProjectsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listProjectsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListProjectsResponse Int

-- | A list that summarizes each project in the portal.
listProjectsResponse_projectSummaries :: Lens' ListProjectsResponse [ProjectSummary]

--

--   <li><tt>CHILD</tt> – The list includes all child assets associated to

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the access policy, which has the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:access-policy/${AccessPolicyId}
--   </pre>
describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyArn :: Lens' DescribeAccessPolicyResponse Text

-- | The identity (Amazon Web Services SSO user, Amazon Web Services SSO
--   group, or IAM user) to which this access policy applies.
describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyIdentity :: Lens' DescribeAccessPolicyResponse Identity

-- | The IoT SiteWise Monitor resource (portal or project) to which this
--   access policy provides access.
describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyResource :: Lens' DescribeAccessPolicyResponse Resource

-- | The access policy permission. Note that a project
--   <tt>ADMINISTRATOR</tt> is also known as a project owner.
describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyPermission :: Lens' DescribeAccessPolicyResponse Permission

-- | The date the access policy was created, in Unix epoch time.
describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyCreationDate :: Lens' DescribeAccessPolicyResponse UTCTime

-- | The date the access policy was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
describeAccessPolicyResponse_accessPolicyLastUpdateDate :: Lens' DescribeAccessPolicyResponse UTCTime

-- | The nanosecond offset converted from <tt>startTimeInSeconds</tt>.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_startTimeOffsetInNanos :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues (Maybe Natural)

-- | The nanosecond offset converted from <tt>endTimeInSeconds</tt>.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_endTimeOffsetInNanos :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues (Maybe Natural)

-- | The alias that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data
--   stream path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_propertyAlias :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues (Maybe Text)

-- | The token to be used for the next set of paginated results.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_nextToken :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues (Maybe Text)

-- | The query interval for the window in seconds. IoT SiteWise computes
--   each interpolated value by using data points from the timestamp of
--   each interval minus the window to the timestamp of each interval plus
--   the window. If not specified, the window is between the start time
--   minus the interval and the end time plus the interval.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you specify a value for the <tt>intervalWindowInSeconds</tt>
--   parameter, the <tt>type</tt> parameter must be
--   <tt>LINEAR_INTERPOLATION</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If no data point is found during the specified query window, IoT
--   SiteWise won't return an interpolated value for the interval. This
--   indicates that there's a gap in the ingested data points.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For example, you can get the interpolated temperature values for a
--   wind turbine every 24 hours over a duration of 7 days. If the
--   interpolation starts on July 1, 2021, at 9 AM with a window of 2
--   hours, IoT SiteWise uses the data points from 7 AM (9 AM - 2 hours) to
--   11 AM (9 AM + 2 hours) on July 2, 2021 to compute the first
--   interpolated value, uses the data points from 7 AM (9 AM - 2 hours) to
--   11 AM (9 AM + 2 hours) on July 3, 2021 to compute the second
--   interpolated value, and so on.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_intervalWindowInSeconds :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues (Maybe Natural)

-- | The ID of the asset property.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_propertyId :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the asset.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_assetId :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to return for each paginated request. If
--   not specified, the default value is 10.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_maxResults :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues (Maybe Natural)

-- | The exclusive start of the range from which to interpolate data,
--   expressed in seconds in Unix epoch time.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_startTimeInSeconds :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues Natural

-- | The inclusive end of the range from which to interpolate data,
--   expressed in seconds in Unix epoch time.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_endTimeInSeconds :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues Natural

-- | The quality of the asset property value. You can use this parameter as
--   a filter to choose only the asset property values that have a specific
--   quality.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_quality :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues Quality

-- | The time interval in seconds over which to interpolate data. Each
--   interval starts when the previous one ends.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_intervalInSeconds :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues Natural

-- | The interpolation type.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>LINEAR_INTERPOLATION | LOCF_INTERPOLATION</tt>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>LINEAR_INTERPOLATION</tt> – Estimates missing data using
--   <a>linear interpolation</a>.For example, you can use this operation to
--   return the interpolated temperature values for a wind turbine every 24
--   hours over a duration of 7 days. If the interpolation starts on July
--   1, 2021, at 9 AM, IoT SiteWise returns the first interpolated value on
--   July 2, 2021, at 9 AM, the second interpolated value on July 3, 2021,
--   at 9 AM, and so on.</li>
--   <li><tt>LOCF_INTERPOLATION</tt> – Estimates missing data using last
--   observation carried forward interpolationIf no data point is found for
--   an interval, IoT SiteWise returns the last observed data point for the
--   previous interval and carries forward this interpolated value until a
--   new data point is found.For example, you can get the state of an
--   on-off valve every 24 hours over a duration of 7 days. If the
--   interpolation starts on July 1, 2021, at 9 AM, IoT SiteWise returns
--   the last observed data point between July 1, 2021, at 9 AM and July 2,
--   2021, at 9 AM as the first interpolated value. If no data point is
--   found after 9 AM on July 2, 2021, IoT SiteWise uses the same
--   interpolated value for the rest of the days.</li>
--   </ul>
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_type :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues Text

-- | The token for the next set of results, or null if there are no
--   additional results.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValuesResponse_nextToken :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValuesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValuesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValuesResponse Int

-- | The requested interpolated values.
getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValuesResponse_interpolatedAssetPropertyValues :: Lens' GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValuesResponse [InterpolatedAssetPropertyValue]

-- | The ID of the gateway that defines the capability configuration.
describeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration_gatewayId :: Lens' DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration Text

-- | The namespace of the capability configuration. For example, if you
--   configure OPC-UA sources from the IoT SiteWise console, your OPC-UA
--   capability configuration has the namespace
--   <tt>iotsitewise:opcuacollector:version</tt>, where <tt>version</tt> is
--   a number such as <tt>1</tt>.
describeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration_capabilityNamespace :: Lens' DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration Text

-- | The response's http status code.
describeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse Int

-- | The ID of the gateway that defines the capability configuration.
describeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_gatewayId :: Lens' DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse Text

describeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_capabilityNamespace :: Lens' DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse Text

-- | The JSON document that defines the gateway capability's configuration.
--   For more information, see <a>Configuring data sources (CLI)</a> in the
--   <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
describeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_capabilityConfiguration :: Lens' DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse Text

-- | The synchronization status of the capability configuration. The sync
--   status can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt> – The gateway is running the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUT_OF_SYNC</tt> – The gateway hasn't received the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>SYNC_FAILED</tt> – The gateway rejected the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
describeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_capabilitySyncStatus :: Lens' DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse CapabilitySyncStatus

--

--   to authenticate users and manage user permissions. Before you can

--   Amazon Web Services SSO. For more information, see <a>Enabling Amazon
--   Web Services SSO</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>. This
--   option is only available in Amazon Web Services Regions other than the
--   China Regions.</li>
--   <li><tt>IAM</tt> – The portal uses Identity and Access Management to
--   authenticate users and manage user permissions. This option is only
--   available in the China Regions.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can't change this value after you create a portal.
--   
--   Default: <tt>SSO</tt>

-- | The updated property definitions of the asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Asset properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can specify up to 200 properties per asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
updateAssetModel_assetModelProperties :: Lens' UpdateAssetModel (Maybe [AssetModelProperty])

-- | The composite asset models that are part of this asset model.
--   Composite asset models are asset models that contain specific
--   properties. Each composite model has a type that defines the
--   properties that the composite model supports. Use composite asset
--   models to define alarms on this asset model.
updateAssetModel_assetModelCompositeModels :: Lens' UpdateAssetModel (Maybe [AssetModelCompositeModel])

-- | The updated hierarchy definitions of the asset model. Each hierarchy
--   specifies an asset model whose assets can be children of any other
--   assets created from this asset model. For more information, see
--   <a>Asset hierarchies</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can specify up to 10 hierarchies per asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
updateAssetModel_assetModelHierarchies :: Lens' UpdateAssetModel (Maybe [AssetModelHierarchy])

updateAssetModelResponse_assetModelStatus :: Lens' UpdateAssetModelResponse AssetModelStatus

-- | The MQTT notification state (enabled or disabled) for this asset
--   property. When the notification state is enabled, IoT SiteWise
--   publishes property value updates to a unique MQTT topic. For more
--   information, see <a>Interacting with other services</a> in the <i>IoT
--   SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If you omit this parameter, the notification state is set to
--   <tt>DISABLED</tt>.
updateAssetProperty_propertyNotificationState :: Lens' UpdateAssetProperty (Maybe PropertyNotificationState)

-- | The ID of the gateway to be updated.
updateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration_gatewayId :: Lens' UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration Text

-- | The namespace of the gateway capability configuration to be updated.
--   For example, if you configure OPC-UA sources from the IoT SiteWise
--   console, your OPC-UA capability configuration has the namespace
--   <tt>iotsitewise:opcuacollector:version</tt>, where <tt>version</tt> is
--   a number such as <tt>1</tt>.
updateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration_capabilityNamespace :: Lens' UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration Text

-- | The JSON document that defines the configuration for the gateway
--   capability. For more information, see <a>Configuring data sources
--   (CLI)</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
updateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration_capabilityConfiguration :: Lens' UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration Text

-- | The response's http status code.
updateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse Int

-- | The namespace of the gateway capability.
updateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_capabilityNamespace :: Lens' UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse Text

-- | The synchronization status of the capability configuration. The sync
--   status can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt> – The gateway is running the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUT_OF_SYNC</tt> – The gateway hasn't received the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>SYNC_FAILED</tt> – The gateway rejected the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   After you update a capability configuration, its sync status is
--   <tt>OUT_OF_SYNC</tt> until the gateway receives and applies or rejects
--   the updated configuration.
updateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_capabilitySyncStatus :: Lens' UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse CapabilitySyncStatus

--   information, see <a>UpdateAssetProperty</a>.
assetProperty_notification :: Lens' AssetProperty (Maybe PropertyNotification)

-- | The alias that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data
--   stream path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
assetProperty_alias :: Lens' AssetProperty (Maybe Text)

-- | The unit (such as <tt>Newtons</tt> or <tt>RPM</tt>) of the asset
--   property.
assetProperty_unit :: Lens' AssetProperty (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the asset property.
assetProperty_id :: Lens' AssetProperty Text

-- | The name of the property.
assetProperty_name :: Lens' AssetProperty Text

-- | The data type of the asset property.
assetProperty_dataType :: Lens' AssetProperty PropertyDataType

-- | The quality of the asset property value.
assetPropertyValue_quality :: Lens' AssetPropertyValue (Maybe Quality)

-- | The value of the asset property (see <tt>Variant</tt>).
assetPropertyValue_value :: Lens' AssetPropertyValue Variant

-- | The timestamp of the asset property value.
assetPropertyValue_timestamp :: Lens' AssetPropertyValue TimeInNanos

-- | The assets that are related through an asset hierarchy.
--   
--   This object is present if the <tt>relationshipType</tt> is
--   <tt>HIERARCHY</tt>.
assetRelationshipSummary_hierarchyInfo :: Lens' AssetRelationshipSummary (Maybe AssetHierarchyInfo)

-- | The relationship type of the assets in this relationship. This value
--   is one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>HIERARCHY</tt> – The assets are related through an asset
--   hierarchy. If you specify this relationship type, this asset
--   relationship includes the <tt>hierarchyInfo</tt> object.</li>
--   </ul>
assetRelationshipSummary_relationshipType :: Lens' AssetRelationshipSummary AssetRelationshipType

-- | Contains associated error information, if any.
assetStatus_error :: Lens' AssetStatus (Maybe ErrorDetails)

-- | The current status of the asset.
assetStatus_state :: Lens' AssetStatus AssetState

-- | The ID of the asset.
assetSummary_id :: Lens' AssetSummary Text

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the asset, which has the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:asset/${AssetId}
--   </pre>
assetSummary_arn :: Lens' AssetSummary Text

-- | The name of the asset.
assetSummary_name :: Lens' AssetSummary Text

-- | The ID of the asset model used to create this asset.
assetSummary_assetModelId :: Lens' AssetSummary Text

-- | The date the asset was created, in Unix epoch time.
assetSummary_creationDate :: Lens' AssetSummary UTCTime

-- | The date the asset was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
assetSummary_lastUpdateDate :: Lens' AssetSummary UTCTime

-- | The current status of the asset.
assetSummary_status :: Lens' AssetSummary AssetStatus

-- | A list of asset hierarchies that each contain a <tt>hierarchyId</tt>.
--   A hierarchy specifies allowed parent/child asset relationships.
assetSummary_hierarchies :: Lens' AssetSummary [AssetHierarchy]

-- | The ID of the asset.
associatedAssetsSummary_id :: Lens' AssociatedAssetsSummary Text

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the asset, which has the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:asset/${AssetId}
--   </pre>
associatedAssetsSummary_arn :: Lens' AssociatedAssetsSummary Text

-- | The name of the asset.
associatedAssetsSummary_name :: Lens' AssociatedAssetsSummary Text

-- | The ID of the asset model used to create the asset.
associatedAssetsSummary_assetModelId :: Lens' AssociatedAssetsSummary Text

-- | The date the asset was created, in Unix epoch time.
associatedAssetsSummary_creationDate :: Lens' AssociatedAssetsSummary UTCTime

-- | The date the asset was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
associatedAssetsSummary_lastUpdateDate :: Lens' AssociatedAssetsSummary UTCTime

-- | The current status of the asset.
associatedAssetsSummary_status :: Lens' AssociatedAssetsSummary AssetStatus

-- | A list of asset hierarchies that each contain a <tt>hierarchyId</tt>.
--   A hierarchy specifies allowed parent/child asset relationships.
associatedAssetsSummary_hierarchies :: Lens' AssociatedAssetsSummary [AssetHierarchy]

-- | The default value of the asset model property attribute. All assets
--   that you create from the asset model contain this attribute value. You
--   can update an attribute's value after you create an asset. For more
--   information, see <a>Updating attribute values</a> in the <i>IoT
--   SiteWise User Guide</i>.
attribute_defaultValue :: Lens' Attribute (Maybe Text)

-- | The error code.
batchPutAssetPropertyError_errorCode :: Lens' BatchPutAssetPropertyError BatchPutAssetPropertyValueErrorCode

-- | The associated error message.
batchPutAssetPropertyError_errorMessage :: Lens' BatchPutAssetPropertyError Text

-- | A list of timestamps for each error, if any.
batchPutAssetPropertyError_timestamps :: Lens' BatchPutAssetPropertyError [TimeInNanos]

-- | The ID of the failed entry.
batchPutAssetPropertyErrorEntry_entryId :: Lens' BatchPutAssetPropertyErrorEntry Text

-- | The list of update property value errors.
batchPutAssetPropertyErrorEntry_errors :: Lens' BatchPutAssetPropertyErrorEntry [BatchPutAssetPropertyError]

-- | The name of the property.
compositeModelProperty_name :: Lens' CompositeModelProperty Text

-- | The type of the composite model that defines this property.
compositeModelProperty_type :: Lens' CompositeModelProperty Text

-- | Undocumented member.
compositeModelProperty_assetProperty :: Lens' CompositeModelProperty Property

-- | The error code.
configurationErrorDetails_code :: Lens' ConfigurationErrorDetails ErrorCode

-- | The error message.
configurationErrorDetails_message :: Lens' ConfigurationErrorDetails Text

-- | Contains associated error information, if any.
configurationStatus_error :: Lens' ConfigurationStatus (Maybe ConfigurationErrorDetails)

-- | The current state of the configuration.
configurationStatus_state :: Lens' ConfigurationStatus ConfigurationState

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the Amazon S3 object. For more information about how
--   to find the ARN for an Amazon S3 object, see <a>Amazon S3
--   resources</a> in the <i>Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide</i>.
customerManagedS3Storage_s3ResourceArn :: Lens' CustomerManagedS3Storage Text

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the Identity and Access Management role that allows
--   IoT SiteWise to send data to Amazon S3.
customerManagedS3Storage_roleArn :: Lens' CustomerManagedS3Storage Text

-- | The date the dashboard was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
dashboardSummary_lastUpdateDate :: Lens' DashboardSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date the dashboard was created, in Unix epoch time.
dashboardSummary_creationDate :: Lens' DashboardSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The dashboard's description.
dashboardSummary_description :: Lens' DashboardSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the dashboard.
dashboardSummary_id :: Lens' DashboardSummary Text

-- | The name of the dashboard
dashboardSummary_name :: Lens' DashboardSummary Text

-- | The error code.
detailedError_code :: Lens' DetailedError DetailedErrorCode

-- | The error message.
detailedError_message :: Lens' DetailedError Text

-- | A list of detailed errors.
errorDetails_details :: Lens' ErrorDetails (Maybe [DetailedError])

-- | The error code.
errorDetails_code :: Lens' ErrorDetails ErrorCode

-- | The error message.
errorDetails_message :: Lens' ErrorDetails Text

-- | The friendly name of the variable to be used in the expression.
expressionVariable_name :: Lens' ExpressionVariable Text

-- | The variable that identifies an asset property from which to use
--   values.
expressionVariable_value :: Lens' ExpressionVariable VariableValue

-- | The forwarding state for the given property.
forwardingConfig_state :: Lens' ForwardingConfig ForwardingConfigState

-- | The namespace of the capability configuration. For example, if you
--   configure OPC-UA sources from the IoT SiteWise console, your OPC-UA
--   capability configuration has the namespace
--   <tt>iotsitewise:opcuacollector:version</tt>, where <tt>version</tt> is
--   a number such as <tt>1</tt>.
gatewayCapabilitySummary_capabilityNamespace :: Lens' GatewayCapabilitySummary Text

-- | The synchronization status of the capability configuration. The sync
--   status can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt> – The gateway is running the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUT_OF_SYNC</tt> – The gateway hasn't received the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>SYNC_FAILED</tt> – The gateway rejected the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
gatewayCapabilitySummary_capabilitySyncStatus :: Lens' GatewayCapabilitySummary CapabilitySyncStatus

-- | A gateway that runs on IoT Greengrass.
gatewayPlatform_greengrass :: Lens' GatewayPlatform (Maybe Greengrass)

-- | A gateway that runs on IoT Greengrass V2.
gatewayPlatform_greengrassV2 :: Lens' GatewayPlatform (Maybe GreengrassV2)

-- | Undocumented member.
gatewaySummary_gatewayPlatform :: Lens' GatewaySummary (Maybe GatewayPlatform)

-- | A list of gateway capability summaries that each contain a namespace
--   and status. Each gateway capability defines data sources for the
--   gateway. To retrieve a capability configuration's definition, use
--   <a>DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration</a>.
gatewaySummary_gatewayCapabilitySummaries :: Lens' GatewaySummary (Maybe [GatewayCapabilitySummary])

-- | The ID of the gateway device.
gatewaySummary_gatewayId :: Lens' GatewaySummary Text

-- | The name of the asset.
gatewaySummary_gatewayName :: Lens' GatewaySummary Text

-- | The date the gateway was created, in Unix epoch time.
gatewaySummary_creationDate :: Lens' GatewaySummary UTCTime

-- | The date the gateway was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
gatewaySummary_lastUpdateDate :: Lens' GatewaySummary UTCTime

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the Greengrass group. For more information about how
--   to find a group's ARN, see <a>ListGroups</a> and <a>GetGroup</a> in
--   the <i>IoT Greengrass API Reference</i>.
greengrass_groupArn :: Lens' Greengrass Text

-- | The name of the IoT thing for your IoT Greengrass V2 core device.
greengrassV2_coreDeviceThingName :: Lens' GreengrassV2 Text

--   the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
