-- | The ARN of the IAM user. For more information, see <a>IAM ARNs</a> in
--   the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If you delete the IAM user, access policies that contain this identity
--   include an empty <tt>arn</tt>. You can delete the access policy for
--   the IAM user that no longer exists.
iAMUserIdentity_arn :: Lens' IAMUserIdentity Text

-- | An IAM user identity.
identity_iamUser :: Lens' Identity (Maybe IAMUserIdentity)

-- | An Amazon Web Services SSO group identity.
identity_group :: Lens' Identity (Maybe GroupIdentity)

-- | An Amazon Web Services SSO user identity.
identity_user :: Lens' Identity (Maybe UserIdentity)

-- | An IAM role identity.
identity_iamRole :: Lens' Identity (Maybe IAMRoleIdentity)

-- | The ID of an existing image. Specify this parameter to keep an
--   existing image.
image_id :: Lens' Image (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
image_file :: Lens' Image (Maybe ImageFile)

-- | The image file contents, represented as a base64-encoded string. The
--   file size must be less than 1 MB.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt>
--   automatically encodes and decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying
--   isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation during --
--   serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw
--   unencoded data.
imageFile_data :: Lens' ImageFile ByteString

-- | The file type of the image.
imageFile_type :: Lens' ImageFile ImageFileType

-- | The ID of the image.
imageLocation_id :: Lens' ImageLocation Text

-- | The URL where the image is available. The URL is valid for 15 minutes
--   so that you can view and download the image
imageLocation_url :: Lens' ImageLocation Text

-- | Undocumented member.
interpolatedAssetPropertyValue_timestamp :: Lens' InterpolatedAssetPropertyValue TimeInNanos

-- | Undocumented member.
interpolatedAssetPropertyValue_value :: Lens' InterpolatedAssetPropertyValue Variant

-- | The IoT SiteWise logging verbosity level.
loggingOptions_level :: Lens' LoggingOptions LoggingLevel

-- | The processing configuration for the given measurement property. You
--   can configure measurements to be kept at the edge or forwarded to the
--   Amazon Web Services Cloud. By default, measurements are forwarded to
--   the cloud.
measurement_processingConfig :: Lens' Measurement (Maybe MeasurementProcessingConfig)

-- | The forwarding configuration for the given measurement property.
measurementProcessingConfig_forwardingConfig :: Lens' MeasurementProcessingConfig ForwardingConfig

-- | The processing configuration for the given metric property. You can
--   configure metrics to be computed at the edge or in the Amazon Web
--   Services Cloud. By default, metrics are forwarded to the cloud.
metric_processingConfig :: Lens' Metric (Maybe MetricProcessingConfig)

-- | The mathematical expression that defines the metric aggregation
--   function. You can specify up to 10 variables per expression. You can
--   specify up to 10 functions per expression.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
metric_expression :: Lens' Metric Text

-- | The list of variables used in the expression.
metric_variables :: Lens' Metric [ExpressionVariable]

-- | The window (time interval) over which IoT SiteWise computes the
--   metric's aggregation expression. IoT SiteWise computes one data point
--   per <tt>window</tt>.
metric_window :: Lens' Metric MetricWindow

-- | The compute location for the given metric property.
metricProcessingConfig_computeLocation :: Lens' MetricProcessingConfig ComputeLocation

-- | The tumbling time interval window.
metricWindow_tumbling :: Lens' MetricWindow (Maybe TumblingWindow)

-- | The error code.
monitorErrorDetails_code :: Lens' MonitorErrorDetails (Maybe MonitorErrorCode)

-- | The error message.
monitorErrorDetails_message :: Lens' MonitorErrorDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains information about a customer managed Amazon S3 bucket.
multiLayerStorage_customerManagedS3Storage :: Lens' MultiLayerStorage CustomerManagedS3Storage

-- | The ID of the portal.
portalResource_id :: Lens' PortalResource Text

-- | Contains associated error information, if any.
portalStatus_error :: Lens' PortalStatus (Maybe MonitorErrorDetails)

-- | The current state of the portal.
portalStatus_state :: Lens' PortalStatus PortalState

-- | The date the portal was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
portalSummary_lastUpdateDate :: Lens' PortalSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date the portal was created, in Unix epoch time.
portalSummary_creationDate :: Lens' PortalSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The portal's description.
portalSummary_description :: Lens' PortalSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The <a>ARN</a> of the service role that allows the portal's users to
--   access your IoT SiteWise resources on your behalf. For more
--   information, see <a>Using service roles for IoT SiteWise Monitor</a>
--   in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
portalSummary_roleArn :: Lens' PortalSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the portal.
portalSummary_id :: Lens' PortalSummary Text

-- | The name of the portal.
portalSummary_name :: Lens' PortalSummary Text

-- | The URL for the IoT SiteWise Monitor portal. You can use this URL to
--   access portals that use Amazon Web Services SSO for authentication.
--   For portals that use IAM for authentication, you must use the IoT
--   SiteWise console to get a URL that you can use to access the portal.
portalSummary_startUrl :: Lens' PortalSummary Text

-- | Undocumented member.
portalSummary_status :: Lens' PortalSummary PortalStatus

-- | The ID of the project.
projectResource_id :: Lens' ProjectResource Text

-- | The date the project was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
projectSummary_lastUpdateDate :: Lens' ProjectSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date the project was created, in Unix epoch time.
projectSummary_creationDate :: Lens' ProjectSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The project's description.
projectSummary_description :: Lens' ProjectSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the project.
projectSummary_id :: Lens' ProjectSummary Text

-- | The name of the project.
projectSummary_name :: Lens' ProjectSummary Text

-- | The asset property's notification topic and state. For more
--   information, see <a>UpdateAssetProperty</a>.
property_notification :: Lens' Property (Maybe PropertyNotification)

-- | The alias that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data
--   stream path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
property_alias :: Lens' Property (Maybe Text)

-- | The property type (see <tt>PropertyType</tt>). A property contains one
--   type.
property_type :: Lens' Property (Maybe PropertyType)

-- | The unit (such as <tt>Newtons</tt> or <tt>RPM</tt>) of the asset
--   property.
property_unit :: Lens' Property (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the asset property.
property_id :: Lens' Property Text

-- | The name of the property.
property_name :: Lens' Property Text

-- | The property data type.
property_dataType :: Lens' Property PropertyDataType

-- | The MQTT topic to which IoT SiteWise publishes property value update
--   notifications.
propertyNotification_topic :: Lens' PropertyNotification Text

-- | The current notification state.
propertyNotification_state :: Lens' PropertyNotification PropertyNotificationState

-- | Specifies an asset attribute property. An attribute generally contains
--   static information, such as the serial number of an <a>IIoT</a> wind
--   turbine.
propertyType_attribute :: Lens' PropertyType (Maybe Attribute)

-- | Specifies an asset transform property. A transform contains a
--   mathematical expression that maps a property's data points from one
--   form to another, such as a unit conversion from Celsius to Fahrenheit.
propertyType_transform :: Lens' PropertyType (Maybe Transform)

-- | Specifies an asset metric property. A metric contains a mathematical
--   expression that uses aggregate functions to process all input data
--   points over a time interval and output a single data point, such as to
--   calculate the average hourly temperature.
propertyType_metric :: Lens' PropertyType (Maybe Metric)

-- | Specifies an asset measurement property. A measurement represents a
--   device's raw sensor data stream, such as timestamped temperature
--   values or timestamped power values.
propertyType_measurement :: Lens' PropertyType (Maybe Measurement)

-- | The alias that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data
--   stream path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyAlias :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the asset property for this entry.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyId :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the asset to update.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_assetId :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The user specified ID for the entry. You can use this ID to identify
--   which entries failed.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_entryId :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry Text

-- | The list of property values to upload. You can specify up to 10
--   <tt>propertyValues</tt> array elements.
putAssetPropertyValueEntry_propertyValues :: Lens' PutAssetPropertyValueEntry [AssetPropertyValue]

-- | A portal resource.
resource_portal :: Lens' Resource (Maybe PortalResource)

-- | A project resource.
resource_project :: Lens' Resource (Maybe ProjectResource)

-- | The nanosecond offset from <tt>timeInSeconds</tt>.
timeInNanos_offsetInNanos :: Lens' TimeInNanos (Maybe Natural)

-- | The timestamp date, in seconds, in the Unix epoch format. Fractional
--   nanosecond data is provided by <tt>offsetInNanos</tt>.
timeInNanos_timeInSeconds :: Lens' TimeInNanos Natural

-- | The processing configuration for the given transform property. You can
--   configure transforms to be kept at the edge or forwarded to the Amazon
--   Web Services Cloud. You can also configure transforms to be computed
--   at the edge or in the cloud.
transform_processingConfig :: Lens' Transform (Maybe TransformProcessingConfig)

-- | The mathematical expression that defines the transformation function.
--   You can specify up to 10 variables per expression. You can specify up
--   to 10 functions per expression.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
transform_expression :: Lens' Transform Text

-- | The list of variables used in the expression.
transform_variables :: Lens' Transform [ExpressionVariable]

-- | Undocumented member.
transformProcessingConfig_forwardingConfig :: Lens' TransformProcessingConfig (Maybe ForwardingConfig)

-- | The compute location for the given transform property.
transformProcessingConfig_computeLocation :: Lens' TransformProcessingConfig ComputeLocation

-- | The offset for the tumbling window. The <tt>offset</tt> parameter
--   accepts the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The offset time.For example, if you specify <tt>18h</tt> for
--   <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise
--   aggregates data in one of the following ways:<ul><li>If you create the
--   metric before or at 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation
--   result at 6 PM (UTC) on the day when you create the metric.</li><li>If
--   you create the metric after 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first
--   aggregation result at 6 PM (UTC) the next day.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The ISO 8601 format.For example, if you specify <tt>PT18H</tt> for
--   <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise
--   aggregates data in one of the following ways:<ul><li>If you create the
--   metric before or at 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation
--   result at 6 PM (UTC) on the day when you create the metric.</li><li>If
--   you create the metric after 6:00 PM (UTC), you get the first
--   aggregation result at 6 PM (UTC) the next day.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The 24-hour clock.For example, if you specify <tt>00:03:00</tt>
--   for <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>5m</tt> for <tt>interval</tt>, and you
--   create the metric at 2 PM (UTC), you get the first aggregation result
--   at 2:03 PM (UTC). You get the second aggregation result at 2:08 PM
--   (UTC).</li>
--   <li>The offset time zone.For example, if you specify
--   <tt>2021-07-23T18:00-08</tt> for <tt>offset</tt> and <tt>1d</tt> for
--   <tt>interval</tt>, IoT SiteWise aggregates data in one of the
--   following ways:<ul><li>If you create the metric before or at 6:00 PM
--   (PST), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (PST) on the day
--   when you create the metric.</li><li>If you create the metric after
--   6:00 PM (PST), you get the first aggregation result at 6 PM (PST) the
--   next day.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
tumblingWindow_offset :: Lens' TumblingWindow (Maybe Text)

-- | The time interval for the tumbling window. The interval time must be
--   between 1 minute and 1 week.
--   
--   IoT SiteWise computes the <tt>1w</tt> interval the end of Sunday at
--   midnight each week (UTC), the <tt>1d</tt> interval at the end of each
--   day at midnight (UTC), the <tt>1h</tt> interval at the end of each
--   hour, and so on.
--   
--   When IoT SiteWise aggregates data points for metric computations, the
--   start of each interval is exclusive and the end of each interval is
--   inclusive. IoT SiteWise places the computed data point at the end of
--   the interval.
tumblingWindow_interval :: Lens' TumblingWindow Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services SSO ID of the user.
userIdentity_id :: Lens' UserIdentity Text

-- | The ID of the hierarchy to query for the property ID. You can use the
--   hierarchy's name instead of the hierarchy's ID.
--   
--   You use a hierarchy ID instead of a model ID because you can have
--   several hierarchies using the same model and therefore the same
--   <tt>propertyId</tt>. For example, you might have separately grouped
--   assets that come from the same asset model. For more information, see
--   <a>Asset hierarchies</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
variableValue_hierarchyId :: Lens' VariableValue (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the property to use as the variable. You can use the
--   property <tt>name</tt> if it's from the same asset model.
variableValue_propertyId :: Lens' VariableValue Text

-- | Asset property data of type integer (whole number).
variant_integerValue :: Lens' Variant (Maybe Int)

-- | Asset property data of type double (floating point number).
variant_doubleValue :: Lens' Variant (Maybe Double)

-- | Asset property data of type string (sequence of characters).
variant_stringValue :: Lens' Variant (Maybe Text)

-- | Asset property data of type Boolean (true or false).
variant_booleanValue :: Lens' Variant (Maybe Bool)


module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise.Waiters

-- | Polls <a>DescribeAssetModel</a> every 3 seconds until a successful
--   state is reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newAssetModelNotExists :: Wait DescribeAssetModel

-- | Polls <a>DescribeAsset</a> every 3 seconds until a successful state is
--   reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newAssetNotExists :: Wait DescribeAsset

-- | Polls <a>DescribeAssetModel</a> every 3 seconds until a successful
--   state is reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newAssetModelActive :: Wait DescribeAssetModel

-- | Polls <a>DescribePortal</a> every 3 seconds until a successful state
--   is reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newPortalNotExists :: Wait DescribePortal

-- | Polls <a>DescribeAsset</a> every 3 seconds until a successful state is
--   reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newAssetActive :: Wait DescribeAsset

-- | Polls <a>DescribePortal</a> every 3 seconds until a successful state
--   is reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newPortalActive :: Wait DescribePortal


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2019-12-02</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Welcome to the IoT SiteWise API Reference. IoT SiteWise is an Amazon
--   Web Services service that connects <a>Industrial Internet of Things
--   (IIoT)</a> devices to the power of the Amazon Web Services Cloud. For
--   more information, see the <a>IoT SiteWise User Guide</a>. For
--   information about IoT SiteWise quotas, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT
--   SiteWise User Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.IoTSiteWise

-- | API version <tt>2019-12-02</tt> of the Amazon IoT SiteWise SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The request isn't valid. This can occur if your request contains
--   malformed JSON or unsupported characters. Check your request and try
--   again.
_InvalidRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource already exists.
_ResourceAlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You've reached the limit for the number of tags allowed for a
--   resource. For more information, see <a>Tag naming limits and
--   requirements</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General Reference</i>.
_TooManyTagsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Your request has conflicting operations. This can occur if you're
--   trying to perform more than one operation on the same resource at the
--   same time.
_ConflictingOperationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Your request exceeded a rate limit. For example, you might have
--   exceeded the number of IoT SiteWise assets that can be created per
--   second, the allowed number of messages per second, and so on.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
_ThrottlingException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | IoT SiteWise can't process your request right now. Try again later.
_InternalFailureException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested service is unavailable.
_ServiceUnavailableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You are not authorized.
_UnauthorizedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested resource can't be found.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You've reached the limit for a resource. For example, this can occur
--   if you're trying to associate more than the allowed number of child
--   assets or attempting to create more than the allowed number of
--   properties for an asset model.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Polls <a>DescribeAssetModel</a> every 3 seconds until a successful
--   state is reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newAssetModelNotExists :: Wait DescribeAssetModel

-- | Polls <a>DescribeAsset</a> every 3 seconds until a successful state is
--   reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newAssetNotExists :: Wait DescribeAsset

-- | Polls <a>DescribeAssetModel</a> every 3 seconds until a successful
--   state is reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newAssetModelActive :: Wait DescribeAssetModel

-- | Polls <a>DescribePortal</a> every 3 seconds until a successful state
--   is reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newPortalNotExists :: Wait DescribePortal

-- | Polls <a>DescribeAsset</a> every 3 seconds until a successful state is
--   reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newAssetActive :: Wait DescribeAsset

-- | Polls <a>DescribePortal</a> every 3 seconds until a successful state
--   is reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newPortalActive :: Wait DescribePortal

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeAssetModelResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelCompositeModels:DescribeAssetModelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetModelResponse_assetModelCompositeModels</a> - The list
--   of composite asset models for the asset model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeAssetModelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetModelResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelId:DescribeAssetModel'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetModelResponse_assetModelId</a> - The ID of the asset
--   model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelArn:DescribeAssetModelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetModelResponse_assetModelArn</a> - The <a>ARN</a> of
--   the asset model, which has the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:asset-model/${AssetModelId}
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelName:DescribeAssetModelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetModelResponse_assetModelName</a> - The name of the
--   asset model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelDescription:DescribeAssetModelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetModelResponse_assetModelDescription</a> - The asset
--   model's description.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelProperties:DescribeAssetModelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetModelResponse_assetModelProperties</a> - The list of
--   asset properties for the asset model.
--   
--   This object doesn't include properties that you define in composite
--   models. You can find composite model properties in the
--   <tt>assetModelCompositeModels</tt> object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelHierarchies:DescribeAssetModelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetModelResponse_assetModelHierarchies</a> - A list of
--   asset model hierarchies that each contain a <tt>childAssetModelId</tt>
--   and a <tt>hierarchyId</tt> (named <tt>id</tt>). A hierarchy specifies
--   allowed parent/child asset relationships for an asset model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelCreationDate:DescribeAssetModelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetModelResponse_assetModelCreationDate</a> - The date
--   the asset model was created, in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelLastUpdateDate:DescribeAssetModelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetModelResponse_assetModelLastUpdateDate</a> - The date
--   the asset model was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelStatus:DescribeAssetModelResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetModelResponse_assetModelStatus</a> - The current
--   status of the asset model, which contains a state and any error
--   message.
newDescribeAssetModelResponse :: Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> AssetModelStatus -> DescribeAssetModelResponse

--   code.

--   device.

--   <a>describeGatewayResponse_gatewayName</a> - The name of the gateway.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayArn:DescribeGatewayResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeGatewayResponse_gatewayArn</a> - The <a>ARN</a> of the
--   gateway, which has the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:gateway/${GatewayId}
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:gatewayCapabilitySummaries:DescribeGatewayResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeGatewayResponse_gatewayCapabilitySummaries</a> - A list of
--   gateway capability summaries that each contain a namespace and status.
--   Each gateway capability defines data sources for the gateway. To
--   retrieve a capability configuration's definition, use
--   <a>DescribeGatewayCapabilityConfiguration</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:DescribeGatewayResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeGatewayResponse_creationDate</a> - The date the gateway was
--   created, in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdateDate:DescribeGatewayResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeGatewayResponse_lastUpdateDate</a> - The date the gateway
--   was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
newDescribeGatewayResponse :: Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> DescribeGatewayResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeAssetResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   models for the asset.

--   <a>describeAssetResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.

--   <a>describeAssetResponse_assetId</a> - The ID of the asset.

--   <a>$sel:assetArn:DescribeAssetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetResponse_assetArn</a> - The <a>ARN</a> of the asset,
--   which has the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:asset/${AssetId}
--   </pre>

--   <a>$sel:assetName:DescribeAssetResponse'</a>,

--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelId:DescribeAssetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetResponse_assetModelId</a> - The ID of the asset model
--   that was used to create the asset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetProperties:DescribeAssetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetResponse_assetProperties</a> - The list of asset
--   properties for the asset.
--   
--   This object doesn't include properties that you define in composite
--   models. You can find composite model properties in the
--   <tt>assetCompositeModels</tt> object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetHierarchies:DescribeAssetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetResponse_assetHierarchies</a> - A list of asset
--   hierarchies that each contain a <tt>hierarchyId</tt>. A hierarchy
--   specifies allowed parent/child asset relationships.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetCreationDate:DescribeAssetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetResponse_assetCreationDate</a> - The date the asset
--   was created, in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetLastUpdateDate:DescribeAssetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetResponse_assetLastUpdateDate</a> - The date the asset
--   was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetStatus:DescribeAssetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeAssetResponse_assetStatus</a> - The current status of the
--   asset, which contains a state and any error message.
newDescribeAssetResponse :: Int -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> AssetStatus -> DescribeAssetResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateAssetModel</a> with all optional fields

--   request. Don't reuse this client token if a new idempotent request is
--   required.

--   asset model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelProperties:CreateAssetModel'</a>,
--   <a>createAssetModel_assetModelProperties</a> - The property
--   definitions of the asset model. For more information, see <a>Asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can specify up to 200 properties per asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelCompositeModels:CreateAssetModel'</a>,
--   <a>createAssetModel_assetModelCompositeModels</a> - The composite
--   asset models that are part of this asset model. Composite asset models
--   are asset models that contain specific properties. Each composite
--   model has a type that defines the properties that the composite model
--   supports. Use composite asset models to define alarms on this asset
--   model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelHierarchies:CreateAssetModel'</a>,
--   <a>createAssetModel_assetModelHierarchies</a> - The hierarchy
--   definitions of the asset model. Each hierarchy specifies an asset
--   model whose assets can be children of any other assets created from
--   this asset model. For more information, see <a>Asset hierarchies</a>
--   in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can specify up to 10 hierarchies per asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateAssetModel'</a>, <a>createAssetModel_tags</a> - A
--   list of key-value pairs that contain metadata for the asset model. For
--   more information, see <a>Tagging your IoT SiteWise resources</a> in
--   the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelName:CreateAssetModel'</a>,
--   <a>createAssetModel_assetModelName</a> - A unique, friendly name for
--   the asset model.
newCreateAssetModel :: Text -> CreateAssetModel

--   operations. This parameter is required if you choose <tt>CHILD</tt>

--

--   <li><tt>CHILD</tt> – The list includes all child assets associated to
--   the asset. The <tt>hierarchyId</tt> parameter is required if you
--   choose <tt>CHILD</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>PARENT</tt> – The list includes the asset's parent asset.</li>
--   </ul>

--   the storage configuration was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeStorageConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeStorageConfigurationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageType:DescribeStorageConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeStorageConfigurationResponse_storageType</a> - The type of
--   storage that you specified for your data. The storage type can be one
--   of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>SITEWISE_DEFAULT_STORAGE</tt> – IoT SiteWise replicates your
--   data into a service managed database.</li>
--   <li><tt>MULTI_LAYER_STORAGE</tt> – IoT SiteWise replicates your data
--   into a service managed database and saves a copy of your raw data and
--   metadata in an Amazon S3 object that you specified.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationStatus:DescribeStorageConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeStorageConfigurationResponse_configurationStatus</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
newDescribeStorageConfigurationResponse :: Int -> StorageType -> ConfigurationStatus -> DescribeStorageConfigurationResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues
GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Quality -> Natural -> Text -> GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues

-- | Create a value of <a>GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTimeOffsetInNanos:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_startTimeOffsetInNanos</a> - The
--   nanosecond offset converted from <tt>startTimeInSeconds</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTimeOffsetInNanos:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_endTimeOffsetInNanos</a> - The
--   nanosecond offset converted from <tt>endTimeInSeconds</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyAlias:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_propertyAlias</a> - The alias
--   that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data stream
--   path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_nextToken</a> - The token to be
--   used for the next set of paginated results.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:intervalWindowInSeconds:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_intervalWindowInSeconds</a> -
--   The query interval for the window in seconds. IoT SiteWise computes
--   each interpolated value by using data points from the timestamp of
--   each interval minus the window to the timestamp of each interval plus
--   the window. If not specified, the window is between the start time
--   minus the interval and the end time plus the interval.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you specify a value for the <tt>intervalWindowInSeconds</tt>
--   parameter, the <tt>type</tt> parameter must be
--   <tt>LINEAR_INTERPOLATION</tt>.</li>
--   <li>If no data point is found during the specified query window, IoT
--   SiteWise won't return an interpolated value for the interval. This
--   indicates that there's a gap in the ingested data points.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For example, you can get the interpolated temperature values for a
--   wind turbine every 24 hours over a duration of 7 days. If the
--   interpolation starts on July 1, 2021, at 9 AM with a window of 2
--   hours, IoT SiteWise uses the data points from 7 AM (9 AM - 2 hours) to
--   11 AM (9 AM + 2 hours) on July 2, 2021 to compute the first
--   interpolated value, uses the data points from 7 AM (9 AM - 2 hours) to
--   11 AM (9 AM + 2 hours) on July 3, 2021 to compute the second
--   interpolated value, and so on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:propertyId:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_propertyId</a> - The ID of the
--   asset property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetId:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_assetId</a> - The ID of the
--   asset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_maxResults</a> - The maximum
--   number of results to return for each paginated request. If not
--   specified, the default value is 10.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTimeInSeconds:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_startTimeInSeconds</a> - The
--   exclusive start of the range from which to interpolate data, expressed
--   in seconds in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTimeInSeconds:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_endTimeInSeconds</a> - The
--   inclusive end of the range from which to interpolate data, expressed
--   in seconds in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quality:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_quality</a> - The quality of the
--   asset property value. You can use this parameter as a filter to choose
--   only the asset property values that have a specific quality.
--   
--   <a>$sel:intervalInSeconds:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_intervalInSeconds</a> - The time
--   interval in seconds over which to interpolate data. Each interval
--   starts when the previous one ends.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,
--   <a>getInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues_type</a> - The interpolation
--   type.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>LINEAR_INTERPOLATION | LOCF_INTERPOLATION</tt>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>LINEAR_INTERPOLATION</tt> – Estimates missing data using
--   <a>linear interpolation</a>.For example, you can use this operation to
--   return the interpolated temperature values for a wind turbine every 24
--   hours over a duration of 7 days. If the interpolation starts on July
--   1, 2021, at 9 AM, IoT SiteWise returns the first interpolated value on
--   July 2, 2021, at 9 AM, the second interpolated value on July 3, 2021,
--   at 9 AM, and so on.</li>
--   <li><tt>LOCF_INTERPOLATION</tt> – Estimates missing data using last
--   observation carried forward interpolationIf no data point is found for
--   an interval, IoT SiteWise returns the last observed data point for the
--   previous interval and carries forward this interpolated value until a
--   new data point is found.For example, you can get the state of an
--   on-off valve every 24 hours over a duration of 7 days. If the
--   interpolation starts on July 1, 2021, at 9 AM, IoT SiteWise returns
--   the last observed data point between July 1, 2021, at 9 AM and July 2,
--   2021, at 9 AM as the first interpolated value. If no data point is
--   found after 9 AM on July 2, 2021, IoT SiteWise uses the same
--   interpolated value for the rest of the days.</li>
--   </ul>
newGetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues :: Natural -> Natural -> Quality -> Natural -> Text -> GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValuesResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValuesResponse
GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValuesResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> [InterpolatedAssetPropertyValue] -> GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValuesResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValuesResponse</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:nextToken:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValues'</a>,

--   token for the next set of results, or null if there are no additional
--   results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetInterpolatedAssetPropertyValuesResponse'</a>,

--   response's http status code.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdatePortal</a> smart constructor.
data UpdatePortal
UpdatePortal' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Image -> Maybe Alarms -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdatePortal

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdatePortal</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:UpdatePortal'</a>, <a>updatePortal_clientToken</a>
--   - A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure
--   the idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:portalDescription:UpdatePortal'</a>,
--   <a>updatePortal_portalDescription</a> - A new description for the
--   portal.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationSenderEmail:UpdatePortal'</a>,
--   <a>updatePortal_notificationSenderEmail</a> - The email address that
--   sends alarm notifications.
--   
--   <a>$sel:portalLogoImage:UpdatePortal'</a>,
--   <a>updatePortal_portalLogoImage</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alarms:UpdatePortal'</a>, <a>updatePortal_alarms</a> -
--   Contains the configuration information of an alarm created in an IoT
--   SiteWise Monitor portal. You can use the alarm to monitor an asset
--   property and get notified when the asset property value is outside a
--   specified range. For more information, see <a>Monitoring with
--   alarms</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise Application Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:portalId:UpdatePortal'</a>, <a>updatePortal_portalId</a> - The
--   ID of the portal to update.

--   A new friendly name for the portal.

--   administrator's contact email address.

--   <a>ARN</a> of a service role that allows the portal's users to access
--   your IoT SiteWise resources on your behalf. For more information, see
--   <a>Using service roles for IoT SiteWise Monitor</a> in the <i>IoT
--   SiteWise User Guide</i>.

data CreatePortal
CreatePortal' :: Maybe AuthMode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Alarms -> Maybe ImageFile -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreatePortal

-- | Create a value of <a>CreatePortal</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:portalAuthMode:CreatePortal'</a>,
--   <a>createPortal_portalAuthMode</a> - The service to use to
--   authenticate users to the portal. Choose from the following options:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>SSO</tt> – The portal uses Amazon Web Services Single Sign On
--   to authenticate users and manage user permissions. Before you can
--   create a portal that uses Amazon Web Services SSO, you must enable
--   Amazon Web Services SSO. For more information, see <a>Enabling Amazon
--   Web Services SSO</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>. This
--   option is only available in Amazon Web Services Regions other than the
--   China Regions.</li>
--   <li><tt>IAM</tt> – The portal uses Identity and Access Management to
--   authenticate users and manage user permissions. This option is only
--   available in the China Regions.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can't change this value after you create a portal.
--   
--   Default: <tt>SSO</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:CreatePortal'</a>, <a>createPortal_clientToken</a>
--   - A unique case-sensitive identifier that you can provide to ensure
--   the idempotency of the request. Don't reuse this client token if a new
--   idempotent request is required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:portalDescription:CreatePortal'</a>,
--   <a>createPortal_portalDescription</a> - A description for the portal.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationSenderEmail:CreatePortal'</a>,
--   <a>createPortal_notificationSenderEmail</a> - The email address that
--   sends alarm notifications.
--   
--   If you use the <a>IoT Events managed Lambda function</a> to manage
--   your emails, you must <a>verify the sender email address in Amazon
--   SES</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alarms:CreatePortal'</a>, <a>createPortal_alarms</a> -
--   Contains the configuration information of an alarm created in an IoT
--   SiteWise Monitor portal. You can use the alarm to monitor an asset
--   property and get notified when the asset property value is outside a
--   specified range. For more information, see <a>Monitoring with
--   alarms</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise Application Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:portalLogoImageFile:CreatePortal'</a>,
--   <a>createPortal_portalLogoImageFile</a> - A logo image to display in
--   the portal. Upload a square, high-resolution image. The image is
--   displayed on a dark background.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreatePortal'</a>, <a>createPortal_tags</a> - A list of
--   key-value pairs that contain metadata for the portal. For more

--   your IoT SiteWise resources on your behalf. For more information, see

--   definitions of the asset model. For more information, see <a>Asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can specify up to 200 properties per asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelCompositeModels:UpdateAssetModel'</a>,
--   <a>updateAssetModel_assetModelCompositeModels</a> - The composite
--   asset models that are part of this asset model. Composite asset models
--   are asset models that contain specific properties. Each composite
--   model has a type that defines the properties that the composite model
--   supports. Use composite asset models to define alarms on this asset
--   model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelHierarchies:UpdateAssetModel'</a>,
--   <a>updateAssetModel_assetModelHierarchies</a> - The updated hierarchy
--   definitions of the asset model. Each hierarchy specifies an asset
--   model whose assets can be children of any other assets created from
--   this asset model. For more information, see <a>Asset hierarchies</a>
--   in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can specify up to 10 hierarchies per asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelId:UpdateAssetModel'</a>,

--   update.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse</a>
--   smart constructor.
data UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse
UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse' :: Int -> Text -> CapabilitySyncStatus -> UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:capabilityNamespace:UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>updateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_capabilityNamespace</a>
--   - The namespace of the gateway capability.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:capabilitySyncStatus:UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse_capabilitySyncStatus</a>
--   - The synchronization status of the capability configuration. The sync
--   status can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt> – The gateway is running the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUT_OF_SYNC</tt> – The gateway hasn't received the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>SYNC_FAILED</tt> – The gateway rejected the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   After you update a capability configuration, its sync status is
--   <tt>OUT_OF_SYNC</tt> until the gateway receives and applies or rejects
--   the updated configuration.
newUpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse :: Int -> Text -> CapabilitySyncStatus -> UpdateGatewayCapabilityConfigurationResponse

--   SiteWise Monitor portal. You can use this URL to access portals that
--   use Amazon Web Services SSO for authentication. For portals that use
--   IAM for authentication, you must use the IoT SiteWise console to get a
--   URL that you can use to access the portal.

--   project, which has the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:project/${ProjectId}
--   </pre>

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListAssets</a> smart constructor.
data ListAssets
ListAssets' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ListAssetsFilter -> Maybe Natural -> ListAssets

-- | Create a value of <a>ListAssets</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelId:ListAssets'</a>, <a>listAssets_assetModelId</a> -
--   The ID of the asset model by which to filter the list of assets. This
--   parameter is required if you choose <tt>ALL</tt> for <tt>filter</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListAssets'</a>, <a>listAssets_nextToken</a> - The
--   token to be used for the next set of paginated results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':ListAssets'</a>, <a>listAssets_filter</a> - The filter
--   for the requested list of assets. Choose one of the following options:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALL</tt> – The list includes all assets for a given asset
--   model ID. The <tt>assetModelId</tt> parameter is required if you
--   filter by <tt>ALL</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>TOP_LEVEL</tt> – The list includes only top-level assets in
--   the asset hierarchy tree.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Default: <tt>ALL</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListAssets'</a>, <a>listAssets_maxResults</a> - The
--   maximum number of results to return for each paginated request.
--   
--   Default: 50
newListAssets :: ListAssets

data DisassociateAssets
DisassociateAssets' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> DisassociateAssets

-- | Create a value of <a>DisassociateAssets</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:DisassociateAssets'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateAssets_clientToken</a> - A unique case-sensitive
--   identifier that you can provide to ensure the idempotency of the
--   request. Don't reuse this client token if a new idempotent request is
--   required.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetId:DisassociateAssets'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateAssets_assetId</a> - The ID of the parent asset from
--   which to disassociate the child asset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hierarchyId:DisassociateAssets'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateAssets_hierarchyId</a> - The ID of a hierarchy in the
--   parent asset's model. Hierarchies allow different groupings of assets
--   to be formed that all come from the same asset model. You can use the
--   hierarchy ID to identify the correct asset to disassociate. For more
--   information, see <a>Asset hierarchies</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:childAssetId:DisassociateAssets'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateAssets_childAssetId</a> - The ID of the child asset to
--   disassociate.
newDisassociateAssets :: Text -> Text -> Text -> DisassociateAssets

-- | Contains an access policy that defines an identity's access to an IoT
--   SiteWise Monitor resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessPolicySummary</a> smart constructor.
data AccessPolicySummary
AccessPolicySummary' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Text -> Identity -> Resource -> Permission -> AccessPolicySummary

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessPolicySummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdateDate:AccessPolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>accessPolicySummary_lastUpdateDate</a> - The date the access policy
--   was last updated, in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:AccessPolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>accessPolicySummary_creationDate</a> - The date the access policy
--   was created, in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:AccessPolicySummary'</a>, <a>accessPolicySummary_id</a> -
--   The ID of the access policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identity:AccessPolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>accessPolicySummary_identity</a> - The identity (an Amazon Web
--   Services SSO user, an Amazon Web Services SSO group, or an IAM user).
--   
--   <a>$sel:resource:AccessPolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>accessPolicySummary_resource</a> - The IoT SiteWise Monitor
--   resource (a portal or project).
--   
--   <a>$sel:permission:AccessPolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>accessPolicySummary_permission</a> - The permissions for the access
--   policy. Note that a project <tt>ADMINISTRATOR</tt> is also known as a
--   project owner.
newAccessPolicySummary :: Text -> Identity -> Resource -> Permission -> AccessPolicySummary

--   time series over a time interval window.
newAggregates :: Aggregates

-- | Contains the configuration information of an alarm created in an IoT
--   SiteWise Monitor portal. You can use the alarm to monitor an asset
--   property and get notified when the asset property value is outside a
--   specified range. For more information, see <a>Monitoring with
--   alarms</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise Application Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAlarms</a> smart constructor.
data Alarms
Alarms' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Alarms

-- | Create a value of <a>Alarms</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationLambdaArn:Alarms'</a>,
--   <a>alarms_notificationLambdaArn</a> - The <a>ARN</a> of the Lambda
--   function that manages alarm notifications. For more information, see
--   <a>Managing alarm notifications</a> in the <i>IoT Events Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alarmRoleArn:Alarms'</a>, <a>alarms_alarmRoleArn</a> - The
--   <a>ARN</a> of the IAM role that allows the alarm to perform actions
--   and access Amazon Web Services resources and services, such as IoT
--   Events.
newAlarms :: Text -> Alarms

--

--   - The name of the composite model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':AssetCompositeModel'</a>,
--   <a>assetCompositeModel_type</a> - The type of the composite model. For
--   alarm composite models, this type is <tt>AWS/ALARM</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:properties:AssetCompositeModel'</a>,
--   <a>assetCompositeModel_properties</a> - The asset properties that this
--   composite model defines.
newAssetCompositeModel :: Text -> Text -> AssetCompositeModel

--   
--   <a>$sel:description:AssetModelCompositeModel'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelCompositeModel_description</a> - The description of the
--   composite model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:properties:AssetModelCompositeModel'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelCompositeModel_properties</a> - The asset property
--   definitions for this composite model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AssetModelCompositeModel'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelCompositeModel_name</a> - The name of the composite
--   model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':AssetModelCompositeModel'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelCompositeModel_type</a> - The type of the composite
--   model. For alarm composite models, this type is <tt>AWS/ALARM</tt>.
newAssetModelCompositeModel :: Text -> Text -> AssetModelCompositeModel

-- | Contains a composite model definition in an asset model. This
--   composite model definition is applied to all assets created from the
--   asset model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetModelCompositeModelDefinition</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition
AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [AssetModelPropertyDefinition] -> Text -> Text -> AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition

-- | Create a value of <a>AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelCompositeModelDefinition_description</a> - The
--   description of the composite model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:properties:AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelCompositeModelDefinition_properties</a> - The asset
--   property definitions for this composite model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelCompositeModelDefinition_name</a> - The name of the
--   composite model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelCompositeModelDefinition_type</a> - The type of the
--   composite model. For alarm composite models, this type is
--   <tt>AWS/ALARM</tt>.
newAssetModelCompositeModelDefinition :: Text -> Text -> AssetModelCompositeModelDefinition

-- | Describes an asset hierarchy that contains a hierarchy's name, ID, and
--   child asset model ID that specifies the type of asset that can be in
--   this hierarchy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetModelHierarchy</a> smart constructor.
data AssetModelHierarchy
AssetModelHierarchy' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> AssetModelHierarchy

-- | Create a value of <a>AssetModelHierarchy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:AssetModelHierarchy'</a>, <a>assetModelHierarchy_id</a> -
--   The ID of the asset model hierarchy. This ID is a
--   <tt>hierarchyId</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AssetModelHierarchy'</a>, <a>assetModelHierarchy_name</a>
--   - The name of the asset model hierarchy that you specify by using the
--   <a>CreateAssetModel</a> or <a>UpdateAssetModel</a> API operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:childAssetModelId:AssetModelHierarchy'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelHierarchy_childAssetModelId</a> - The ID of the asset
--   model. All assets in this hierarchy must be instances of the
--   <tt>childAssetModelId</tt> asset model.
newAssetModelHierarchy :: Text -> Text -> AssetModelHierarchy

-- | Contains an asset model hierarchy used in asset model creation. An
--   asset model hierarchy determines the kind (or type) of asset that can
--   belong to a hierarchy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetModelHierarchyDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data AssetModelHierarchyDefinition
AssetModelHierarchyDefinition' :: Text -> Text -> AssetModelHierarchyDefinition

-- | Create a value of <a>AssetModelHierarchyDefinition</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AssetModelHierarchyDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelHierarchyDefinition_name</a> - The name of the asset
--   model hierarchy definition (as specified in the
--   <a>CreateAssetModel</a> or <a>UpdateAssetModel</a> API operation).
--   
--   <a>$sel:childAssetModelId:AssetModelHierarchyDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelHierarchyDefinition_childAssetModelId</a> - The ID of an
--   asset model for this hierarchy.
newAssetModelHierarchyDefinition :: Text -> Text -> AssetModelHierarchyDefinition

-- | Contains information about an asset model property.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetModelProperty</a> smart constructor.
data AssetModelProperty
AssetModelProperty' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> PropertyDataType -> PropertyType -> AssetModelProperty

-- | Create a value of <a>AssetModelProperty</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataTypeSpec:AssetModelProperty'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelProperty_dataTypeSpec</a> - The data type of the
--   structure for this property. This parameter exists on properties that
--   have the <tt>STRUCT</tt> data type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:AssetModelProperty'</a>, <a>assetModelProperty_id</a> - The
--   ID of the asset model property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:AssetModelProperty'</a>, <a>assetModelProperty_unit</a> -
--   The unit of the asset model property, such as <tt>Newtons</tt> or
--   <tt>RPM</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AssetModelProperty'</a>, <a>assetModelProperty_name</a> -
--   The name of the asset model property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataType:AssetModelProperty'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelProperty_dataType</a> - The data type of the asset model
--   property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':AssetModelProperty'</a>, <a>assetModelProperty_type</a>
--   - The property type (see <tt>PropertyType</tt>).
newAssetModelProperty :: Text -> PropertyDataType -> PropertyType -> AssetModelProperty

-- | Contains an asset model property definition. This property definition
--   is applied to all assets created from the asset model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetModelPropertyDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data AssetModelPropertyDefinition
AssetModelPropertyDefinition' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> PropertyDataType -> PropertyType -> AssetModelPropertyDefinition

-- | Create a value of <a>AssetModelPropertyDefinition</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataTypeSpec:AssetModelPropertyDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelPropertyDefinition_dataTypeSpec</a> - The data type of
--   the structure for this property. This parameter is required on
--   properties that have the <tt>STRUCT</tt> data type.
--   
--   The options for this parameter depend on the type of the composite
--   model in which you define this property. Use <tt>AWS/ALARM_STATE</tt>
--   for alarm state in alarm composite models.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:AssetModelPropertyDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelPropertyDefinition_unit</a> - The unit of the property
--   definition, such as <tt>Newtons</tt> or <tt>RPM</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AssetModelPropertyDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelPropertyDefinition_name</a> - The name of the property
--   definition.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataType:AssetModelPropertyDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelPropertyDefinition_dataType</a> - The data type of the
--   property definition.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>STRUCT</tt>, you must also specify
--   <tt>dataTypeSpec</tt> to identify the type of the structure for this
--   property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':AssetModelPropertyDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelPropertyDefinition_type</a> - The property definition
--   type (see <tt>PropertyType</tt>). You can only specify one type in a
--   property definition.
newAssetModelPropertyDefinition :: Text -> PropertyDataType -> PropertyType -> AssetModelPropertyDefinition

-- | Contains current status information for an asset model. For more
--   information, see <a>Asset and model states</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise

data AssetModelStatus

--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   Contains associated error information, if any.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:AssetModelStatus'</a>, <a>assetModelStatus_state</a> -
--   The current state of the asset model.
newAssetModelStatus :: AssetModelState -> AssetModelStatus

-- | Contains a summary of an asset model.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetModelSummary</a> smart constructor.
data AssetModelSummary
AssetModelSummary' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> POSIX -> POSIX -> AssetModelStatus -> AssetModelSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>AssetModelSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:AssetModelSummary'</a>, <a>assetModelSummary_id</a> - The
--   ID of the asset model (used with IoT SiteWise APIs).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:AssetModelSummary'</a>, <a>assetModelSummary_arn</a> - The
--   <a>ARN</a> of the asset model, which has the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:asset-model/${AssetModelId}
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AssetModelSummary'</a>, <a>assetModelSummary_name</a> -
--   The name of the asset model.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:AssetModelSummary'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelSummary_description</a> - The asset model description.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:AssetModelSummary'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelSummary_creationDate</a> - The date the asset model was
--   created, in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdateDate:AssetModelSummary'</a>,
--   <a>assetModelSummary_lastUpdateDate</a> - The date the asset model was
--   last updated, in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AssetModelSummary'</a>, <a>assetModelSummary_status</a>
--   - The current status of the asset model.
newAssetModelSummary :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> AssetModelStatus -> AssetModelSummary

-- | Contains asset property information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetProperty</a> smart constructor.
data AssetProperty

-- | Create a value of <a>AssetProperty</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   this property. This parameter exists on properties that have the
--   <tt>STRUCT</tt> data type.
--

--   <a>assetProperty_notification</a> - The asset property's notification
--   topic and state. For more information, see <a>UpdateAssetProperty</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alias:AssetProperty'</a>, <a>assetProperty_alias</a> - The
--   alias that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data
--   stream path (for example,
--   <tt>/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature</tt>). For more
--   information, see <a>Mapping industrial data streams to asset
--   properties</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.

--   (such as <tt>Newtons</tt> or <tt>RPM</tt>) of the asset property.

--   asset property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AssetProperty'</a>, <a>assetProperty_name</a> - The name
--   of the property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataType:AssetProperty'</a>, <a>assetProperty_dataType</a> -
--   The data type of the asset property.
newAssetProperty :: Text -> Text -> PropertyDataType -> AssetProperty

-- | Contains information about assets that are related to one another.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetRelationshipSummary</a> smart constructor.
data AssetRelationshipSummary

--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>assetRelationshipSummary_hierarchyInfo</a> - The assets that are
--   related through an asset hierarchy.
--   
--   This object is present if the <tt>relationshipType</tt> is
--   <tt>HIERARCHY</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:relationshipType:AssetRelationshipSummary'</a>,
--   <a>assetRelationshipSummary_relationshipType</a> - The relationship
--   type of the assets in this relationship. This value is one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>HIERARCHY</tt> – The assets are related through an asset
--   hierarchy. If you specify this relationship type, this asset
--   relationship includes the <tt>hierarchyInfo</tt> object.</li>
--   </ul>
newAssetRelationshipSummary :: AssetRelationshipType -> AssetRelationshipSummary

newAssetStatus :: AssetState -> AssetStatus

-- | Contains a summary of an asset.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssetSummary</a> smart constructor.
data AssetSummary
AssetSummary' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> POSIX -> POSIX -> AssetStatus -> [AssetHierarchy] -> AssetSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>AssetSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:AssetSummary'</a>, <a>assetSummary_id</a> - The ID of the
--   asset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:AssetSummary'</a>, <a>assetSummary_arn</a> - The
--   <a>ARN</a> of the asset, which has the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:${Partition}:iotsitewise:${Region}:${Account}:asset/${AssetId}
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AssetSummary'</a>, <a>assetSummary_name</a> - The name of
--   the asset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assetModelId:AssetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>assetSummary_assetModelId</a> - The ID of the asset model used to
--   create this asset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:AssetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>assetSummary_creationDate</a> - The date the asset was created, in
--   Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdateDate:AssetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>assetSummary_lastUpdateDate</a> - The date the asset was last
--   updated, in Unix epoch time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AssetSummary'</a>, <a>assetSummary_status</a> - The
--   current status of the asset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hierarchies:AssetSummary'</a>, <a>assetSummary_hierarchies</a>
--   - A list of asset hierarchies that each contain a
--   <tt>hierarchyId</tt>. A hierarchy specifies allowed parent/child asset
--   relationships.
newAssetSummary :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> AssetStatus -> AssetSummary

newAttribute :: Attribute

-- | Contains the details of an IoT SiteWise configuration error.

-- | Create a value of <a>ConfigurationErrorDetails</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

-- | Contains a summary of a gateway capability configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGatewayCapabilitySummary</a> smart constructor.
data GatewayCapabilitySummary
GatewayCapabilitySummary' :: Text -> CapabilitySyncStatus -> GatewayCapabilitySummary

-- | Create a value of <a>GatewayCapabilitySummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:capabilityNamespace:GatewayCapabilitySummary'</a>,
--   <a>gatewayCapabilitySummary_capabilityNamespace</a> - The namespace of
--   the capability configuration. For example, if you configure OPC-UA
--   sources from the IoT SiteWise console, your OPC-UA capability
--   configuration has the namespace
--   <tt>iotsitewise:opcuacollector:version</tt>, where <tt>version</tt> is
--   a number such as <tt>1</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:capabilitySyncStatus:GatewayCapabilitySummary'</a>,
--   <a>gatewayCapabilitySummary_capabilitySyncStatus</a> - The
--   synchronization status of the capability configuration. The sync
--   status can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_SYNC</tt> – The gateway is running the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>OUT_OF_SYNC</tt> – The gateway hasn't received the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   <li><tt>SYNC_FAILED</tt> – The gateway rejected the capability
--   configuration.</li>
--   </ul>
newGatewayCapabilitySummary :: Text -> CapabilitySyncStatus -> GatewayCapabilitySummary

-- | Contains details for a gateway that runs on IoT Greengrass. To create
--   a gateway that runs on IoT Greengrass, you must add the IoT SiteWise
--   connector to a Greengrass group and deploy it. Your Greengrass group
--   must also have permissions to upload data to IoT SiteWise. For more
--   information, see <a>Ingesting data using a gateway</a> in the <i>IoT
--   SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGreengrass</a> smart constructor.

--   find a group's ARN, see <a>ListGroups</a> and <a>GetGroup</a> in the
--   <i>IoT Greengrass API Reference</i>.
newGreengrass :: Text -> Greengrass

-- | Contains details for a gateway that runs on IoT Greengrass V2. To
--   create a gateway that runs on IoT Greengrass V2, you must deploy the

newIdentity :: Identity

-- | Contains an image that is one of the following:

--   be less than 1 MB.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically
--   encodes and decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will
--   encode to Base64 representation during -- serialisation, and decode
--   from Base64 representation during deserialisation. -- This
--   <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw unencoded data.

--   <a>$sel:type':ImageFile'</a>, <a>imageFile_type</a> - The file type of
--   the image.

-- | Contains an asset measurement property. For more information, see
--   <a>Measurements</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMeasurement</a> smart constructor.
data Measurement
Measurement' :: Maybe MeasurementProcessingConfig -> Measurement

-- | Create a value of <a>Measurement</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfig:Measurement'</a>,
--   <a>measurement_processingConfig</a> - The processing configuration for
--   the given measurement property. You can configure measurements to be
--   kept at the edge or forwarded to the Amazon Web Services Cloud. By
--   default, measurements are forwarded to the cloud.
newMeasurement :: Measurement

-- | The processing configuration for the given measurement property. You
--   can configure measurements to be kept at the edge or forwarded to the
--   Amazon Web Services Cloud. By default, measurements are forwarded to
--   the cloud.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMeasurementProcessingConfig</a> smart constructor.
data MeasurementProcessingConfig
MeasurementProcessingConfig' :: ForwardingConfig -> MeasurementProcessingConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>MeasurementProcessingConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:forwardingConfig:MeasurementProcessingConfig'</a>,
--   <a>measurementProcessingConfig_forwardingConfig</a> - The forwarding
--   configuration for the given measurement property.
newMeasurementProcessingConfig :: ForwardingConfig -> MeasurementProcessingConfig

-- | Contains an asset metric property. With metrics, you can calculate
--   aggregate functions, such as an average, maximum, or minimum, as
--   specified through an expression. A metric maps several values to a
--   single value (such as a sum).
--   
--   The maximum number of dependent/cascading variables used in any one
--   metric calculation is 10. Therefore, a <i>root</i> metric can have up
--   to 10 cascading metrics in its computational dependency tree.
--   Additionally, a metric can only have a data type of <tt>DOUBLE</tt>
--   and consume properties with data types of <tt>INTEGER</tt> or
--   <tt>DOUBLE</tt>.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Metrics</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetric</a> smart constructor.
data Metric
Metric' :: Maybe MetricProcessingConfig -> Text -> [ExpressionVariable] -> MetricWindow -> Metric

-- | Create a value of <a>Metric</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingConfig:Metric'</a>, <a>metric_processingConfig</a> -
--   The processing configuration for the given metric property. You can
--   configure metrics to be computed at the edge or in the Amazon Web
--   Services Cloud. By default, metrics are forwarded to the cloud.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expression:Metric'</a>, <a>metric_expression</a> - The
--   mathematical expression that defines the metric aggregation function.
--   You can specify up to 10 variables per expression. You can specify up
--   to 10 functions per expression.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Quotas</a> in the <i>IoT SiteWise User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:variables:Metric'</a>, <a>metric_variables</a> - The list of
--   variables used in the expression.
--   
--   <a>$sel:window:Metric'</a>, <a>metric_window</a> - The window (time
--   interval) over which IoT SiteWise computes the metric's aggregation
--   expression. IoT SiteWise computes one data point per <tt>window</tt>.
newMetric :: Text -> MetricWindow -> Metric

-- | The processing configuration for the given metric property. You can
--   configure metrics to be computed at the edge or in the Amazon Web
--   Services Cloud. By default, metrics are forwarded to the cloud.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricProcessingConfig</a> smart constructor.
data MetricProcessingConfig
MetricProcessingConfig' :: ComputeLocation -> MetricProcessingConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricProcessingConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:computeLocation:MetricProcessingConfig'</a>,
--   <a>metricProcessingConfig_computeLocation</a> - The compute location
--   for the given metric property.
newMetricProcessingConfig :: ComputeLocation -> MetricProcessingConfig

-- | Contains a time interval window used for data aggregate computations
--   (for example, average, sum, count, and so on).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricWindow</a> smart constructor.
data MetricWindow
MetricWindow' :: Maybe TumblingWindow -> MetricWindow

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricWindow</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tumbling:MetricWindow'</a>, <a>metricWindow_tumbling</a> - The
--   tumbling time interval window.
newMetricWindow :: MetricWindow

--   portal.

--   of the portal.
--

--   The URL for the IoT SiteWise Monitor portal. You can use this URL to
--   access portals that use Amazon Web Services SSO for authentication.
--   For portals that use IAM for authentication, you must use the IoT
--   SiteWise console to get a URL that you can use to access the portal.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:PortalSummary'</a>, <a>portalSummary_status</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
newPortalSummary :: Text -> Text -> Text -> PortalStatus -> PortalSummary
